loans.name: Las Doncellas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Doncellas lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras que buscan como sacar a sus familias adelante una de ellas es Blanca Ibón Solórzano OS. quien vende teléfonos desde hace dos años. En este negocio le va muy bien según comento Solórzano es por esa razón que desea ampliarlo e invertir mayor capital.

Mientras Noelia López S.  comenzó vendiendo sopa de res, mondongo, de queso, de pollo y de hueso los fines de semana con lo cual ahorro un pequeño capital e instalo una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita. La otra integrante es Irma I. quien desde hace tres años  vende prendas y perfumes.
texts.en:
The Las Doncellas Group is comprised of hardworking and enterprising women who are looking for a way to help their families get ahead. One of the members is Blanca Ibón Solórzano OS., who has been selling telephones for two years. Solórzano states that her business has been very prosperous, which is why she wants to expand it and invest more capital in it.

Meanwhile, Noelia López S. started selling beef stew, and cheese, chicken or bone mondongo (a hearty Latin American soup made of slow-cooked tripe) on weekends. She managed to save enough capital to establish a fritanga--a popular restaurant that sells fried foods.

The other group member is Irma I., who has been selling clothing and fragrances for the last three years.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase telephones, accessories, phone cards, etc.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 34 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la casa de sus suegros. Anteriormente se dedicaba a su hogar, sin embargo el sueldo de su esposo, que trabaja como cerrajero, no le daba abasto para mantener su familia. Es por eso que ayudaba a bordar a una vecina, y con el correr del tiempo y con la ayuda de su esposo, puede ella ahora realizar sus propios bordados, por lo que le fue bien este trabajo, es así que lleva cinco años, teniendo dos personas que le ayudan a bordar, pagándoles un porcentaje por su trabajo. María esta contenta con lo que hace, aplicando bordados a los polos, eso la mantiene muy ocupada,  hilando y cosiendo. Ahora con la habilidad que adquirido en estos años, puede ahora elaborar rápidamente estos bordados, dándole más ventaja en las ganancias. En el futuro, ella y su esposo, anhelan instalar una cerrajería, a la vez independizarse con su negocio, ya que espera ofrecer un mejor beneficio a sus hijos. Éste es su primer crédito con MFP, en donde se compromete a cumplir puntualmente sus pagos, puesto que desea contar con nuevos crédito mas adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar diversos colores de hilos, para que pueda terminar a tiempo los bordados que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
María is 34, married, and living with her husband and their three children in the home of her in-laws. Previously she worked in the home, but her husband's wage as a locksmith did not provide enough to support the family. This is why she helped a neighbor to embroider, and over time and with the help of her husband, now she creates her own embroideries. This work has been going well for her, over the last 5 years, with two persons helping with the embroidery, paying them a percentage for their work. María is happy with what she does, embroidering polo shirts, which keeps her very busy threading and sewing. Now, with the abilities she has acquired in these years, she can rapidly create these embroideries, giving her an advantage in her earnings. In the future, she and her husband hope to install a locksmith shop, becoming independent businesspersons, hoping to provide greater advantages to their children. This is her first loan through MFP; she commits herself to punctual payments, since she hopes to have additional credit in the future. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy various colors of thread, so she can complete her current embroidery projects in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase embroidery thread

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Mrs. Sreymom H., 42 years old, lives in Chrak Chi Koam village in Takeo Province where she owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is also a rice middleperson earning a small additional income.  A widow with two children who are students in the local school, Sreymom is now requesting a loan to add to her savings to replace an old motorbike and to buy more rice to enlarge her business activities.

loans.use: To replace her old motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr: Monsieur Yaya B. est une commerçant qui exploite de l'huile de palme venu de la casamance sa region natale situé au sud du Sénégal pour être revendu dans le marché mbourois .Il est a son second crédit ainsi celui ci va entrer dans le renforcement de ses activités pour générer davantages de profit ce qui lui permettrait de nourrire sa famille et de s'occuper de l'éducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Mr. Yaya B. is a retailer who trades on palm oil from Casamance, his native region located in the south of Senegal to be retailed in the Mbour market. He is on his second credit which will go into strengthening his business to generate more profit which would enable him to feed his family and to take care of the education of his children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch B., a 57-year-old farmer, lives in Smaong village in Takeo Province where she owns 1.50 hectares of land upon which she cultivates rice and also breeds pigs. Both businesses provide a small income that helps to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Saroeun Preap, is a police officer.

Touch is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pay for the rental of a water machine and farm labor, and to buy piglets and pig food for pig breeding. This couple has two children; one is a driver, while the other works at a casino.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, to pay for rental of a water machine and farm labor, and to buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Edison Stalin

texts.es:
Edison de 34 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil. El trabajaba en una empresa pero como lo despidieron tuvo que consegir otro medio de ingresos compror un reprodcutor de Cd y empezar ha hacer musica en su computadora y empezar a venderlos. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicacion ha sido la reproduccion de cd de musica su ingreso principal, comprar los formatos de cd basios a $ 0.40 y cuando ya ha grabado la musica los vende a $ 1.00 (en Ecuador es comun que se venda cd de cantantes a tan bajo costo).  Para vender los cd tiene que recorrer las calles de Guayaquil y venderlos como comerciante informal. 

El quiere tener un local para vender los cd de musica y quiere adecuar un local necesita comprar con el prestamo cemento, pinturas, bloques para el local que siempre a querido. En el futuro quiere tener sucrusales de su puesto de venta de cd de musica y asi asegurar el futuo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Edison is 34 years old and lives in the peri-urban area of Guayaquil. He was employed with a company, but since losing his job has had to find another way to make money. He bought a CD burner and created music CDs on his computer in order to sell them. With a lot of work, reproducing music CDs has gradually become his main source of income. Edison buys blank CDs for $.40, records music onto them and then sells them for $1.00 (in Ecuador it is common for artist's music to be sold at such a low price). Edison walks the streets of Guayaquil as an informal merchant in order to sell the CDs. Edision plans to use the loan to buy paint, cinder blocks and cement in order to sell CDs at a permanent location, like he has always wanted to do. In the future, he would like to expand his music CD business into new locations and in that way be able to secure a future for parents.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement, cinder blocks and paint

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie L. is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Talisay, Sta. Fe Cebu City. She earns her living by buying and selling of coconuts and also by pig fattening.

Rosemarie’s 45-year-old husband, Victor, is a farmer; the couple has 6 children.  One of their children has a family to raise already while the other 5 are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Rosemarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by buying and selling coconuts as well as pig fattening. Now she earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her businesses.

Rosemarie is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP was used to fund operations of her coconut business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 11th cycle loan, in the amount of 11,000 PHP, which she intends to use for both the coconut and pig-fattening businesses. Rosemarie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Polatala

texts.en:
Polatala N. is 30 years old and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture, selling lavalavas (bottom-half. wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  Polatala has 3 years of experience in this business.  Polatala needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Polatala joined SPBD. This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Polatala's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Braulio Manuel

texts.es: Braulio Manuel tiene 30 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ropa nueva pues siempre está pendiente de entregar a sus clientes los pedidos que le realizan, el vende su ropa de manera ambulante y en su vivienda. El viaja hasta Managua para realizar las compras de sus productos a precios más favorables por lo que sus clientes siempre le están solicitando una gran variedad de mercadería. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de pantalones, camisetas, ropa interior y sabanas. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es seguir con este negocio e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Braulio Manuel is 30 years old. He buys and sells new clothing and always makes sure to deliver his customers’ orders to them. He sells his items on foot as well as out of his home. He travels to Managua to buy his products at favorable prices because his customers are constantly requesting a variety of merchandise. He is asking for this loan in order to invest in pants, shirts, undergarments, and sheets. He feels that this loan will give him the opportunity to get ahead. He hopes to be able to continue this business and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Essotina

texts.en: Monsieur Essotina T., age 25, works from his home selling school supplies and clothing. He has been in this business for the last five years. In order to prepare for the upcoming school year, Monsieur T. is planning to purchase five boxes of various school supplies - notebooks, pens, school books, and other items - that university students and secondary school students will buy as they prepare to go back to school for the year. To this end, Essotina has requested a loan of 400,000 CFA to help him purchase school supplies. This is his first time requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies for sale

loans.name: Crane Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth A., who is in her early forties, is married and has a daughter of 17.  She has a retail shop and has been selling different types of liquid soap since 2007.   She works from 6am to 10pm daily and she is able to make a monthly profit of about US$ 53.

This will be Elizabeth’s 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to open the retail shop and to purchase a small piece of land. She has successfully paid back her loan.  She will use the current loan to build her house foundation.

Elizabeth will share this loan with her loan group, Crane, which totals 21 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 
	
In the picture, Elizabeth is in the front row holding her product in her hands.

loans.use: To build a house foundation

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald M., from the village of Brgy. Calaocan, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya, is 23 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Ronald owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in his business for over five years, he earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ronald joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting his first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, Ronald plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel se dedica al destace de cerdo. Hace más de 17 años que inicio este negocio, y por medio de su esposo quien le ayudo a dedicarse a este negocio. Es una persona que tiene mucha experiencia con créditos, por lo que no ha sido la primera vez. Tiene 1 hijo menor de 6 años que está a su cargo  ella se levanta temprano pues sabe que la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a buscar sus productos. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como cerdos ya que tiene muy buenas ofertas. Sueña con obtener más capital de trabajo para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is dedicated to gutting pigs. For more than 17 years she has been working in this business, through her husband who helped her get started in this business. She has a lot of experience with credits, so this is not the first time. She has a 6 year old son who she takes care of. She wakes up early since she knows that the majority of her customers arrive early to ask for her products. This credit is to purchase raw material such as pigs since she has a lot of great offers. She dreams of obtaining more working capital to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a large quantity of glasses and sunglasses

loans.name: Julio Jose

texts.es: Julio José tiene 38 años, su actividad es la elaboración de artesanía. Hace más de 14 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy satisfactorio para él y su familia, el tiene 2 hijo a su cargo ya que es un padre muy responsable y se preocupa por proporcionarle los ingresos necesarios. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para mejorar su negocio. El cuenta con su propio taller elaborando los diferentes productos como hoyas, vasijas, adornos, floreros y tinajas. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en: Julio José is 38 years old.  His business is making handicrafts.  He has been in this business for more than 14 years and it has been very rewarding for him and his family.  He has 2 children in his care since he is a very responsible father and he worries about making enough income for them.  This is not the first time that he has taken loans to improve his business.  He has his own workshop where he makes his products such as basins, earthenware pots, ornaments, vases and large earthenware jars.  This is why he is requesting this loan, to buy raw materials to make his products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nona's Group

texts.en:
Nona M. is from the village of Santa Rosa, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 36 years old. Nona is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nona is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nona prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $58 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nona joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.    Esther has a hotel business, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Esther hopes to become a doctor.  Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by protect herself from diseases.

loans.use: food.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has been operating a food selling stall for the last seven years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanasiti faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season, the business is very low compared to the hot summer season. She hopes to own a big restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials to sell. She decided to join Yehu because it has few legal formalities.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials to sell

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia H. is a 47-year old widow who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Hillside, Daanbantayan, Cebu, and she has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007. Combined with her individual efforts, Vergenia has improved her living conditions with the help of the loans from NWTF. By working hard in her general store she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5000. 

Vergenia is borrowing PHP 25000 so she can purchase more inventory for her general store, and this will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP18000 was paid off well within its term, and it was another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Vergenia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Maria Eloisa

texts.es:
María tiene 60 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. con su esposo y sus 2 menores hijos en el distrito D. Chulucanas, que pertenece a la región Piura, a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del departamento D. Lambayeque. 

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades relacionadas con la crianza y venta D. animales. Ella cría ganado ovino y aves D. corral en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, teniendo a la fecha 15 pavos y 10 gallinas, los engorda alimentándoles D. pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general  y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. resiD.. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

María desea comprar alimento balanceado para engordar a sus animales, y una vez que estén desarrollados venderlos y así obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan seguir progresando y ayudando a su familia a salir adelante. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is 60 years old, married and lives with her husband and her 2 youngest children in Chulucanas district, which is part of the Piura region, 4 hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque.

She works in activities related to raising and selling animals. She raises sheep and poultry in some pens near her home and right now has 15 turkeys and 10 chickens. She fattens them by feeding them natural grasses, and when they have reached a good level of development she sells them to the general public and to traders who visit the area where she lives. This activity allows her to help her husband with the family´s finances.

María would like to buy nutritious feed for fattening the animals, and once they are grown, sell them and in this way get higher profits. This will enable her to continue progressing and helping her family cope. To reach this objective she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles.

loans.use: Buy nutritious feed for her animals.

loans.name: Otoniel Antonio

texts.es:
Para  Otoniel  V., hombre de 55 años habitante de las Nieves de Barranquilla, barrio popular y carnavalero, la ornamentación ha sido el pan de cada día en su medio, porque conoce esta actividad hace 20 años  ya que es  de tradición familiar. Así fue como al quedarse sin empleo recurrió a lo que ha sido su máxima experiencia  “la ornamentación”, especializándose en    herrajes entre cerrojos y bisagras para puertas metálicas, portones, puertas de garaje y reja. Aunque  tiene entre sus maquinarias y equipos  soldador de punta, troqueles, maquinas de soldar, cisalla, prensa, congelador y herramientas varias, su meta principal es industrializar su actividad y generar empleos, pero la falta de capital es su gran desafío  y por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a tramitar su Credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento y el cual invertirá en la adecuación de sus máquinas troqueladoras  con lo cual será mas eficiente ya que le ahorraría tiempo y dinero. 
Otoniel se muestra como un hombre disciplinado en su trabajo y cada día busca el perfeccionamiento de su saber empírico, por eso tiene muchos sueños con su empresa y sabe que los va a cumplir gracias a todos sus esfuerzos y al apoyo de las organizaciones que  en su gestión  le dan la mano, como la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y Kiva. Mientras tanto maneja los siguientes indicadores financieros:   Margen de Utilidad Bruta 89.19%,	margen de utilidad operativa 57.06%, margen de Utilidad Neta  47.06%, rentabilidad sobre las ventas  87%. En su negocio  Otoniel elabora y vende sus productos en ferreterías de la ciudad de Barranquilla,  tiene un empleado fijo, que trabajan por producción durante todo el año, en el sector, área de acción de su negocio no hay   competencia y por lo general venden sus productos sobre pedidos, Su fortaleza es que  cuenta con excelentes estados financieros , con un nivel de inversión bajo para la elaboración de sus productos , y su capacidad de pago es muy buena y suficiente para cubrir el valor de la cuota que le corresponde. Sus índices son muy buenos, con cero endeudamiento y una rentabilidad alta sobre el total de ventas y esto pronostica que su inversión sea exitosa al igual que su recuperación.
texts.en:
For 55 year old Otoniel V., resident of Nieves de Barranquilla, a popular carnival neighborhood, decorative gates and doors have been his daily bread.  He knows this business.  He’s been doing it for 20 years and it has become a family tradition.  He started doing what he knew best, “decorating,” when he became unemployed.  He specializes in fittings between locks and hinges for metal doors, gates, garage doors, and grilles.  Even though he has a variety of welding equipment and tools, his main goal is to industrialize his business and create jobs.  His great challenge is the lack of working capital, so he has seen fit to approach Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan.  This will be his first and he will invest the money in punching machines, which will make him more efficient, saving him time and money.

Otoniel has proven to be well disciplined in his work and seeks more knowledge each day.  This is why he has many dreams about his company, and he knows that he will fulfill them, thanks to his efforts and support from groups, such as Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva, who help him with management.  He maintains the following: Gross revenue 89.19%, operating margin 57.06%, net revenue 47.06%, and profits from sales 87%.

Otoniel makes and sells his products in hardware stores around the city of Barranquilla.  He has steady employees who work year round and there is no competition in the area where his business is located.  They manufacture most of their products to order.  His strength is that he has an excellent financial position and each product requires a low investment to produce.  His ability to pay is good and enough to cover his payments.  His indexes are very good and his high overall profits from his total sales lead us to believe that his investment will prove successful and he will recover it.

loans.use: Punching machines

loans.name: Arnelito

texts.en:
Arnelito W. is from the village of Salvador, Rogongon, Iligan City. He is 42 years old. Arnelito is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Arnelito owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Arnelito has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arnelito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnelito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Arnelito is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Arnelito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

location.town: Rogongon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Tierra Fertil (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tierra fértil está conformado por un grupo de 11 mujeres y 3 hombres quienes laboran en diferentes actividades en su comunidad o en la ciudad, las que les permiten crecer economícamente y salir adelante con sus familias. Viven por la parroquia del Valle, en esta parroquia se puede admirar hermosos paisajes de la naturaleza, su gente es amable y cordial quienes se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señora. Jeannette Pilatuña vive por la comunidad de Cochapamba en la parroquia del Valle, se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta porque en él tiene muy buenas amigas. Nuestra socia trabaja como empleada privada en una clínica de la ciudad ya que es enfermera, actividad en la que labora hace 5 años y trabaja en turnos rotativos. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes.
Doña Jeannette tiene 31 años de edad es soltera y tiene una hija de 7 años de edad que  estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo vive en casa de un familiar. 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en el arreglo del galpón para sus cuyes. Su meta es darle a su hija una buena educación para que ella pueda salir  adelante.

La Señora. Mónica C. vive por la comunidad de Cochapamba en la parroquia del Valle, tiene 34 años, es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 17 años de edad, su primera hija vive con su papá y su segundo hijo quien es discapacitado vive en su casa y estudia en una escuelita para niños especiales. Con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.
Doña Mónica se dedica al comercio, vende cosméticos de la marca Yanbal, esta actividad la realiza sin un horario y hace 5 años. También tiene una tienda en su casa hace 6 años y en ella trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su prima, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para la tienda y así tener un mejor surtido para su clientela. Su meta es  agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Tierra Fértil” (Fertile Land) is a group that consists of eleven women and three men who work in different businesses within their community or in the city. This enables them to grow financially and move their families forward. The members live in the parish of El Valle, which is admired for its beautiful natural landscapes and the friendly cordial people who engage in trade, livestock breeding, and agriculture.

Sra. Jeannette Pilatuña lives in the community of Cochapamba in the parish of El Valle. She is receiving her fifth loan from the Communal Bank. Jeannette enjoys being a member because she has made many good friends. She has worked for a private clinic in the city as a nurse for five years. Jeannette works in rotating shifts and also raises guinea pigs from her home.

Doña Jeannette is 31 years old, single, and has a seven year old daughter who attends school in the city. She does not have a house of her own, so she lives at the home of a relative. The money from her loan will be invested in repairs to the pen where she keeps her guinea pigs. Her goal is to give her daughter a good education so that she can get ahead.

Sra. Mónica C. lives in the community of Cochapamba in the parish of El Valle. She is 34 years old, divorced, and has two children (ages 18 and 17). Her first child, a daughter, lives with her father while her second child, a son, lives with her at home since he is disabled. He attends a school for special needs children. Through her work, Mónica was able to build her own home.

Doña Mónica is a merchant who sells cosmetics from the Yanbal line. She has worked in this business without a set schedule for five years. In addition, she has a store in her home that she managed for six years. She works in this business Sunday to Sunday from 8am to 8pm. This is the first loan she has received from the Communal Bank and she was invited by her cousin. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of more products for her store so that she can have a better inventory for her customers. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: Make repairs to a guinea pig pen

loans.name: Ebtisam

texts.ar: ابتسام في عمر 36 سنة تعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية والمشروبات والخردوات لها في عملها 10 سنوات متزوجة ولها ثلاث اولاد تحب عملها وهي تعتمد على نفسها في تربية اولادها في الانفاق عليهم تريد ان تؤمن مستقبل جيد لها ولعائلتها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء كارت لخطوط الهواتف النقالة لكي يصبح عندها مدخول اضافي لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وكانت تتلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة وهي نشيطة ومثابرة وتحب العمل والاعتماد على الذات
texts.en: Ebtisam is 36 years old and works in a grocery store selling food and drink items and vegetables. She has 10 years experience in this. She is married and has three children. She loves her work and independently raises and provides for her three children. She wants to secure a good future for herself and her family. With this loan she wants to purchase mobile phone credits to sell so that she has some additional income. She has good credit history with Al Majmoua and has full support from her family. She is enthusiastic, persistent and loves her business and being independent.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone credits to sell.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a young man from Jineen.  Bassam lives with his family and helps, together with his brother, to take care of the family. He took out a loan from FATEN to purchase home appliances that they need to replace their old stove and washing machine.

Bassam is photographed in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Jenin.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances.

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja O. lives in Imereti Region, village Persati. He is 50 years old and lives with his wife. The only source of income of the family comes from agricultural activities: they own five milk cows and produce cheese, which is sold on the local market. They also grow strawberries on a 300 sq meter plot of land. They harvest on average 100 kg of strawberries per year and sell them on the local market. 

The family also runs a bee-keeping business: they own 35 bee-hives and bee colonies. 300 liters of honey are gathered and sold annually. With the requested amount Elguja will purchase the following items:  parts for bee-hives frames, equipment for production of beeswax, and some joiner’s (carpentry) equipment.  

Due to this investment, Elguja will be able to reduce his production costs for the wax plates by 30% and the cost of production of the bee-colonies by 50%. This will positively influence family income. With the increased income Elguja will purchase additional bee-colonies and expand the family’s business.

loans.use: to purchase parts for bee-hive frames, equipment for production of beeswax, and some joiner’s equipment.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 30 years old and married to Beatrice. They have two children who are 4 years old and 7 months old.  Stephen owns a shop in Ndurio trading centre in Kapsabet town and has been in the business for a period of three years. He earns an income of KES 10,000 monthly.

He has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. This is his first loan and he hopes to use the money to purchase sugar, wheat flour, and cooking oil. 

The profits will be used to increase the stock for the business. He hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, wheat flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Gerphas

texts.en: Gerphas is a 41-year-old man who is married and has two children.  He repairs vehicles to earn a living.  He has been in the business for six years.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has gained knowledge of business management.  This has helped him to grow his business.  He hopes to open other outlets of his business and employ more people.  He has requested 20,000 KES to buy auto spare parts.

loans.use: To buy auto spare parts

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old and blessed with only one school-aged child.

Marife owns and operates a “sari-sari” (retail) store. She has been engaged in her business for 18 years since she married her husband. She earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In July 2009, Marife joined Paglaum MPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Marife is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products to sell and to buy housing materials for her house improvement. This will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy housing materials for house improvement.

loans.name: Shakar's Group

texts.en:
Shakar, 47, is the leader of this group. She resides in the town of Nookat, known for its agricultural products of a high quality and taste. It’s been ten years since she got involved in agriculture, following the example of most of her friends. Land feeds all residents of this town, therefore every resident is thankful for being born in a land with such rich soil and good climate. Shakar is a widow, however she has given a worthy life to all of her three kids, two of whom already have their own businesses. For ten years Shakar has been saving and gradually expanding the size of the land she owns. At this moment her piece of land is one of the largest in the neighborhood. This means that she cultivates a bigger amount of agricultural products and she needs more inputs such as water and fertilizers.  The initial capital of 1500 soms used ten years ago allowed Shakar to grow only one type of product, unlike now when Shakar grows a wide variety of products. However Shakar isn’t always capable of covering  all her costs, especially fertilizers. For such big land and wide range of products, Shakar needs a large amount of different types of fertilizers. With this purpose she is applying  for a loan from Kiva.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for farming

loans.name: Maria Milagro De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, es soltera, vive con su madre y un hermano,  ella realiza ventas de pupusas desde hace 10 años, este negocio lo heredo de su madre, hasta el momento ha ganado experiencia, sus clientes son vecinos y amigos cercanos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar chicharrón, quesillo, aceite, condimentos y bebidas, para el negocio, ya que por el momento no tiene un buen inventario de productos.
Para María, el objetivo primordial es mejorar su negocio, su calidad de vida, vivir con una mejor solvencia económica junto a su familia.
texts.en:
María is single and lives with her mother and brother.  She has been selling pupusas for 10 years. She inherited this business from her mother, and from that moment has gained experience.  Her customers are neighbors and close friends.

She is requesting a loan to buy fried pork rinds, cheese, oil, condiments and beverages for her business, because at the moment she does not have a good inventory of products.  For María, her primary objective is to improve her business and quality of life, and to live with better economic solvency with her family.

loans.use: to buy fried pork rinds, cheese, oil, condiments and beverages.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 42 years old and lives in Plaridel. She is married and has six children. 

Elvie works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for four years. 

Elvie has been a member of PMPC for six years. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LA UNION DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 57 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte turismo y también el socio es propietario de un hotel, el socio es chofer de turismo y lleva a diferentes turistas a lugares como Pisaq, Machupicchu, Calca y Urubamba, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere implementar el hotel y mejorar el negocio de turismo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su carro y comprar sabanas y camas para el negocio de hotel.
                                               
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "La Union de Ollantaytambo". It is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, and it belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. 

He is 57 years old, married common-law, and he has one son. He alternates his daily activities with his business of tourism transportation and he is also the owner of a hotel. He is a tourism driver and he takes tourists to different places such as Pisaq, Machupicchu, Calca, and Urubamba. It is through these businesses that he is able to support his children. He wants furnish his hotel and he wants to improve his tourism business. He requests a loan to purchase spare parts for his car and to purchase bed sheets for his hotel business.

He is happy for this loan and he is committed to making his loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car and to purchase bed sheets for his hotel business.

loans.name: Jane Albania

texts.es:
Jane es una mujer madre de 4 hijos oriunda de Santo Domingo. Vive con sus dos hijos menores, José y Antony de 16 y 4 años de edad en la parroquia "La Libertad". 

Desde hace 8 años, por recomendación de sus amistades empezó su negocio de venta de calzado puerta a puerta. Empezó vendiendo a familiares y amigos y hoy su cartera de clientes se ha incrementado. Vende calzado de hombre y de mujer. Pasó por una crisis económica un poco difícil de superar pero gracias a su gran esfuerzo ha logrado sobreponerse. Hoy en día ella con mucha visión quiere invertir en calzado de mujer y para ello acudió a Fundación Alternativa en busca de un crédito que le permita seguir trabajando. Es su primer crédito en esta institución, el asesor de crédito al realizar la evaluación de su negocio vio en Jane una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y visionaria.

Jane espera incrementar su negocio para así dar una mejor vida a sus hijos y verlos profesionales.
texts.en:
Jane is originally from Santo Domingo and the mother of four.  She lives with her two youngest children, José and Antony, ages 16 and 4, in the “La Libertad” parish.

Eight years ago, with the recommendation of her friends, she started selling shoes door to door.  She began selling to family and friends, but now her customer base has increased and sells men’s and women’s shoes.  She went though a financial crisis that was a bit difficult to get through, but thanks to her effort she was able to do so.  Now she has a great vision and wants to invest in more shoes, so she approached Fundación Alternativa for a loan that will allow her to continue her work.  This will be her first loan through this institution.  The loan officer, after evaluating her business, saw Jane as a hard working entrepreneur with vision.

Jane expects to grow her business in order to give her children a better life and see them establish professional careers.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her business.

loans.name: Usaha Jaya 15 Group

texts.en:
Siti is 42 years old, has two children and lives in Cilincing. She is one of the group’s entrepreneurs and sells adult’s and children’s clothes on credit.

Since 2006 Siti has sold clothes from her house and around the neighborhood. With earnings from this business she has helped her husband to pay for her children’s school fees.

This is will be Siti’s second loan through VisionFund Indonesia. She is asking for 2,000,000 IDR to buy more clothes to sell. In the future she hopes she can open a kiosk in Pasar Koja and go on a pilgrimage.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Todo Lo Puedo En Cristo Group

texts.es:
Fue hace 5 años que la Sra. Ofelia empezó el  sueño del negocio propio ella se inicio viajando a la ciudad D. Trujillo ubicado al norte del Perú donD. el calzado es bueno y barato, ella compraba los zapatos a bajo costo y  los vendía en la ciudad donD. el precio es mas elevado esto le permitía tener mas ganancias fue así que  su negocio fue creciendo y  pudo juntar algo D. dinero para comprarse un puesto D. venta en una galería D. su sector, donD. actualmente tiene su boutique que tiene por nombre “DETALLES” ahora no solo venD. zapatos sino toda clase D. productos como ropas y accesoR. para mujer, su negocio es completo D. manera que sus ingresos le permiten ayudar  a sus hijos en los estudios algo que para la Sra. Ofelia es elemental ya que desea que sus hijos sean profesionales ellos  también ayudan atendiendo en el negocio  , el dinero D. su préstamo lo usara para seguir invirtiendo e su tienda comprara  regalos , ropa y accesoR. para ofrecer a su clientela, el grupo al cual pertenece se llama “TODO LO PUEDO EN CRISTO” son 07 socias amigas y vecinas del mismo lugar.

   * La Sra Ofelia es la cuarta D. la derecha viste chompa color crema.
texts.en:
Five years ago, Sra. Ofelia began her dream of having her own business. She started traveling to the city of Trujillo in northern Peru, where the shoes are cheap and of good quality. By purchasing shoes at low cost, Ofelia was able to sell them in her city at a higher price. This allowed her to generate more income. As a result, her business grew and she was able to use some of her money to buy a vending space at a shopping center in her neighborhood where she currently has a boutique called “Details”. Not only does she sell shoes, but Ofelia also offers all types of products such as clothing and women’s accessories. Her business is complete and helps her to generate revenue so that she can help her children with their studies. This is important to Ofelia because she wants them to become professionals. Her children also help with managing her business.

The money from her loan will be used to continue investing in her store. She plans to buy gifts, clothing, and accessories to offer to her customers. The group that she belongs to is called “Todo Lo Puedo En Cristo” (I Can Do All Things Through Christ), which consists of seven members who are friends and neighbors from the same area.

*Sra. Ofelia is standing fourth from the right, wearing a cream-colored sweater.

loans.use: to buy gifts, clothing, and accessories.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Ii -Chilca Group

texts.es: Ana  de 21 años de edad, soltera, mujer luchadora, empeñosa  es una de la socias que conforman la nueva Alcancía comunal Las Triunfadoras II Chilca, por el momento Ana  estudia  una carrera profesional y a la vez trabaja  ofreciendo los productos a sus amistades ,y también gracias  a sus padres que diariamente le apoyen en sus estudios para  que así  salgue adelante por sí misma .Solicita este préstamo para poder comprar  más  productos que se encuentren en oferta ,para así poder venderlos a un precio cómodo y a la vez poder incrementar su  capital .La socia desea para el futuro lograr terminar  su carrera profesional y ser una  mayorista en cuanto a sus productos .En la foto Ana viste una chompa color celeste y pantalón jeans, se encuentra ubicada a lado derecho de la socia que viste  una chompa color verde. Ana  al igual que  todos los socios de esta alcancía comunal están muy agradecidos por  el préstamo brindado.
texts.en:
Ana, 21, is a single, tenacious, dedicated woman.  She’s one of the members of the “Las Triunfadoras II Chilca” (Chilca Victorious Ones II) communal bank.  At present, Ana is studying a professional career but at the same time works selling products to her acquaintances and, thanks to support from her parents, who daily provide for her studies, is working towards becoming independent.  

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy more products that are on special promotion or on sale to sell them at an affordable price and increase her capital.  She hopes in future to complete her professional training and become a wholesaler of her products.

In the photo, Ana is wearing a sky blue sweater and jeans; she’s located to the right of the member wearing a green sweater.  Ana, like all the other members of this communal bank, is very grateful for the loan granted.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Segundo Jasmany

texts.es:
Segundo Jasmany tiene 28 años, es Soltero vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y poder adquirir los abonos , fertilizantes, urea para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. 

Su sueño es salir adelante y tener un negocio propio para no depender de ninguna otra persona..

En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el futbol.
texts.en:
Segundo Jasmany is 28 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. He does not have any children. 

The SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS communal bank is located in Amarillos, in the Ventanas canton. 
The members of this communal bank work in farming with short-cycle crops like corn and rice. 

Segundo farms corn and rice. He buys his products at the Murillo market and he sells his crops at the same market. 

He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and different types of fertilizers for his crops.  The help from the loan would help him economically so he can take care of his needs. He faces challenges in his work like plagues, diseases and the variations in the climate. 

His dream is to get ahead and to have his own business so he does not have to depend on anyone else.

In his free time, he likes to play sports and especially he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: buy seeds and different types of fertilizers.

loans.name: Sonagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SONAGNON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Amina, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Amina est âgée de 54 ans et est mariée à Jean, un maçon. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Amina assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes du ménage. Amina n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Amina vend des tissus de façon ambulante, depuis près de cinq ans. Amina achète ses tissus au Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Amina n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigence. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Amina et les autres membres du groupe SONAGNON sollicitent ensemble un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus précédemment ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The SONAGNON group has three members who all live in the same neighborhood.  The group's representative is called Amina (she is the lady raising her hand in the photo).  This is the fourth time that this group has requested the financial support of ALIDé in order to expand their businesses.

Amina is 54 years old and married to Jean, a builder.  The couple have two children who are both in school and their responsibility.  Amina and her husband jointly cover their household expenses.  Amina did not attend school.  In order to cover her various expenses, Amina has been selling fabric as a street vendor for nearly five years.  She buys her fabric in Benin.

Amina's customer demand is increasing but, bearing in mind her limited means, she is no longer able to properly meet this demand.  Owing to the fact that they have limited capital, Amina and the other members of the SONAGNON group are together requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.  They have fully repaid their previous loans.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and lives in Pines, Oroquieta. She is married with 5 children. 
Josephine has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 
Josephine has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Josephine hopes to have a fishing boat to help meet their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Solomon.  He is married to a businesswoman and has four children aged 18, 15, 12 and 10 years; all are school-going children.  He has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she is his younger sister's daughter, who came to live with him to attend school as his sister is living in the village. 

 In 1992, Solomon established his essential drugs business.  Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,300,000 every month from this business.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. 

Solomon has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and he now requires a new loan in order to purchase - Caf D - 5 cartons @ Le200,000, Glucose powder - 4 cartons @ le250,000, Dexorange - 4 cartons @ Le200,000, Septrin Syrup - 2 cartons @ Le200,000, Is Cof S - 2 cartons @ Le200,000 and Vitamin Syrups - 2 cartons @ Le200,000.   He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  

In the future, Solomon plans to build a house, open another drug store and educate his children very well.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase - Caf D - 5 cartons @ Le200,000, Glucose powder - 4 cartons @ le250,000, Dexorange - 4 cartons @ Le200,000, Septrine Syrup - 2 cartons @ Le200,000, Is Cof S - 2 cartons @ Le200,000 and Vitamin Syrups - 2 cartons @ Le200,000.

loans.name: Mauricio Armando

texts.es: Mauricio, nuevamente necesita otro crédito, porque quiere mejorar su negocio y por eso necesita comprar materiales para la elaboración de pan francés como: un cilindro para hacer francés, harina, azúcar y gas, el objetivo de él es tener lo suficiente material y herramientas para mejorar la produccion y para atender la demanda de clientes que tiene, los créditos anteriores le ayudaron a crecer en sus ganancias, esto le ayudo a mejorar lo económico en su familia mejorando las condiciones que antes tenían.
texts.en: Mauricio once again needs another loan because he wants to improve his business and needs to buy supplies to make French bread like a cylinder to make French baguettes, flour, sugar and gas.  His goal is to have sufficient ingredients and equipment to improve production and meet the demand he has.  Previous loans helped him to increase profits which helped him improve his family economically improving the conditions they used to have.

loans.use: to buy a cylinder to make French baguettes, flour, sugar and gas.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 25 years old, and single. He runs a tailoring shop where he makes dresses and sells to his customers. The business has been in operation for the last seven years, with an income of KES 10,000, a month.

Jonathan has never borrowed from any other MFI. This will be his fourth loan. He is applying for KES 50,000. He will use KES 20,000 to buy cloth, and KES 30,000 to cultivate land for planting crops.  

With his profits, he plans to constructs a building for business use. He hopes to grow his business, and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy cloth and to cultivate land.

loans.name: Jaques

texts.en: Jaques is 35 years old and married to a nurse. For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling food and milk to his customers. He is applying for a loan to buy a cow and more food to sell. He plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to set aside some savings and buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materiales necesarios para la fontanería, como lo son tubos, pegamentos, camisas, codos, y demás accesorios; el después de haber tenido una buena experiencia con los préstamos, se decidió por este y espera que le ayude de igual manera, para mejorar su servicio de fontaneria a los clientes, generando para su familia más ingresos.
texts.en: Miguel is requesting a new loan to buy supplies necessary for his work as a plumber, such as pipes, glue, casing, elbow bends, and other accessories. Having had a good experience with previous loans, Miguel decided to do this and expects it to help him in the same manner, improving his plumbing services for his customers, and generating more income for his family.

loans.use: buy pipes, glue, casing, and plastic elbows for his plumbing work.

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es: Maritza es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Gotitas de Amor” grupo conformado por 12 personas dedicadas a diversas actividades comerciales. Maritza tiene 44 años de edad es casada y tiene 04 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 02 de ellos ya que están en etapa escolar, ella cuenta  con un negocio la cual trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo en la elaboración de joyas donde llevan más de 03 años, este negocio nació a raíz que su esposo había aprendió las técnicas para elaborar joyas, ya que trabajaba ayudando a dichas elaboraciones, pues con los deseos de contar con un negocio propio iniciaron, actualmente importan sus productos a distintas provincias del Perú, gracias a  su negocio a podido mejorar su vivienda y brindarles educación a sus hijos. A futuro a Maritza le gustaría instalar en su vivienda una bodega donde ofrezca productos de primera necesidad. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando plata por mayor  y así poder entregar sus pedidos a tiempo. La Alcancía Comunal “Gotitas de Amor” están muy agradecidos con el crédito brindado.  María, Elsa y Elide  no pudieron estar presentes por motivo de trabajo,  adjuntamos la fotografía de Isabel.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the "Gotitas de Amor" ["Little Drops of Love"] Communal Bank. The Bank's 12 members have various jobs. Maritza is 44, married, and has four children, two of whom she still supports as they are school-aged. She has a business where she works with her husband, making jewellery. They have been doing this for over three years. They were able to start this business because her husband learned jewellery-making techniques in a previous job. They wanted to have their own business, and now they import their products from all over Peru. Thanks to this business they have been able to improve their home and offer their children an education. In the future, Maritza would like to open a store in their home in order to sell basic staples. She requested this loan for investing in her business, buying silver wholesale in order to complete their orders on time. The "Gotitas de Amor" Communal Bank members are grateful for this loan.
María, Elsa and Elide were not able to be present because of work commitments. Isabel's photo has been inserted.

loans.use: to buy silver.

loans.name: Genna

texts.en:
Genna, is married and has six children. Genna is 46 years old, residing at Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Genna owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of office and school supplies to earn a living and she's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP. 

She requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. 

In 2010, Genna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials to continue putting up concrete walls at the front of her home

loans.name: Paulina

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de duas filha que frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais uma neta que vive com ela. 	
É negociante e dona do negócio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, sumos, massa, óleo, capulanas e sapatos) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja concluir da sua casa e mobilar para oferecer conforto a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a instabilidade do negócio e o elevado custo de vida.
texts.en: Paulina is a window the mother of two daughters who go to school.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports a granddaughter that lives with her.  She has her own business selling various products.  With her current loan, she will buy products (rice, juice, dough, butter, capulanas [a garment worn in Mozambique], and shoes) to increase her quantity of merchandise.  In the future, she hopes to finish her home and to furnish it to offer comfort to her family.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is the instability of her business and the elevated cost of living.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (rice, juice, dough, butter, capulanas, and shoes).

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en:
Bayarjargal is a 36-year-old married woman who has two daughters. She lives with her family in an outer ger district that lacks the basic infrastructure of central Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. She works as a tester while her spouse runs a taxi service; both of their daughters attend local secondary schools. 

Bayarjargal is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials in order to finish renovation work on her family’s current house, which is old, unsafe, and small. Also, she will use the loan to build a garage to protect her car from the very cold winter season, which is very bad for cars.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish her home renovation.

loans.name: Indra Karina

texts.es:
Indra es una mujer de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de refrescos y golosinas.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Pura pura’ que se encuentra en la parte norte de la ciudad colindando con el Bosquecillo, la extensión verde más grande la ciudad. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados.
Indra es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto a la altura de los hombros, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia para el comercio habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas y refrescos en su kiosco, ella se dedica al comercio minorista de golosinas, como; galletas, chocolates, dulces, chicles y refrescos, gaseosas, etc. “gracias a mi madre pude obtener este kiosco, trabajamos con mi pareja que se encarga de las compras para surtir el kiosco y trabaja en otro rubro…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son continuas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para compra de un frigo bar  y un mostrador para mejorar sus ingresos. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo, Ella desea realizar la compra de un frigo bar  y un mostrador para su negocio para mejorar la atención al cliente. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera continua. 
Es por esos motivos que Indra solicita un préstamo para la compra de un frigo bar  y un mostrador para su negocio para mejorar la atención al cliente.
texts.en:
Indra is a 24 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has a 3 year old son. She sells refreshments and snacks.

She is a good mother, independent, entrepreneurial, consistent, responsible and very hard working. She works in the area called ‘Pura Pura’ which is located in the northern part of the city bordering Bosquecillo, the greenest part of the city. It has a cold, dry climate with temperatures during the day varying between 1 and 12 Celsius. 

Indra has a dark complexion, with brown eyes and black, shoulder length hair. She is short in stature and has a medium build. Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks with her family. For business she uses Spanish. She shares her life with her partner who makes a living in construction and her son who isn’t old enough to begin school yet. They live in their own home built of brick and cement and have electricity, potable water and sewage. Her business is the sale of snack foods and refreshments at her stand. She works in the snack retail business, including cookies, chocolate, sweets, gum, refreshments, sodas, etc. “Thank you to my mother who was able get this stand. We work with my partner who takes care of purchasing to supply the stand and also has another job,” she says.

The advantage of her business is that the sales are constant, but the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy a minibar and a counter to improve earnings. Her dream is to improve her business to be able to improve her son’s quality of life. She hopes to purchase a minibar and a counter to improve customer services. This is her first loan with the institution in the three years she has been working continuously in this business. 

Indra is asking for a loan to buy a minibar and a counter for her business to improve her customer service.

loans.use: to buy a minibar and a counter for her business to improve her customer service.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra lives in Villa de Garcia Nuevo Leon. She has 6 children to care for. Every day she works a lot to cover all the home necessities. A long time ago she separated from her husband, and for that reason she decided to begin her own business to support her family. She started selling cosmetics, and later she added groceries and personal hygiene products. Her two young children help in the business, and that lets Petra to spend more time with them and care them. To Petra, it is the unique job that she has and allows her earns an income to support her family.

Petra requires a loan of $200 USD to purchase merchandise, because she says that she has had a great success with the personal hygiene product sales. In this way she wants to increase her product inventory to cover her demand of products. Petra and her family thank your affection and support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Petra vive en Villa de García Nuevo León, tiene 6 hijos a su cuidado y todos los días trabaja mucho para cubrir las necesidades del hogar. Hace algunos años se separo de su esposo, por lo que decidió iniciar su propio negocio para atender a su familia, comenzó vendiendo cosméticos, tiempo después vendió abarrotes y productos de higiene personal. Sus dos jóvenes hijos ayudan en el negocio, por lo que esto ha permitido que Petra este más al pendiente de sus hijos y al cuidado de ellos. Para Petra es el único trabajo que tiene y que le permite ganar un ingreso para cuidar de su familia.

Petra requiere de $200 USD para comprar mercancía, porque dice que ha tenido un gran éxito con la venta de productos de higiene personal. De esta manera ella quiere aumentar la existencia de esos productos para enfrentar la alta demanda de sus productos. Petra y su familia agradecen tu cariño y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sadik

texts.en: I am a married man, a father of 5. I sell charcoal for a living. I intend to use the loan to venture into a new business so as to enable me to pay school fees for my children with ease.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto has 15 years of experience in ironwork. He started out in construction, then learned ironworking while working for someone else. His boss later sold him some of his tools and Jacinto started up his own workshop. He works every day from 8:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening. He also repairs machinery for a grocery store when they call him. Jacinto will use this loan to buy the steel plates, rods and tubes he uses to make door and window grills. His business is growing and he would like to continue to provide good service to his customers. Jacinto is married and has four children, two of whom are working and help with the household expenses. Through his hard work he has been able to finish his family's small concrete home and buy a small truck which he uses for his business.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Jacinto tiene una experiencia de 15 años con su actividad. Se inicio siendo albañil. Poco a poco fue adquiriendo el conocimiento de la cerrajería ya que trabajaba para otra persona la que le enseño todo el oficio. Inclusive esta persona le vendió parte de sus herramientas de trabajo para que Jacinto comience con su propio taller. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Además el da mantenimiento a las maquinas de un supermercado. Actividad que la realiza cuando lo llaman.

Jacinto invertirá el crédito en la compra de materia prima como lo es planchas, varillas, tubos los que le servirán para elaborar mas puertas y ventanas. Su demanda ha crecido y por ende desea dar un mejor servicio ha sus clientes.

Jacinto es casado. Tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 trabajan y le ayudan en los gastos del hogar. Fruto de su trabajo ha logrado terminar su casita de cemento. Su esposa también trabaja vendiendo artículos de bisutería y cosméticos. Posee un carrito el cual lo utiliza para su trabajo.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as steel plates, rods and tubing.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
Business Description

Felicidad has been selling Yanbal brand cosmetic products for several years. She began this business at the suggestion of a cousin. At first she only sold to family members and friends, but due to good demand and the excellent attention she gives to her customers, she began selling to others, as well.

How the Loan Will Be Used

Felicidad needs the loan in order to buy more merchandise so that she can have a good inventory for when the prices are reduced—then she can sell at a better price. She is also starting to sell items on credit, which has also been well received by her customers.

Information about Felicidad

She is 34 years old and has a daughter who is in school. Her house is made of cane, but she has begun to build one of cement. Felicidad hopes to get ahead with her business so that she can give her daughter an education, which she herself never got to have.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Felicidad se dedica ala venta de cosméticos de belleza de productos Yanbal desde hace un años y comenzó ese negocio por referencia de una prima que le sugirió comenzara con esta empresa. Al principio solo vendía a sus parientes y amigo pero debido a la gran acogida y a su excelente atención

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería y así tener para cuando lleguen las promociones poder vender a mejor precio. Además esta incursionando en la venta de artículos a crédito que también han tenido muy buena acogida

Información Personal

Ella tiene 34 años y una hija que estudia su casa es de caña pero ya ha comenzado a construir la de cemento. Felicidad desea superarse en el negocio para asi brindarle a su hija la educación que ella no pudo tener

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe is 28 years old, married with two children. Her spouse works as a driver. Three years ago she decided to start a business selling shoes through a catalog and this allows her to help with the family budget. She joined a solidarity network called Solidario 12 together with Ms. Luz Esperanza Ruiz Gómez (who makes cheese, creams, and a local food called quesillos) and Ms. Consuelo Morales Cruz ( who also sells shoes via catalog). With this loan, Guadalupe and Consuelo will invest in the purchase of different sized shoes with a variety of designs and will divide the money among the women to sell credit to their clients. Ms. Luz will buy cooking utensils to better prepare her food.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

GUADALUPE, tiene 28 años, casada, dos hijos y su esposo trabaja como chofer. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo , desde hace tres años que se inició con este negocio y le permite ayudar al presupuesto familiar forma parte del grupo Solidario 12 junto con doña Luz Esperanza Ruiz Gómez ( hace queso , cremas, quesillos) y doña Consuelo Morales Cruz ( venta de zapatos por catalogo) .Con el préstamo Guadalupe y Consuelo invertirán comprando mas calzados de diferentes números y diseños y se repartirán entre ellas y venderán a sus clientes al crédito y doña Luz comprará implementos para mejor preparar sus alimentos .

.

loans.use: Shoe Sales via Catalog

loans.name: Victoria Saragoza

texts.es:
Senora Victoria N. is 40 years old. She is a courageous and strong mother, immersed in the commercial activities of her small shop together with her oldest son. She is the only provider for her 4 children, since her husband abandoned her, leaving her in charge of all the responsibilities of the family. But this did not discourage her. On the contrary, with the help of her children and her efforts and desire to get out of this difficult situation, she realized she needed to improve the education and quality of life for her children. Unfortunately,her oldest son had to stop his plans for a higher education because there was not enough money. It's because of this that Victoria needs to increase the quantity of the products she offers in her shop, and with the income her children will hopefully be able to get an adequate education. Your generous support will help her realize her goals.

Encontramos a la señora Victoria N. de 40 años, una madre vigorosa y valiente, inmersa en las actividades comerciales de su pequeña bodega, en la que cordialmente oferta sus productos en compañía de su hijo mayor.Ella es el único sostén de sus 4 hijos, a raíz del abandono de su esposo, dejándola a cargo de todas las responsabilidades familiares y de la manutención de su numerosa familia Esto hecho no la amilanó y por el contrario con la ayuda de sus hijos se esfuerza con el afán de salir de esa difícil realidad con el objetivo de mejorar su educación y calidad de vida.
