Sin embargo muchas veces este esfuerzo no es suficiente ya que su hijo mayor tuvo que desistir de sus planes de estudios superiores debido a los bajos ingresos del hogar.Es por ello que Victoria desea incrementar la cantidad de productos de su bodega y través de el sus ingresos económicos familiares con los cuales podrá lograr que sus hijos puedan estudiar adecuadamente.Recurre a vuestra generosa ayuda a fin de poder hacer realidad sus anhelos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A GREATER QUANTITY AND VARIETY OF EVERY DAY ITEMS TO SELL IN THEIR SMALL STORE

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has a small business selling photograph accessories. She operates her business from a small outdoor sales kiosk at the Kahovski market in Kahovka, Ukraine. Because she has an outdoor location where she is unable to lock up her inventory, Elena sets up her product displays at the beginning of each day and packs everything up for storage at the end the day. Elena has been selling at the market for about five years. She started her own business after losing a factory job due to downsizing. Elena is married and has a three year old daughter and a twelve year old son. Her job is a good source of income for Elena and her husband, Nikolai, and allows her to take care of the family while Nikolai travels on business.

Elena has requested a loan of $1100 to add to her available capital so she can invest in her business and work on increasing her income.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Juana María

texts.en: Juana María is 45 years old.  She lives with her husband and four children in Palavé, in San Cristobal.  Juana is a versatile businesswoman.  She has been running a grocery store in her community for three years.  She also prepares and sells traditional Dominican foods for lunch.   She will use the loan to expand her business so that she will be able to send her children to a university so that they will get a better education.  She thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: This second loan will be invested to replenish a small grocery store.

loans.name: Banda B7 D Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Agnes K..  She owns a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase inventory.  Agnes is 40 years old and is divorced.   She has 3 children ranging from age 11 to 15 and her children go to school.  Each week, Agnes makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to buy a piece of land  Agnes has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time. Agnes is joined in her small group by Gloria N., Betty N., Aisha Nakafero, and B. Nakazzi.  Gloria N. has a business in arts and craffs and wants to expand business.  Betty N. is currently operating a business in livestock farming and wants a loan to expand her piggery business.  Aisha Nakafero operates a business of clothing sales and wants to add inventory.  B. Nakazzi is currently in the business of used clothing and is requesting a loan to increase stock.

loans.use: To increase inventory in retail shop

loans.name: Félix Hubert

texts.fr:
Félix Hubert M. is a very dynamic young man; being without salaried employment, he engaged himself early on in retail business to provide for his family. He now has a shop on Boulevard 54 in the Tiléne neighborhood of Ziguinchor town. He is seeking a loan to supply his shop with assorted grocery products.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Félix Hubert M. est un jeune tres dynamique ; etant sans emploi salarie , il s' est lance tres tot dans des activites de commerce de details pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille ; il tient actuellemnt une boutique sur le boulevard 54 m à Tiléne dans la ville de Ziguinchor Il sollicite un credit pour approvisionner sa boutique en produits alimentaires diverses.

loans.use: Purchase of various merchandise and grocery products to expand shop stock

loans.name: Devota's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Devota is 32 years old and is a married woman with one child, 11 years old. Devota is a cloth and charcoal seller, a business she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 8am to 11pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Subira and Mariam, who have businesses dealing in bolt and nut oil sales and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Edis

texts.es:
Business Description

Edis owns more than 2 hectares (5 acres) of land for growing rice. He has been in farming for more than 12 years. Depending on the weather and the cycle of the varieties of rice, Edis generally obtains up to 4 crops per year.

Use of the Loan

The loan is required for working capital, to buy the necessary supplies for the crop such as seeds, manure, fertilizers, renting of machinery, labor, etc.

Personal Information

Edis is 34 years old and is married. He has 6 children, four of whom are studying in local schools. His home is of mixed construction, that is, wood and cane. One of his goals is to improve quality of life through the education of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Edis posee más de 2 hectáreas de tierras propias para la cosecha de arroz. Lleva en la agricultura más de 12 años. Dependiendo del clima y del ciclo de las variedades, Edis generalmente obtiene hasta 4 cosechas al año.

Uso del Préstamo

Requiere el préstamo para capital de trabajo, esto comprando los insumos necesarios para la cosecha tales como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, alquilando maquinarias, mano de obra. etc.

Información Personal

Edis tiene34 años. Es casado. Tiene 6 hijos de los cuales cuatro estudian en escuelas del sector. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta, es decir madera y caña. Una de sus metas es mejorar la calidad de vida a través de la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: To invest in his rice farm

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma has gradually been overcoming the vast emptiness that was left with the loss of her beloved son due to a terrible illness. Now with more strength than ever, she is dedicated to raising small animals from home. Thanks to the love and care with which she provides them, the animals have multiplied considerable. She would like to invest in her business because it gives her the sustenance she needs to survive.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

NORMA, se viene reponiendo poco a poco del gran vacío que le dejó la pérdida D. su amado hijo a causa D. una terrible enfermedad, y ahora con más fuerza que antes se dedica a criar a sus pequeños animalitos en casa, éstos gracias al inmenso amor y cuidados que les otorga se han multiplicado considerablemente y desea seguir invirtiendo en esta ocupación debido a que le otorga el sustento necesario para vivir.

loans.use: Purchase of food for small animals

loans.name: Selafina

texts.en:
Selafina T., 71, is widowed with 8 children. She has many years of experience in sewing clothes and material. She sells to the public and villagers 5 days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

SPBD loans are Selafina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan money will also be used to buy cement, timber and an iron roof for home improvement. She has children overseas who always sends her money to help her out.

loans.use: Buy material and equipment for her sewing business.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
I am Adrián V. Z. and I work in a restaurant in Piedras Negras, Mexico. My family is growing and so my wife and I decided to build another room in our house for our young daughter. We have already started the construction of her room, but due to a lack of money we’ve had to leave it unfinished. For this reason we are requesting a loan of $825 dollars in order to be able to finish the construction project.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Yo soy Adrián V. Z., trabajo en un restaurante de Piedras Negras, mi familia esta creciendo así que mi esposa y yo decidimos hacer un cuarto mas en nuestra casa para la pequeña hija que tenemos y ya hemos empezado la construcción de dicho cuarto pero por falta de recursos se ha quedado parada, por eso solicito la cantidad de 825 dlls para poder terminar la construcción de este cuarto.

loans.use: To build an additional room

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime is 28 years old and lives with Rolina and his small 6 year old daughter Mirian, who started primary school. Jaime was born and lives in Juliaca, and for 8 years he has been machine knitting clothing, which he learned from his mother who taught him all the secrets to making beautify and attractive items of clothing. Today, with his wife Rolina, they both work on creating clothing with the knitting machine. Their knitting machine is in their house, and they work all day Monday through Friday, then on Saturday and Sunday they go out and sell the items they made at various markets throughout the city. The business is good because Jaime and Rolina work well together, being able to work together all day and take care of their small daughter Mirian. What is difficult is only having one knitting machine, they aren’t able to produce the quantities that they would hope to and be able to generate more income. Their daughter Mirian is the focus of these parents, on her behalf they work day after day in order to give her a promising future. With the money from the loan, Jaime will be able to buy a knitting machine for his wife, increase production, and in the future establish a small shop where he can employ more knitters.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Jaime tiene 28 años, convive con Rolina y con su pequeña hija Mirian de 6 años, quien ya empezó la escuela primaria. Jaime es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, desde hace ocho años ha venido dedicándose al negocio del tejido a máquina, que aprendió de su madre, la cual le ha enseñado todos los secretos para realizar prendas bonitas y atractivas.Actualmente, con su pareja Rolina, se dedican íntegramente a la elaboración de prendas tejidas a máquina, en su casa donde cuentan con una máquina de tejer, trabajando durante todo el día de lunes a viernes, ya que los días sábados y domingos salen a vender las prendas confeccionadas en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad. El negocio es bueno porque existe cooperación entre Jaime y Rolina, pudiendo trabajar juntos todo el día y cuidar a su pequeña hija Mirian, lo dificultoso es contar con una sola máquina de tejer, no se abastecen para producir las cantidades que ellos esperan y generar más ingresos económicos. Su hija Mirian es la razón de ser de estos padres, por la cual trabajan día a día a favor de darle un futuro prometedor. Con el dinero del préstamo, Jaime podrá comprar una máquina de tejer para su esposa, aumentar la producción y en el futuro contar con un pequeño taller donde emplear a más tejedores.

loans.use: Buy a knitting machine to make a greater quantity of items

loans.name: Facundo

texts.es:
Facundo Fernández es oriundo de la ciudad de Roque Gonzalez de Santacruz tiene 44 años de edad, la compañera de su vida con quien esta casado hace mas de 8 años se llama Juana Bautista Fernández de 27 años de edad, tienen 1 hijo, en edad escolar

Hace 15 años iniciò una pequeña despensa en su domicilio y esta a cargo de su esposa , mientras tanto el se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno para proveer de carne a la microempresa, ya que es la ùnica de la zona y tiene muchos clientes Tambièn son propietarios de un tambo que distribuye leche en horario de la mañana son multifacèticos y se ayudan bastante para progresar honestamente Con el crèdito comprarà harina ,azucar,fideo arroz,yerba
texts.en:
Facundo Fernández comes from the city of Roque Gonzalez of Santacruz and he is 44 years old. His life companion, to whom he has been married for more than eight years, is called Juana Bautista Fernández, and she is 27 years old. They have one son who is in school. Fifteen years ago he began a little pantry store in his home that his wife manages while he is occupied buying and selling cattle to provide meat for his little business. It is the only such business locally and he has many clients. He also owns a dairy that delivers milk in the morning. His many talents help him progress honestly. With this loan he will buy flour, sugar, noodles, rice, and yerba mate (tea leaves).

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise (flour, sugar, noodles, rice, yerba mate, and other goods)

loans.name: Maria Nakagwa’S Group

texts.en:
Maria is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 38-year-old married woman with 8 children, aged between 22 and 1. Four of her children go to school. Maria also takes care of 3 orphans. She resides in and rents a single-room house, where she is staying with 4 people. They don’t have electricity or piped water at home.

The family gets 2 meals a day and rarely takes tea. She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Maria sells secondhand clothes and moves on foot selling them; she doesn’t have a fixed place. She sells to all categories of people. Maria’s monthly expenses include medication, rent, and food for the family.

Maria works 6 days a week and has been with MCDT for 4 years, servicing her eighth loan. She wants to use this loan to expand her business and aspires to sell new clothes.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng S. is a 37-year-old who makes a living growing vegetables which she sells 3 months after planting at the market to earn income, making around $2 per day. She is married with three young children, all of who still live at home whilst her husband, Mr. Shavdy Horm, 26, is a local builder who has several workers for providing services to customers for income and lives in Battambang Province.

Seng is requesting a loan of US$ 500 for her husband to use for enlarging his investment and paying workers' salaries.

loans.use: to enlarge their business

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Virginia is married to Rudy Sr. and are blessed with five kids. They live in the small rural area of Brgy. San Pedro Tumauini, Isabela.

For almost 21 years, Virginia’s second home is the Tumauini Public Market where she has a stall for grinding and selling coconut, sugar and rice which are used in making native cakes and other native delicacies. 
 
Virginia works hard to support the education of her two children who are still studying in school. She would like an additional loan of PHP20,000 to buy more coconut, charcoal, brown sugar, plastic bags and other merchandise which she will sell in her stall. She expects to have more income with the increase in output after selling these products. It will help her to save for the education of her children and also in maintaining her business. 

Virginia considers perseverance, hard work, and loving the customers will result to better operation of her business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is a member of the Empecemos (“Let’s get started”) Village Bank. Apolonia is 59 years old and is married, with six children. Apolonia has a stand in the Nery Garcia Market where she sells vegetables, both wholesale and per kilo. She works seven days a week, and her daughter helps her run the stand.  Apolonia is requesting a loan to buy squash and carrots. Apolonia dreams that her children will finish their schooling and of improving her business. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Apolonia es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos. 
Apolonia es casada, tiene 59 años y 6 hijos, Apolonia tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende verduras al por mayor y menor, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hija. 
Apolonia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapallo y zanahoria. 
Los sueños de Apolonia son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy squash and carrots

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita F. F. vive en Apopa municipio de San Salvador, como madre soltera, ha enfrentado todas las dificultades de la vida, pues su marido la abandono, dejándola sola con su hija. Con valor y fe en Dios, Margarita nunca se ha rendido, y ha educado y mantenido por si misma a su hija.
Con un negocio ambulante de venta de ropa y otros accesorios, Margarita es digna de admiración y orgullo, pues  siempre ha mantenido la frente en alto en su humilde profesión. En este momento Margarita solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y le brinde nuevas ganancias para llevar a cabo su sueño de abrir un pequeño puesto fijo, en donde ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Margarita F. F. lives in the Apopa municipality of San Salvador. As a single mother she has faced many difficulties in life, as her husband abandoned her, leaving her to raise her daughter by herself. With courage and faith in God, Margarita has never given up, and has educated and supported her daughter on her own. With a roving business selling clothing and other accessories Margarita deserves admiration and pride, as she has always held her head high in her humble profession. Margarita is currently seeking a loan to buy new merchandise and earn new income, in order to realize her dream of opening a small permanent stall where she could sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, and use the income to pay for a permanent stall

loans.name: Bibifotima

texts.ru: Самадова Бибифотима является активной клиенткой Микроинвест. Ей 63 года, имеет 3 детей. Ее сыновья работают в России а сама Бибифотима занимается предпринимательством на местных рынках. Бибифотима получает от своих сыновей денежные переводы, и на эти деньги в прошлом году построила новую пристройку к своему дому. Часть денег которых не хватило она получила в виде займа Микроинвест. Сейчас она планирует покрыть крышу шифером и нуждается в небольшом займе, поэтому пришла в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Bibifotima S. is an active client of MicroInvest. She is 63 years old, has 3 children

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to remodel home

loans.name: Holman Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Holman  trabaja en una empresa que distribuye productos lubricantes lleva cuatro años en este trabajo, cuando inicio comenzó de conductor ahora trabaja en la cobranza, tiene 36 años de edad, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 12,14 y 15 años de edad, que están estudiando, reside en el barrio memorial sandino en la ciudad de Managua. Su esposa trabaja como afanadora, con esta solicitud va a comprar materiales de construcción para repellar las paredes y construir  un muro en la parte de enfrente de su casa para tener una mejor seguridad con su familia. Sus metas personales  es poder cambiar de trabajo y poder tener un ingreso mejor.
texts.en:
Mr. Holman works in a company that distributes lubricants. He has worked there for four years, beginning as a driver, and now working in payment collection. He is 36 years old and he and his wife have three children aged 12, 14, and 15, who are all studying. They live in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua. His wife works as a cleaner. With this loan he is going to buy construction materials to plaster the walls of his house and build a wall in front of the house to provide more safety for his family. His personal goals are to be able to change jobs and have a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a front wall

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Mrs. Marilyn B. is 50 years of age, married, and has five children. An active member of the Paglaum Co-op, she has already availed several loans financed to her business selling longanisa. She also engages in dealing RTWs. Her sources of household income are from the business and the salary of her husband. Marilyn availed another loan from the Co-op for the purchase of additional stocks of longanisa to generate more income to support the education of her children since the salary of his husband is insufficient to provide for all their needs.

loans.use: To purchase of longanisa to sell

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 56-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Khalil has owned a printing factory for fifteen years. Khalil requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his factory. This is the first time that Khalil has requested a loan. 
Khalil is special because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing the machines for his work because he didn’t have enough cash. Khalil decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his factory.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his factory.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.es: Don Ronaldo trabaja como guarda de seguridad desde hace 11 años, tiene 2 hijos los estudiando, el mayor de 16 años estudia su cuarto año de Educacion primaria y la niña de 14 años estudia su segundo año en el instuto Ruben Dario,su esposa trabaja como tecnica de MiFamilia la cual aporta y ayuda a su marido con los gastos familiares, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construir una  vivienda), a pesar que el salario que este devenga es poco ha  luchado para que a su familia no le falte lo básico en el  hogar, como tambien el en sus dias libres se dedica a sembrar diversos cultivos, y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, el es un hombre trabajador, responsable y anhela un porvenir mejor,  ama su trabajo, se siente agradecido con la Institución de AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha comprado electrodomésticos y a mejorado la vivienda donde  vive con su esposa, su sueño es tener una vivienda bonita y trabajo para así sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Ronaldo has worked as a security guard for the past 11 years. He has two children in school; the eldest is 16 in his fourth year of high school and his daughter is 14 and is in her second year at the Ruben Dario Institute. His wife works as a technical expert at MiFamilia and supports him with family expenses. Ronaldo is requesting his seventh loan and plans to invest it in the improvement of his home (build a room). Despite his small salary, he has fought so that his family doesn't lack the basics in their home, and in his free time he also plants diverse crops and tries to improve the living conditions. He is a hard-working and responsible man who's goal is to make the future better. He loves his work and is grateful to Kiva partner AFODENIC whose previous loans have helped him buy household appliances and improve the bedroom he shares with his wife. His goal is to have a beautiful home and works hard so his children can make headway.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room in his home

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa O. T.  cuenta con 45 años de edad es casada, vive con sus 4 hijos, Actualmente se dedica a la Elaboración de Cortes Típicos lleva 5 años dedicándose a esta actividad,  reside en el caserío Xapatan Aldea Chipuac municipio y departamento  de Totonicapán, Guatemala, pero en las condiciones a las que vive no son suficientes por lo que solicito un préstamo y acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo ya que la demanda de sus clientes y  la de su trabajo a crecido por lo que necesita comprar materia prima para poder cubrir la demanda y así generar más fuentes de trabajo mejorando sus ingresos y darle una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teresa O. T. is 45 years old, married and lives with her four children. She is an artisan who has been making a living making typical garments for the past five years. She resides in the village of Xapatan Aldea Chipuac, department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, but her living conditions are not sufficient, which is why she is turning to Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR. She is requesting a loan because her customers' demands for her products and her work has grown and she needs to purchase raw materials in order to meet their demands. This will generate more sources of work and improve her income and help her provide a better education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.en:
The committee “Oñondivepa” formed with the union of many neighbors from the same district of La Lomita, in the city of Ñemby.

All of the participants of the committee have developed their own independent business activities, the majority of them in sales. The members form a very united and capable group, and do their activities together, as many of them sell fruits and vegetables.

All of the participants of the committee are mothers and they work in order to strengthen their household economies and to develop their businesses in a sustainable fashion.

1. Paulina L. R. -- Clothing sales 
2. Venancia M. -- Food sales 
3. Dionicia T. -- Beverage sales 
4. Maria Teresa O. -- Manicurist 
5. Mercedes A. -- Dressmaker 
6. Lucia O. -- Fruit sales 
7. Ignacia N. -- Fruit sales 
8. Maria Gloria N. -- Cosmetics sales 
9. Isidora A. -- Vegetable sales 
10. Senona V. B. -- Vegetable sales 
11. Marta B. -- Fruit sales 
12. Rosa M. -- Event planning 
13. Nelida C. -- Food sales 
14. Elena I. B. -- Food sales 
15. Limpia O. -- Fruit sales 

One member of the committee decided not take out a loan, and to save her money instead.

loans.use: To be invested in each member’s small business

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora C. hails from the island village of Kinagatan in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is 47 years old and married to Eduardo, who is a fisherman and also a farmer. She is the mother of three. She is full of determination and has discipline within her for things that can fight poverty.

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 1997 and was given the opportunity to have access to capital. She invested her previous loans in her sari-sari store (general store) and wisely managed the business. Now on her eighth loan, she is requesting the amount of 19,000 pesos to pay for purchases for her store: 10 sacks of rice, one gallon of gasoline (resale), two sacks of brown sugar, one sack of white sugar, liquors, and groceries.

She is positive that her business will grow bigger with the help of her husband and children. She dreams of sending her children to school up to college and to have savings for their personal needs in case of emergencies.

loans.use: 10 sacks of rice, three sacks of sugar, liquors and other groceries for her general store

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is a 30-year-old woman, married with three children. Currently all her three children are in school.

Agatha enjoys selling and has much experience in customer care. She has been selling maize and powdered pepper for four years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices.

Agatha wants to use the loan to buy maize and powdered pepper in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy maize and powdered pepper in bulk

loans.name: Tawopr Group

texts.en:
Here are Baba K., Marie K., Iye S. and Adama B.. They call their group "Tawopr," a Temne phrase meaning "let us be steadfast." This is the fourth loan these entrepreneurs have borrowed from SMT/Kiva. Their previous loans have had a tremendous effect on the lives of these borrowers. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan of Le 1,300,000.00 to enable them further improve their businesses.

Baba K. is the leader of this group. Baba was born in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have five children. He sells food items and non-food items at the Magburaka town market. He has been a businessman for more than fifteen years.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Juliana B. tiene un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, es mujer soltera y no tienen ningún hijo, compra sus productos a  camiones repartidores y en el mercado, ella desde muy joven empezó a trabajar porque su padres eran de escasos recursos. Con su  esfuerzo a podido salir adelante esta solicitando un financiamiento para invertirlo en diversidad de productos, además quiere invertir en un carrito de venta de sorbete, la señora vive de manera moderada y cuenta con los servicio básicos. Su deseo es obtener una pequeña distribuidora en la que ofrezca los productos de consumo diarios.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Tinik

texts.en:
Tinik is a humble mother who, with much effort, works on her potato and wheat farm to later sell her agricultural products in the markets of the closest towns or to merchants from the same area. Her responsibilities as a mother have encouraged her to pursue farming activities to continue growing the best vegetables in the area.

Tinik is also engaged in the business of raising and selling cattle. Her children and husband actively help her with operations. She wants to increase her investment in agriculture and expand her farmland to improve the living standards of her beloved family. Let’s help this mother to keep working for the well-being of her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, mineral fertilizer, and young cattle

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Felista M. from Tukuyu. She is married with four children between the ages of 16 and 21. Felista has been running a business purchasing and selling crops since 1995. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week.  Felista currently earns about 120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve the quality and range of product. Felista thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Tsedev

texts.en:
Tsedev A. is a 40-year-old single mother who lives with her sister and three-year-old son in Uvs province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. A. owns and operates a small cafe in her town. Her cafe serves up a variety of traditional Mongolian dishes, but her most popular item is Huushuur, a deep fried flour pocket filled with meat. Her cafe is a preferred lunch spot in the community as huushuur is a quick and easy meal for many people on the go. 

A. started her cafe in 2005 and has since built a stable and successful operation. Her earnings have enabled her to buy a two-room apartment to house her cafe. She is very hardworking and has built her cafe into one of the most popular dining spots in her town.  A. is very hopeful for the future and says, "One can achieve anything they want if they work hard." She hopes to soon expand her business and has plans to start a clothing trade business to supplement her income. She is requesting a  $2500 loan to purchase food supplies for her cafe and to invest in starting a clothing trade business.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies for her cafe and to invest in a clothing trade business

loans.name: Petrona Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, la señora Petrona Isabel L. se ha destacado por ser trabajadora del hogar y por velar siempre por el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Ella atraviesa la necesidad de inverter en el mejoramiento de su vivienda debido a que los años han transcurrido y cada día su vivienda se ha ido dañando y por tal razón ella solicita un crédito para adquirir los materiales de construcción para iniciar la obra y así brindarle un techo digno donde habitar a su familia compuesta por su pequeño hijo en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Petrona Isabel L. lives in Managua, where is is known to be a very hardworking homemaker, ever watchful of the maintenance of her home.

However, she has reached a point when she must invest in improvements to her house, which has gotten damaged over the years. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to purchase construction materials to begin making repairs so that she can provide an adequate home for her family, which includes her young school-aged son.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Beng

texts.en: Beng B., 33, is single and lives with his parents. He resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. To make a living, he raises pigs and produces rice wine. He is able to earn an income of $8 USD per day from his businesses, which helps cover household expenses. B. and his family are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, B. is asking for a loan of $500 USD to purchase pig food and pig medicine. With the remainder of the loan, B. wants to purchase more rice to manufacture more rice wine to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy pig food and medicine, and rice to produce wine

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Of Little Ants Group

texts.en:
The official name of this group translates as “The Women´s Bank of Little Ants”. This group consists of eleven members from the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica in the Cariari region. With this loan, each member will receive a deposit to invest at their discretion. These women have created The Women’s Bank of Little Ants as a formal way to support one another as guarantors of each other’s loans.

The Cariari region is located in the province of Limon. In this rural area, life has been difficult due to a lack of job opportunities, family responsibilities, low levels of formal education and a lack of available financial services. Their challenging situation has resulted in a communal initiative to create work for themselves by engaging wholeheartedly in the purchase, rearing and sale of pigs.

In order to fund the development of their businesses each woman is applying for a loan of 100,000 colons (roughly US$180). Their loans will be used to purchase piglets and nutritional food that will ensure their growth into quality livestock products. The pigs will be sold to people in the community for direct consumption or resale. From November to December is the high season for the group, the reason can be summed up in one word: Tamales. Tamales are a traditional Costa Rican food eaten at Christmas time and their main ingredient is pork. As customer needs for pork meat increase, so too do the revenues of the “Little Ants”.

For many of the group members, the responsibility of raising a family has fallen solely on their shoulders, rendering the income generated from pig sales a vital source of income. Despite their entrepreneurial spirit, their efforts have been hamstrung, partly due to exclusion from the traditional banking system. This is where you, through Kiva’s lending model, can help.

Your contribution is a direct investment in the betterment of the lives of women living in a poor community of Caribbean Costa Rica. By lending to these proactive and hardworking entrepreneurs, you are enabling them to help themselves.

The Group Members

These women identify most with the struggle of “little ants”. The members observe that “ants work together and support one another day and night, in order to build something that is bigger than themselves.” This can be taken to symbolize the group’s aspirations for growth and approval for more loans in the future. The following detailed description of Flor M. A. A. can be considered as generally applicable to all the women in the group: they are all participants in similar economic activities in the Caribbean region of Costa Rica.

Flor M. A. A. is the elected treasurer of this group. She is 38 years old and has not completed high school. She lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a farmer who grows plantains, rice and beans for family consumption and sells what he has left over.

On average, Flor earns 37,500 colons (roughly US$67) per month. At the moment, she has one pig; she would use this loan to purchase another. She would like to earn enough money from her pig-selling business so that she may buy a cow.

Flor takes pride in managing her business with one hand while raising her children with the other. An obstacle for her, and for all the group members, is the high cost of nutrients for the pigs. Transportation is another challenge: walking to town to get the nutrients and hauling them back is a laborious task. When it rains heavily, the rise in the nearby river makes transport by bus impossible.

The members of The Women´s Bank of Little Ants have lived in the rural zone of Cariari for their entire lives. They are experienced in the trade of livestock and other agricultural activities; for example, Flor has been rearing pigs for the last fifteen years of her life. Your loan will help these women take the first steps in a loan cycle that leads to the end of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Uranchimeg is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in the Khovd province of western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent. All three of her sons, aged 16, 14, and 11, attend a local secondary school. 

Uranchimeg operates a beauty-product retail business in a rented stall at a local market. She began her business in 2000 and since then, she has stabilized her business operation and gained a lot of experience running a business. She would like to grow her business in the future and expand her customer base. Uranchimeg is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large amount and wider variety of beauty products for her growing business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount and wider variety of beauty products

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Noemí es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Noemí tiene un puesto en el Mercado Grau, donde vende lencería, además Noemí vende diversos productos dependiendo de las campañas, como juguetes, útiles, etc.
Noemí necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles escolares y medias.
Los sueños de Noemí son salir adelante, incrementar su mercadería y que sus hijos sean buenas personas.
texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the Marcela Communal Bank. She is 30, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She has a stand in the Grau Market where she sells dry goods. Noemí also sells diverse products, depending on the season, like toys and supplies, etc. Noemí needs a loan for 900 PEN to buy school supplies and socks. Noemí’s dreams are to get ahead, increase her merchandise, and to see her children become good people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies and socks

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es:
Mayela tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia.
DesD. hace 9 años se dedica a la venta D. productos comestibles D. primera necesidad en un puesto del mercado cerca D. su casa. Ella atienD. desD. la mañana hasta la tarD.; es conocida por su trato amable y por dar un peso exacto y justo, razón por la cual tiene varios clientes fieles y regulares. En algunas ocasiones su hija mayor y su esposo la ayudan, pero generalmente ella es la única responsable del negocio.
Esta actividad le ha resultado muy rentable, y por ello desea continuar por muchos años en este negocio. 

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy responsable y que cumple su palabra, por lo que es muy apreciada en su banco comunal. Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy responsable y que cumple su palabra, por lo que es muy apreciada en su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y panetones.
texts.en:
Mayela is 55 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and children. For the past nine years, Mayela has been selling basic necessities from a market post near her home. She works from morning until evening and has gained several loyal and regular customers because of her kind treatment and accurate measurements. Sometimes her oldest daughter and husband help with the business, but she usually works by herself. This business has proven to be very profitable. Therefore, she hopes it will continue for many more years to come.

This is her third loan with MFP. Mayela is a very responsible person who is true to her word and highly regarded by her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, and panettones.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and panettones

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La Sra. Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 27 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella. La Socia presenta Estudios Superiores de Auxiliar en Contabilidad.

Maribel, es una mujer joven y trabajadora, lleva 02 años en el negocio y ahora tiene como meta, seguir prosperando e implementándose más en su negocio. Hoy en día le esta yendo muy bien, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas, ubicada en su misma casa. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró bebidas gasificadas de diferentes sabores tamaños y marcas.

Manifiesta que con el negocio que ejerce se siente muy tranquila y contenta, es ella quien administra su negocio. Se siente muy capaz y responsable con las cuotas que debe pagar mensualmente al Banco Comunal.

Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio,  ya es muy conocida en el barrio; y cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario consumen sus bebidas, ya que las vende bien heladitas al gusto del cliente.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará bebidas gasificadas de diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas. Así como agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Se siente orgullosa por haber logrado implementar su negocio. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a superarse y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y a defenderse como mujeres. Su sueño es tener una Distribuidora de bebidas gasificadas y ser reconocida
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the “Las Aguerridas II” Communal Bank, in the Tarapoto, District of the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 27 years old, married, and has two children who depend on her. She is trained to work as an assistant accountant. Maribel is a hard working young woman and has been working in her business for two years. Her goal is to continue to prosper and work her business. At the moment she is doing well, selling soft drinks from her home. She invested the money from her first loan of 300 PEN in soft drinks of different flavors, sizes and brands. She says that she feels very comfortable and happy with the business she runs. She feels that she will be able to afford the monthly payments to repay the communal bank. She is well known in her neighborhood and has regular customers who buy her soft drinks daily, which she sells nice and cold the way her customers like. With this 1,330 PEN ($475) loan, she will buy more soft drinks of different flavors, sizes and brands and also mineral water and bottled water. She is proud for having succeeded at starting her business and is thankful to the “Manuela Ramos” movement for helping her and other women to get ahead. She would like to one day run a soft drink distributorship and become well recognized.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Ellaindina's Group

texts.en:
Ellaindina O. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Ellaindina is the group leader of an eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ellaindina O..

Ellaindina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $130 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ellaindina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shehas successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ellaindina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Sime, una zona rural del distrito de Pítipo cuya principal actividad económica es la agricultura y que se encuentra ubicada a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Como la mayoría de hombres de la zona, Luis se dedica a la agricultura para captar ingresos con los cuales pueda mantener a su familia. Actualmente tiene instaladas dos hectáreas de arroz ya transplantadas. Luis está cuidando mucho de su cultivo para asegurarse una buena producción que le brinde los ingresos suficientes para sacar adelante a su familia.

Siguiendo este objetivo el desea abonar su cultivo para que este se desarrolle correctamente. Por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1100 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de fertilizantes para lograr su objetivo.

Luis es un padre de familia responsable y entregado a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución ya ha demostrado tranquilidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir su pago. En la imagen aparece mostrandonos el accesorio con el que piensa aplicar los fertilizantes a su cultivo.
texts.en:
Luis is 46 years old, married, and has three children. He lives with his family in the Sime neighborhood, a rural zone of the Pítipo district where the main economic activity is agriculture, located about forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Like the majority of men from the area, Luis works in agriculture to earn an income and maintain his family. He currently has 2 hectares of rice planted. Luis is taking great care of his crop in order to insure a good production which will provide him sufficient income move ahead with his family. Following his goal he wants to fertilize his crop so that it develops correctly. For that reason he is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a credit of 1100 Soles which he plans to use for the purchase of fertilizers to achieve his goal. Luis is a responsible family man, dedicated to his work. His greatest wish is to see his children achieve good careers. He has worked before with our institution and has demonstrated calmness and responsibility since assuming his payments. In the photo, he appears showing us the tool with which he plans to apply the fertilizer to his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to maintain his rice crop.

loans.name: Kanyinya Beekeepers Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
T. Philmon is 34 years old and is the leader of his lending group in Kyenjojo. He is a friendly, hardworking and determined man who is married with two wives with seven children aged 14 to 6 years and all in primary schools. Philmon also helps to take care of three dependents.

Philmon has operated a drugstore in Kanyinya A trading centre for thirteen years. Ever since he started his drugstore, his business has progressed and he has been able to make 300,000/= as monthly profits.

Philmon says that he has been able to attract his customers because of the good services offered and he would like to continue having a stable and successful business as well as a well-established family.

Philmon needs a loan to be able to increase the stock in his business by buying more drugs for resale.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for increased sales

loans.name: Marylou's Group

texts.en:
Marylou C. is from the village of Dioyo. She is 28 years old. Marylou is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marylou is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marylou owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector making & selling "nipa", a native roof, in their community. Marylou has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marylou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marylou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for the business. Marylou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Marylou from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve their living situation. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for expansion of the business

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto se dedica al servicio de transporte trabaja con un colegio de la ciudad, trasportando a los niños y a los profesores; vive en la zona de Pampahasi con su esposa, que es profesora, sus hijos ya son independientes, pero viven en la misma casa, el cliente es muy trabajador ya que los fines de semana que no trabaja con el colegio, realiza contratos para viajes a otras ciudades y algunos pueblos de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito que solicita es para comprar el equipo de gas natural vehicular y hacer la conversion a su vehículo, ya con este combustible el gasto diario será menor al que tiene actualmente y asi tambien reducir la contaminacion de nuestro planeta muchos de los transportistas de Bolivia estan convirtiendo sus vehiculos de Gasolina y diesel a GNV gas natural uno por reducir el costo y otro por que ya se esta tomando conciencia en el cuidado de nuestro planeta, El Sr. Roberto esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Roberto provides transportation service for a school in the city. He transports the children and the teachers. He lives in the Pampahasi region with his wife, a teacher. His children are independent, but they live in the same house. He is very hard-working. On the week-ends, when he does not work for the school, he is hired to travel to other villages and some towns around the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting is to buy natural gas equipment to convert his vehicle. The daily expense of this fuel will be less than what he currently pays. He will also reduce the contamination of our planet. Many of the drivers in Bolivia are converting their vehicles from gas and diesel to natural gas. First, they do this to reduce cost. The other reason is that they are being conscientious about the care of our planet. Roberto is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy natural gas equipment to convert his vehicle

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es: Don Luís es un hombre dedicado al trabajo desde joven logro aprender la construcción hoy en día, trabaja como maestro de obra lo que se ha beneficiado ya que el ha construido su propia casa. Su esposa procreo dos hijos y trabaja como estilista para pagar gastos básicos y poder apoyar a su esposo. Don Felipe ha mejorado su casa gran parte con los financiamientos de la institución. Los tiempos difíciles es cuando no tiene trabajo por semanas la situación económica se le complica. Pero casi siempre trabaja por contratos haciendo escuelas, en los departamentos en donde se lleva meses en la construcción y su salario esta fijo. Son trabajo cansado pero se gana bien. Con este crédito comprara materiales para instalar el cielo raso de su casa, y poder bajar la temperatura del calor que ha estado bastante calorosa.
texts.en:
Luís is a dedicated worker; from a very early age he learned construction skills and today he works as a master builder. An added benefit of this is that he has built his own house. He and his wife have two children; she works as a beautician to help him with household expenses. Felipe has improved his home in large measure thanks to financing from the institution. Hard times are when he doesn’t have work for weeks and the economic situation becomes complicated. Most of the time, however, he has work contracts to build schools for departments where the job lasts several months and the salary is steady; it’s exhausting work but it pays well. He will use this loan to buy materials and supplies to install ceilings in his home in order to cool it down a bit because it’s been pretty hot.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to install ceilings in his house.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa G. is from the village of Mimbunga, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Rosa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosa runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Rosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Rosa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
Fedila Y. is a 50 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a vegetable business. She lives in Barangay Jantianon, Amlan, Negros Oriental with her 47 year old husband, Florencio, who works as a driver, and with their 2 children who are between 18-21 years old and are currently studying.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her vegetable vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000.

Fedila is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she could continue her vegetable vending business. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Fedela aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita S. is a widow who lives in Barangay Purisima, Manapla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a carinderia business (an eatery or mini-restaurant). Nenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past fifteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, Nenita is borrowing PHP 18,000 which she intends to use to purchase fresh meat and vegetables for her fast-food so that she can continue to save for the future to sustain her family’s daily needs. Nenita S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase fresh meat and vegetables for her fast-food

loans.name: Fe Bulay-Og Group

texts.en:
Fe B. is from the village of Poblacion Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Fe is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Pineapple 2.

Fe is married and has 1 adult-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seafood products to sell

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora María Rosario Chimbo es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, vive en la comunidad de Punta Corral que es perteneciente al parroquia de Turi, la mismas que es reconocida por ser el mirador del la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su población ha migrado para ofrecer a sus familias un mejor futuro.

La Señora. María Rosario tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 9 hijos de los cuales 6 son casados, 4 viven independientemente y 2 viven con ella compartiendo los gastos del hogar, sus 3 últimos hijos estudian,  uno en la universidad, otro en el colegio y su último hijo en la escuela; su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías como es el bordado, actividad que la realiza hace 12 años y aprendido en varios cursos que ha recibido en su comunidad,cuenta con un pequeño taller en donde labora de lunes a sábado sin horarios y ahora es doña María Rosario quien dicta los cursos de bordados a sus demás compañeras de la comunidad.

Es una socia fundadora del banco comunal y se siente muy contenta de formar parte de un gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela, hilo y muchos más materiales para su pequeño taller, su meta es agrandar su taller para incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
María Rosario Chimbo is a member of the Mujer y Fortaleza (Women and Strength) community bank. She lives in the community of Punta Corral, which is in the parish of Turi, known for its views of the city of Cuenca. Its people make a living raising livestock and in agriculture, and much of the population has migrated to offer their families a better future. María is 48 years old, married and has nine children, six who are married, of whom four live out on their own and two of whom share the household expenses with her, and the youngest three are in school, one at the university, one in trade school and the other in regular school. Her husband makes a living in agriculture and together they were able to build their own home. María makes a living making embroidery handicrafts, which has has been doing for the past 12 years and learned from various courses she took in her community. She has a small workshop where she works without a schedule from Monday through Saturday. Now it's María who gives the embroidery classes to her fellow community members. She is one of the founding members of her community bank and feels very please with being part of such a great group of hard-working women. She plans to use the loan to purchase fabric, thread and many more materials for her small workshop. Her goal is to expand her shop to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, threads, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Reida

texts.en: Reida Y. is currently in the business of selling bags of maize, rice, and millet at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of sorghum to sell.  Reida is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store to sell her cereals in.

loans.use: Stock bags of sorghum to sell

loans.name: Las Rosas De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
LAS ROSAS D. SAN MATEO:  SE LOCALIZA EN  LA COMUNIDAD D. SAN MATEO MILPAS ALTAS ANTIGUA GUATEMALA HACE 18 MESES, QUE SE FORMO, CON 12 SEÑORAS QUE SE DEDICAN  A LA AGRICULTURA, TORTILLERIA Y GANADO   UTILIZANDO CREDITO D. FAPE.EL BANCO LAS ROSAS D. SAN MATEO HA LLEGADO A SU CUARTO CICLO GRACIAS AL CREDITO D. FAPE, SU LIDER DOÑA ELIDA T. Q.,CASADA, CON 10 HIJOS ESTUDIAN 6 EN LA ESCUELA LOCAL 5 Y EN DIVERSIFICADO  1 EN ANTIGUA GUATEMALA  LLEVANDO LA CARRERA D. MAESTRA D. PRIMARIA, VIVEN CON ELLA 9  EN UNA COMUNIDAD PEQUEÑA.LOS SUEÑOS D. DOÑA ELIDA , SON QUE SUS HIJOS SIGAN ESTUDIANDO Y ALCANZAR UNA MEJOR OPORTUNIDAD EN EL FUTURO,SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA AGRICULTURA, SIEMBRA D. EJOTE, ARVEJA CHINA, ARVEJA CRIOLLA, LLEVA 10 AÑOS  D.  TRABAJAR EN SU PROPIO TERRENO CON AYUDA D. SU ESPOSO,E HIJOS Y POR TEMPORADA HOBREROS PARTICULARES. INVERTIRA EN SU AGRICULTURA PAGARA PARA QUE  MONTEN Y DESMONTEN EL TERRENO, YA QUE CUENTA CON SEMILLAS Y ABONO PARA REALIZAR SU SIEMBRA, ES NECESARIO PARA QUE TENGA BUENA COSECHA, Y AL FINAL Y ENTREGAR UN BUEN PRODUCTO.
DOÑA ELIDA T. Q., HA TENIDO 3 CREDITOS EN FAPE HA DEMOSTRADO RESPONSABILIDAD Y CAPACIDAD Y SOBRE TODO PUNTUALIDAD EN LOS PAGOS,  MENSUAL, Y SOBRE TODO LO QUE LE ENCANTA ES EL AHORRO FIJO QUE ME SOLICITA, PORQUE SIN DARME CUENTA ESTOY AHORRANDO Y ES UN DINERO QUE FAPE ME LO HA GUARDADO Y ESO ME ALEGRA PORQUE NO ESTA EN MIS MANOS Y LOGRO PAGAR MI CREDITO
texts.en:
“Las Rosas D. San Mateo” (The Roses of San Mateo) is located in the community of San Mateo Milpas Altas in Antigua Guatemala. This group was started eighteen months ago with twelve women who engage in agriculture, tortilla production, and livestock breeding. For this reason, they are utilizing loans from FAPE. The “Rosas D. San Mateo” Bank is in its fourth loan cycle with FAPE. Their leader is Doña Elida T.. She is married and has ten children, nine of whom still live with her in this small community. Six of her children are students at the local school while one lives in Antigua and has a degree in elementary school education. Doña Elida dreams that her children will continue their studies so that they can have better opportunities in the future. Her main business activity is farming. She has been growing green beans, Chinese peas, and Creole peas on her own land for ten years with the help of her husband, children, and seasonal workers. Elida will invest in her farming activities by paying to have her land plowed and cleared. She has the seeds and compost needed for planting because it is necessary for her to have a good harvest and produce a quality crop.

Doña Elida T. Q. has had three previous loans with FAPE and has demonstrated that she is responsible and prompt when making all of her monthly payments. Of all the services, she enjoys the established savings. She is happy with the money she keeps with FAPE because it stays out of her hands and it helps with repaying her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in farming activities

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic A. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Marivic owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marivic from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora. María Y. es socia del banco comunal Eugenio Espejo, vive en la comunidad de Narancay Bajo a unos 10 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca, en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, muchos encuentran en la ciudad un trabajo en fábricas, construcción etc., también han migrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor oportunidad de trabajo.
 
La Señora. María tiene 27 años,  es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad que están en la escuela, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña María trabaja como empleada domestica hace un año y tres meses, labora desde las nueve de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde.

Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y está contenta de formar parte de un gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras.  Su crédito lo va  a invertir  en la salud de su hija ya que se encuentra con una infección intestinal y los remedios son caros.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio propio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Ms. María Y. is a member of the Eugenio Espejo communal bank.  She lives in the community of Narancay Bajo, some 10 minutes from the city of Cuenca, where most people work in agriculture or animal husbandry.  Many people also find work in factories, doing construction, etc. in the city.  Some have also migrated to various places around the world in search of better work opportunities.

Ms. María is 27 years old, married, and has two children who are 7 and 4 years old.  The children are in school and her husband is a taxi driver.  They do not own their own house so they rent.

Doña María has worked as a domestic employee for one year and three months.  She works from nine in the morning until five in the afternoon.

This is her third loan through the communal bank and she is happy to be part of a great group of hard-working and enterprising women.  Her loan will be used towards her daughter's health, as she is suffering from an intestinal infection and the medicines are expensive.

Her goal is to have her own business selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her daughter, who is suffering from an intestinal infection

loans.name: Yolanda Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Yolanda Median de 72 años viuda y madre de 4 hijos en las edades de 41 a 54 años. Vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y se dedica a la elaboración de  muñecos de trapo y también vende mercancías variada mediante guías especializadas de productos.  Desde que le ofrecieron un curso de manualidades no dejó de confeccionar  muñecos, porque Yolanda es apasionada por esta   actividad que además le ha ayudado a generar ingresos, al mismo  tiempo que amparada en su clientela inicial, estimuló su vinculación al comercio mediante catálogos de productos. Ella es una comerciante ejemplar, transparente en sus negociaciones y esto le ha generado reconocimiento, por eso coordina un pequeño grupo de 3 vendedoras y también ha logrado buenos contratos con su muñequería. Este es el primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y  espera comprar telas y rellenos para fabricar muñecas encargadas para el 24 de Diciembre, fecha en que se celebra el nacimiento del niño Dios y   los niños esperan sus regalos del cielo; por eso Yolanda aprovecha para sacar sus mejores diseños y también para comprar la oferta de los productos en descuento que traen sus catálogos. Su sueño aun es perfeccionar su arte y lograr mayor dedicación y crecimiento de sus dos negocios, aunque su gran desafío es el poco dinero con el que cuenta y esta es la razón de recurrir a su credikiva para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Señora Yolanda Median is a 72 year old widow. She is the mother of 4 children, ages 41 to 54. She lives in the city of Cartagena and is engaged in the manufacture of cloth dolls. She also sells varied merchandise by means of specialized catalogues.

Since being offered a handicrafts course Yolanda hasn’t stopped making dolls because she is passionate about this activity. In addition, it has helped her generate income. While maintaining her initial clientele, she added to her customer base by means of product catalogues.

She is a model businesswoman, transparent in her dealings, and this has generated recognition. That’s why she coordinates a small group of three saleswomen and also has obtained good contracts with her doll making business.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she hopes to buy fabric and stuffing for dolls ordered for December 24, the date on which the birth of the son of God is celebrated and children await their Christmas gifts. This is the time when Yolanda puts out her best designs and also the time for the purchase of products offered at a discount in her catalogues. Her dream is to improve her art and achieve dedication and growth of her two businesses. Her greatest challenge is the small amount of money which she has, and this is the reason for resorting to a Kiva loan in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and stuffing for making dolls which have been ordered.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is a fifty-eight-year-old married man with nine children. He lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. Geofrey dreams of opening up a store for his farm produce and educating her children so that they can have a better future.

Geofrey wants a loan to pay labor for farmland clearing and to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.use: Paying labor for farmland clearing and buying seedlings for planting

loans.name: Katebo Business Group-Mpigi

texts.en: L. Steven's affiliation is with Katebo Business group-Mpigi. It has been 10 years now since he set forth in his Fishing and farming businesses in Katebo. Thinking back, Steven says it is his parents who gave him with reassuring pep talk to begin this business. Prior to that, he says he was more engaged in farming. Farming was something he really put effort into and as is the case with most African countries, it was his main means of livelihood. At length, he banked on savings from harvested crop sells to venture into the above mentioned businesses. Steven is happily married and has five kids. Monthly this business brings him 200,000 shillings and with this loan, he says he wants to purchase more equipment for his fishing business. Principally he says he wants to buy fishing nets and a boat.

loans.use: The purchase of fishing nets and a boat

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
