Nida T. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Nida is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to buy and sell

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn L. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Pangobilian, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a dried fish vending business and a variety store business. Her husband Ramonito, who is 35 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 1 and 14 years old. Jonalyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jonalyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,500, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use to buy a large volume and variety of dried fish so that she can continue to save up for the future renovation of their house. Jonalyn L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase plenty of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Irma Isabel

texts.es:
Irma tiene 57 años de edad, divorciada, tiene 3 hijos que ahora son profesionales ya que ella con mucho esfuerzo trabajó para sacarlos adelante.  Tienen una pequeña casa ubicada en Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la repostería desde hace 20 años, y todos los productos que ella prepara lo hace en un espacio exclusivo para esta actividad dentro de su casa.  Ella tiene muy buena sazón, por lo que cuenta actualmente con clientes que buscan deleitarse con sus postres.

Irma quiere comprar más insumos y poder preparar más postres y pasteles, para satisfacer la gran demanda que tiene, así maximizar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos por ellas.  Es por eso que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa para lograr su objetivo.  Ella ya ha tenido 2 créditos en nuestra entidad y ha cumplido puntualmente en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Irma is 57, divorced, and has 3 children who are now professionals because she has worked very hard to get them ahead. They have a small house in Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque Department.

She has been a baker for 20 years, and she makes all of her products in a space in her home dedicated exclusively to this activity. Her products are very tasty, so she has many customers looking to delight in her pastries.

Irma wants to buy more supplies and to be able to prepare more desserts and cakes in order to satisfy the great demand for her products. This will allow her to maximize her sales and make a better income. Thus, she has decided to request a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to achieve her goal. She has already had two loans with the institution, and has punctually completed her payments.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: La Srta. Noemi Y. H. vive en casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Santiago. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Tiene mas de 5 años en este negocio. Requiere el crédito para incrementar su negocio. La Srta. Noemi segun nos comenta desea incrementar su negocio y así poder formar su propio negocio. Ella está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Noemi Y. H. lives in her own home in the Santiago district and sells beauty products.  She’s been doing this for five years.  She needs this loan in order to grow this business so that she can eventually start her own business.  She is very grateful for the support she will be getting through this loan.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

She has operated an ice cream selling business for over two years, selling from home to school children. Florence's major challenge is seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a deep freezer for storing ice cream for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of its loan efficiency.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer for storing ice cream for sale.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a 53-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a sari-sari store and a tricycle transport business.  She lives in the municipality of Tuburan, Cebu. Liza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Liza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to purchase some goods for her sari-sari store so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Liza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

 About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.ar: هنادي في عمر 35 سنة متزوجة ولها 2 ولدان تعمل في صالون للحلاقة نسائي لها في عملها 3 سنوات تحب عملها وجيده ترغب في تحسين وضعها المادي والاجتماعي وتطوير عملها فهي نشيطة محبة للعمل تعمل بنشاط وحيوية لها خبرة في عملها تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى تحديث قسم جديد لتأجير الفساتين الخاصة بالسهرات + شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل مثل الشامبو وغيره هنادي تساعد عائلتها على تطوير نفسها فهي مجدة في طلب التقدم في العمل والحياة
texts.en: Hanadi is 35 years old and married with two children. She works in a women's hair salon, which she owns. She has owned her store for three years. She likes her work and has come to do it very well. She would like to improve her material and social position by developing her business, as she is an active woman who likes to work. She works very hard, and she has experience in her field. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she would like to both update the new section in her store where she rents out evening gowns, and buy new supplies for her store, such as shampoo. Through her seriousness about improving her personal and professional life, Hanadi helps her family develop themselves as well

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her hair salon as well as buy new rental dresses for the dress-rental section of her salon

loans.name: Mayra Beatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mayra, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y  5 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer. Nuestra amiga lleva en el Banco Comunal tres ciclos y le gustan las reuniones y las charlas educativas.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal, Esika y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días por las mañanas, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Nos cuenta que lleva 5 años en esta actividad y que fue una amiga que la impulso a dedicarse a este tipo de ventas y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos de todas las marcas que vende.

Su sueño es comprarse un carro para realizar más ventas.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto meets every two weeks in the Circunvalación neighborhood in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches. Many domestic and foreign tourists visit these beaches throughout the year. Manta is one of the most important ports in Ecuador and in the Americas. It is located on the Pacific Ocean.

This is where we met Mayra, a 29-year-old married woman. She and her husband have two children together, a ten year old and a five year old. Both children are in school. Her husband works as a driver. This is our friend Mayra's third loan cycle with the Banco Comunal. She enjoys the bank's meetings and educational talks.

Mayra is a housewife. She makes some money for herself by selling Yanbal, Esika and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She works every morning selling these products door to door. She sells her products on credit and collects payment every week. She told us she has been doing this job for five years now. A friend of hers convinced her to begin selling these products and it has worked out well for her.

She plans to use this loan to buy perfume, lotion, cosmetics and other products from all the brands that she sells. She would like to buy a car one day in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lotion, cosmetics and other Avon, Yanbal and Esika products.

loans.name: Women In Active Group

texts.en:
50 year-old Mustafah M. has been a member of Women in Active group for the last 17 years. The father of 5 was previously in a retail business. He says he used savings from his retail shop to start up his current poultry business, which he operates from Mbiko in Lugazi. He says being steadfast, hardworking, and dynamic have been his calling cards.  He says his profits total up to 480,000 shillings a month. Mbiko is a favorite stop-over for refreshments for many people traveling from Eastern Uganda and Kenya. 

Mustafah says he is going to use this loan to purchase more mash for his chickens and also more chickens to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more mash for his chickens and also more chickens to sell

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron K. C. is a man of fifty-six years, and is the married father of seven. He lives in Mosop on the outskirts of Eldoret town. His wife Salome is a teacher and adds to the family income.  Haron is a maize farmer and has been in this business for twenty-one years now. He gets a monthly income of about $188.


This will be Haron's 4th loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the income he is going to get he wants to pay school fees for his children and also plow some back into his farming business. 


In future Haron wants to educate his children and also continue with his farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maize seedlings.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es un cliente de 34 años de edad, vive en casa de padres ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz –  Chiclayo. Ésta es una comunidad urbana en vías de crecimiento gracias a las gestiones gubernamentales.

Olga goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales manifestadas por vecinos y amigos, que la catalogan como una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora.

Olga se dedica a brindar un servicio de transporte público. Ella cuenta con una mototaxi (moto con una cabina en la parte trasera  donde se pueden transportar pasajeros) la cual alquila desde la puerta de su casa a clientes conocidos. Además de ello, Olga obtiene ingresos adicionales por ejercer las funciones de cosmetóloga en un local ubicado en el mercado más conocido de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Dichas actividades las viene realizando hace más de 3 años.

Olga solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para el mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular, para reparar rodajes y cabina de ésta.

Olga espera tener una flota de 5 motos para así incrementar sus ingresos y por consiguiente mejorar su calidad de vida. Es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa y cuenta con buenas referencias crediticias.
texts.en:
Olga is 34 years old.  She lives in her parents' home which is located in José Leonardo Ortiz-Chiclayo district.  This is an urban community which is developing thanks to the government's work. 

Olga has good personal and work references from neighbors and friends who describe her as a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.

Olga provides a public transport service.  She owns a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with a cabin in back for transporting passengers) which she hires out from her front door to known customers.  She also makes additional income by working as a cosmetologist in premises which are located in the best-known market in the city of Chiclayo.  She has been engaged in these business activities for more than three years.

Olga is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can have some maintenance work done on her vehicle.  She would like to repair the wheels and the cabin.

Olga hopes to eventually own a fleet of five motorcycles so that she can increase her income and thereby improve her quality of life.  She is a repeat client of Edpyme Alternativa and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to repair the wheels and the cabin of her motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 57 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelita has a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store.

Nelita has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Okyeso Nyame (Kajebir) Group

texts.en: Esther is the leader (in the blue blouse and white skirt) of this group and sells travel bags and other kinds of bags at Takoradi. She has been in this trade for three years. Esther is a single parent, taking care of one child. She is responsible for the upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a shop.

loans.use: to buy more bags for resale.

loans.name: Frelly Roxana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Mundo Natural.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Frelly, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, el marido es dueño de un taxi y un camión.

Ella para obtener sus propios ingresos y no depender de nadie se dedica en sus ratos libres al comercio, vende productos por catalogo como: ropa, zapatillas y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y  trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las tardes cuando esta mas desocupada, ella  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en el centro en una distribuidora. Tiene cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes tanto para damas como para caballeros ya que son muy buenos comenta.
	
Este crédito es para comprar zapatillas, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva cuatro años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en: The members of Mi Mundo Natural ("My Natural World") Community Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, which has been known as the "City of Royal Tamarind Trees" since colonial times. Here we find Frelly, who is 25 years old, married and has a 3-year-old son. Her husband owns a taxi and a truck. In order to earn her own income and not be dependent upon anyone, Frelly works as a merchant in her free time, selling products such as clothing, footwear and Yanbal-brand cosmetics via catalog. She sells door to door and works three days a week, most often in the afternoons when she is less busy. She sells the products on credit and collects every week or 15 days, depending on what her customers want. Frelly tells us that her best sellers are her perfumes and colognes since they are really good. She plans to use this loan to purchase footwear, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing. She has been with the community bank for four years and likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase footwear, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Willis

texts.en:
Willis is 33 years old. He is married with a 2-year-old child. He sells shoes to earn a living, and has employed two people. He has been in the business for eight years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been empowered economically and has grown his business.  

Willis hopes to become a well-established businessman in the future. He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es:
Serapio, vive con su esposa y dos nietos de 13 y 4 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 40 años, aprendió a sembrar frijoles, maíz, caña de azúcar y piña, su horario de trabajo es de 5:00am a 2:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes para la siembra, que le ayudan a fortalecer el cultivo, dando un cuido adecuado para esperar una buena cosecha.
Su objetivo en un futuro es aplicar a sus hijos en la agricultura, trabajando en las tierras para no perder la costumbre de la familia.
texts.en:
Serapio lives with his wife, and two grandchildren who are 13 and 4.  He has been farming for 40 years.  He learned to grow beans, corn, sugar cane and pineapples.  His work hours are 5.00am to 2.00pm.

Serapio is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers.  This will help him to strengthen his crops, providing them with appropriate care so that he can expect a good harvest.  His future goal is to have his children work in agriculture, working on the land, so that they don't lose their family custom.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his corn crops

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba makes Fante kenkey, fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves, to sell. She is divorced and has five children. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy maize to make kenkey. She hopes to use the profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase maize to make kenkey for resale.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
At the age of 24, Benjie got married. He is now 32 years old with two children. He is married to a hard-working and loving wife, Analyn. They always seem to look for a better way of life for their family, and that's why they did not stick only in the farming business.

Benjie operates his tricycle for passenger transport, which serves as an extra source of income to him. He has also managed his hog-raising business for five years. His hog-raising business is not stable because of his financial status. Actually, Benjie wants to continue his hog-raising business, because it was temporarily stopped.

Last month, Benjie sold his hogs. He is not able to buy piglets, because his earnings went to the hospitalization of and medicine for their child who is suffering an illness. Thus, Benjie is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy piglets to raise. He looks forward to the success of his business.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Judith has a shop that sells frozen foods like hot dogs, bacon and sausages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional frozen foods to sell. 

Judith has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 29 years old and married. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Loida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other supplies for farming. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies for farming.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto  tiene 40 años vive en Unión Libre tiene un hij,  vive con la conyugue y el hijo de tres años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol gandúl. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol gandúl y compra de insumos y fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas, para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder superarse y llegar a tener un negocio de venta de ropa para poderlo administrar.

En los tiempos libres le gusta leer los textos coómo ser un buen líder..
texts.en:
40 year old Carlos Alberto lives with his partner and their three year old son in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. 
The members of the “SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS” communal bank are located in Amarillos which belongs to Ventanas Canton. They are short-cycle corn and rice farmers. 
Carlos is a farmer and grows corn, rice, and beans. He buys his products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well. 
He is requesting the loan to plant corn, rice, and beans, and to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for his crops. Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs. The challenges he faces are infestations of pests, crop diseases, and the variations in the weather. His dream is to get ahead and to have a clothes store to manage. 
In his free time, he likes to read so that he will be a good leader.

loans.use: to sow rice and beans and to buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Musitati Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Musitati Group in Western Kenya! This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Eunice is the facilitator of the Musitati group. She takes care of five children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Eunice had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eunice was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eunice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Eunice will pay for school fees and basic needs for her family.
In 2012, the members of Musitati group will each plant  between half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vohid

texts.ru: Вохид возраст 25 лет, холост. Он самостоятельный, ответственный молодой человек. Работает Вохид в сфере транспортных услуг водителем микроавтобуса, которую он арендует. Он перевозит пассажиров с одного населенного пункта на другой. Вохид выполняет свою работу хорошо и среди водителей имеет хорошую репутацию. Он очень самостоятельный и у него большие планы на будущее. Вохид хочет получить займ на сумму $2000 США для покупки микроавтобуса. Этот займ поможет сделать самостоятельный шаг в развитие собственного бизнеса. Вохид надеется на вашу поддержку и благодарит вас за помощь
texts.en: Vohid is 25 years old, he is a bachelor. He is an independent and responsible young man. Vohid works in the field of transportation services as a driver of a minibus which he rents. He transports passengers from one location to another. Vohid does his job well and has a good reputation among his fellow drivers. He is a self-suficient man and has big plans for the future. Vohid wants to take out a loan in the amount $2,000 USD to buy a minibus. This loan will help him make an independent step in the growth of his own business. Vohid hopes for everyone's support and thanks for the help.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Perseveranda

texts.en:
This is Perseveranda, 45, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a mother of 3 children and her husband, Emeterio, is a vendor. Two of her children are in college while the youngest is in high school. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Perseveranda operates a business selling accessories. She buys accessory products from wholesalers, repackages them and then sells them for a profit. Customers are attracted to the low selling prices and the many products that she offers. Her regular customers are neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as a result.  

Perseveranda hopes to have a stall in the market and dreams of being able to give all of her children a high quality education through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more accessory items for resale

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo, de 52 años, es una hombre muy bueno, honesto y trabajador. Es padre soltero de cuatro hijos de los cuales solo tres viven con él, ya que uno de ellos es mayor de edad y tiene su propia familia. El trabajo de Domingo consiste en el de transporte de carga y pasajero dentro y fuera de la ciudad, es una trabajo que le ha brindado muchos beneficios, entre ellos el crecimiento económico y la estabilidad del ingreso a su hogar. Lleva trabajando con su vehiculo ya por siete años, lo hace solo, y hasta el momento posee tres unidades y uno lo maneja él y los otros dos manejan sus dos hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para poder hacer sus cosas personales, además le permite disponer de su horario. Sin embargo su vehñiculos se 
empiezan a deteriorar y tiene que estar en constante mantenimiento mecánico. Este será el sexto crédito con la institución MFP, siempre se caracterizó dentro de su grupo como una persona muy puntual. Está feliz por la oportunidad que le darán para poder realizar una buena inversión, además está seguro de poder seguir cancelando sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado, comprará piezas y repuestos para su mototaxi, también le hace falta un cambio total de llantas, tapizado de los asiento y del toldo, además desea asegurar sus vehículos.
texts.en:
Domingo, 52, is a very good, honest and hardworking man.  He’s a single father of four children.  Only three of them live with him because one of them is an adult and has his own family.  Domingo’s work consists in transporting cargo and passengers within and outside the city.  It’s a job that has brought him many benefits among which is economic growth and stable income for his home.  He’s been working with his vehicle for seven years; he works alone.  To date he owns three units.  He operates one of them and the other two are operated by his two sons.  What he likes about the work is that it leaves time for him to do his personal things plus it lets him manage his own time.

However, his vehicles are starting to wear down and need constant mechanical service.  This will be his 6th MFP loan.  He always stood out in his group as a very punctual person.  He’s happy for the opportunity he’ll be given to make a good investment.  Besides, he’s sure that he will be able to continue making his installment payments on time like he’s been doing to date.  He will use the requested amount to buy spare parts for his mototaxi.  It also needs to have a complete tire replacement, the seats need to be upholstered and it needs a shade; he also needs to insure his vehicles.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, tires, to upholster the seats, to buy a shade and insurance.

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es: el señor  Cristhian por incentivo de sus padres abrió su foto estudio hace varios años atrás es soltero no tiene hijos y vive en la casa de sus papas durante todo este tiempo demostró ser muy trabajador y responsable ayudando en la economía de su familia y dando ejemplo a sus hermanos menores  por las noches estudia photoshop en un instituto esto le ayuda mucho en su trabajo de revelado y ediciones de fotos su estudio fotográfico se encuentra ubicado cerca de la plaza principal de sacaba el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una cámara filmadora profesional que le servirá para renovarse y realizar mejores trabajos porque tiene mucha demanda de clientes por sus excelentes trabajos y también por estas fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Sr. Cristhian was encouraged by his parents to open his photo studio several years ago. He is single, has no children, and lives at the home of his parents. Throughout this time, he has demonstrated that he is extremely hardworking and responsible in helping with the family finances. He also sets an example for his younger siblings. At night, he studies Photoshop at an institute which has helped him in his work of developing and editing photos in his studio. His business is located near the main square.

The loan he is receiving will be invested in the purchase of a professional video camera, which will help him obtain and perform better jobs because there is great demand among his customers for his excellent work. This will also enable him to be equipped for the year-end parties.

loans.use: to buy a professional video camera.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells maize porridge and bread at Besease near Elmina. Esther is married to a farmer and has five children. She has been selling maize porridge, fish and kenkey for fifteen years. She uses her income to support her husband in paying utility bills. Ama will use her loan to purchase bulk maize. With the new profit Esther will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk maize.

loans.name: Maria Eduarda

texts.es:
María, quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio por eso solicita un préstamo para comprar una nueva bicicleta de carga, que le permitan mejorar la distribución de sus productos y mercaderia, y atender a más clientela con la intención de que también sus ganancias sean mejores clientes estén satisfechos con el servicio.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo de sus préstamos anteriores manteniéndose en el negocio, proveyendo para su familia todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Maria wants to continue to grow her business. For this reason, she is applying for a loan to buy a new cargo bicycle, which will allow her to improve the delivery of her products and mechandise and to attend to more clientele. Alongside increasing her profits, her intention is that her customers will be satisfied with the service she offers. 

Her previous loans have had a positive effect on Maria, allowing her to maintain the business and to provide her family with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 49-year-old woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children. 

Huda is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to do maintenance on her home with an aspiration to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her home

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aileen is 52 years old and has three of her children are in school.

Aileen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Aileen requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Aileen has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Lucio tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, él nació en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad donde nació. Lucio se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano en la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad Lucio requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea desea para la canasta familiar ósea para alimentación de la familia.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza" [New Hope] community bank is made up of responsible and hardworking people who are trying to get their families ahead.  The majority of the members live and work in the city of Cusco.  Cusco is known for its tourism, businesses, the traditional celebration of Inti Raymi, and because it is located near one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

Lucio is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  He was born in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco and he lives in the beautiful city where he was born.  Lucio works providing taxi service in the city of Cusco.  He is requesting this loan for personal use so that he can purchase food for his family.

loans.use: to purchase food for his family.

loans.name: Donya

texts.en:
Donya is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her mother.

Donya is 20 years old and a married woman, a mother of one child. She lives in Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Donya is looking to have a loan of 800 JDs so she can buy more makeup, clothes, perfumes and cosmetcs in order to expand her general trading.

Donya is under 30 years old so her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, clothes and makeup for trading

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José es un hombre muy honesto y responsable,  reside con su esposa, y su hijo en la zona occidental del país.  José es muy conocido en su lugar de residencia, los vecinos lo conocen por su forma de ser, se dedica al cultivo de cereales como: Arroz, Trigo, Avena entre otros, pero también como trabajo extra se dedica hacer mandador es decir una persona que esta a cargo por temporadas de la administración en una finca. El esta muy a gusto con su trabajo y siempre lo ha hecho de la mejor  manera pero siente la necesidad de extender un poco mas sus cosechas y no cuenta con los recursos propios para hacerlo, es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un prestamo para la compra de insumos básicos como: pesticidas, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes entre otros, espera así que podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y a su hijo.

loans.use: para la compra de insumos básicos como: pesticidas, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes entre otros.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rainforest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Joseph is married, and has seventeen children. All of the adult members of his family help out on his farm, and he is currently growing maize, beans, vegetables and passion fruit, as well as tending to a tree plantation. Interestingly, Joseph is the brother of Honey Care Kiva borrowers Vincent, Peter and Francis. 

This is Joseph’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to educate his children, and buy a cow. His dream for the future is “to own a pickup truck and have money to take good care of my family.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Coro De Angeles Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores uno de ellos es Juan hombre  de 49 años de edad, acompañado, con tres hijos de 18, 16 años y 8 meses, su negocio es la compra y venta de calzado en su comunidad y por encargo desde hace 5 meses. El crédito lo solicita para comprar más inventario de zapatos de diferentes estilos de damas y varón y comprar una paca de ropa usada. Marbely mujer de 23 años de edad su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y Alexandra mujer de 22 años de edad y su negocio es la compra y venta de accesorios de plata.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial members. 

One of them is Juan, a 49 year old man with a domestic partner and three children aged 18,16 and 8 months. 

He sells and buys footwear in his community. And for the past five months he also takes requests by order. 

He is requesting a loan to increase his shoe inventory in different styles for men and women and to buy a bale of used clothes. 

Marbely, 23, sells cosmetics and Alexandra, 22, buys and sells silver accessories.

loans.use: to increase his shoe inventory in different styles for men and women and to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with eight (8) children specializes in the sales of food items. She started her business in the year 1982. According to her if given the above amount, it will improve her business tremendously.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora, like most women, works in a flea market. She sells her own Samoan handicrafts and clothes, plus other things like hair accessories and footwear. Her husband earns some money, and together they make a good profit in a week. This way they can improve their housing conditions and meet other family needs.

loans.use: To purchase sandals, clothes, stationary, school fees, timber, an iron roof.

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Han C. is a mother of three children. She is 45 years old and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a seamstress and makes very little money from this business. Meanwhile, her husband is a motor-taxi driver and sometimes assists her brother in selling rice crops. He typically makes around $7/day in revenue. One of her children works at the garment factory and contributes her income once a month to the household. The other two children are students. Han hopes to use the loan to purchase a motorcycle and more clothes for her business. One day Chanthy hopes to own a rice crop shop.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to run a business.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang Khim is a 46 year-old mother of 1 child.  She lives with her husband (pictured here) in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a vendor at a market, while her husband works as a dentist. Together, they make on average $13/day. Her husband needs more dental tools for use in his dental surgery, but faces financial constraints.  She has applied for this loan of $1000 to help him grow his business.

loans.use: Needs more dental tools for use in her husband's surgery.

loans.name: Dum

texts.en: Mrs. Dum S. is 57 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Dum S. currently earns $4 a day selling the vegetable morning glory at a local market. Her husband earns $3 a day breeding ducks. Dum S. would like to use this loan to expand her husband's business, as this will increase the family's total income. She intends to use the $700 to purchase more ducks.

loans.use: To purchase ducks

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is married and has a little daughter named Alina. Their family lives in Khoost, in western Ukraine. Yuliya is a private entrepreneur who sells women’s outer wear in the central city market. Her vending spot is well-known in the market for having high-quality inventory. Yuliya has had good experience working as a market vendor. She started her own venture only two years ago; presently, her turnover capital is a little over $3000, and her monthly net profit is about $1500.

Yuliya can boast of a good reputation with other market entrepreneurs and her customers. Her business is stable and profitable. Yuliya is ready to work even harder because she loves what she’s doing and it offers her family stability and confidence for the future. Yuliya is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase her inventory, and her sales and income as a result.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.en: Ahmadjon A. has been an active client of Microinvest since 2005.  Ahmadjon is married with three children. He implements the commercial services by holding the national “Oshkhona” in the bazaar. Ahmadjon is a very respectable family man and his family welfare is very important to him.  He requires a loan for a cow purchase to increase the selling of milk products.

loans.use: Cow purchase to increase the selling of milk products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her inventory, particularly with beach clothing and items

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
We find Alejandra and her charming husband located in front of a school in the city of Ayaviri, offering a wiD. variety of sweets, cookies, sodas, etc. for sale to the students and other pedestrians in said city. Alejandra is 56 years old and her loving husband is 71. They always have been entrepreneurial and hardworking people; both are from Ayaviri. Since starting their family, they dedicated themselves to working the land, a noble enterprise that helped them educate their son who is now a professional and living independently. They retired from this labor when they found it became too physically demanding as they grew older. For this reason, they decided to invest their savings and start a business selling snacks/sweets. This activity brings them much joy, as it provides them with financial stability and peace. The wish of this humble couple is to prosper in this endeavor and, to do this, they are considering purchasing another tricycle/tram and additional products with which to expand their sales efforts. Let’s help seal the plans of this loving couple.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Frente a un colegio D. la ciudad D. Ayaviri ubicamos a doña Alejandra y a su encantador esposo Patricio ofreciendo gran variedad D. golosinas, galletas, gaseosas, etc. a los estudiantes D. dicho centro D. estudios y transeúntes en general.Alejandra D. 56 años y su amoroso esposo D. 71 años D. edad siempre fueron personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, ambos son D. la ciudad D. Ayaviri y desD. que formaron su familia se dedicaron ha labrar la tierra, con este noble oficio educaron a su hijo, quien ahora es profesional e independiente, dejaron esta labor porque ya no cuentan con la misma fuerza física D. antes, es por esa razón que decidieron invertir el ahorro que tenían e incursionar en el negocio D. venta D. golosinas, esta actividad les viene generando mucha alegría porque les está permitiendo obtener bienestar económico y tranquilidad.El deseo D. esta humilD. pareja es prosperar con este oficio, para eso tiene pensado adquirir otro triciclo y mayor cantidad D. productos con el fin D. ampliar su mercado. Ayudemos a concretar los planes D. esta amorosa pareja.

loans.use: Purchase a tricycle/tram and additional merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in greater variety of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Ireny

texts.en:
Ireny is 30 years old and the mother of two sons, ages 7 and 8. For seven years, she has been operating a beauty parlor in the Itabo community of San Cristobal. Ireny has acquired a lot of experience through this long time of offering her services to people of her community. She offers services of manicure, pedicure, haircut, hair straightening, nail cut and the like.

The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy more products to keep operating her business and attending to her customers. Ireny hopes that her business can continue growing so that she becomes the most famous beauty parlor owner in her community.

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of products for a beauty parlor

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is an independent, single woman who saw in the shoe sale-by-catalog business an opportunity to generate extra income since her regular salary job paid her too little and did not provide an income that was satisfactory. She started out selling to friends and then she became more popular thanks to their recommendation.

She is requesting a credit line in the amount of US$250 which will be repaid in 3 months. It will be used to purchase new merchandise. With your help, Beatriz can continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Beatriz es una mujer soltera e independiente que inicio su negocio de venta de zapatos por catalogo porque vio la oportunidad de ganar dinero extra, ya que el trabajo que tenia en una empresa no le ofrece suficiente sin ingresos, porque pagan muy poco. Comenzó vendiendo entre sus conocidos y así se fue dando a conocer gracias a la recomendación de estos.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía nueva. Con tu ayuda Beatriz saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Mrs. Narin H. lives in Trapaing Bey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She sells Chinese noodles in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Piseth Chhem, is a policeman in the province. They have four children, one of whom works as a security guard while another one is employed in a garment factory. The remaining two study in the state school.

Although the family members have different business activities and jobs, their living conditions have not improved. To help improve their standard of living, Mrs. Narin H. is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell in the market as a new business. Mrs. Narin H. previously obtained a loan from AMK to buy pigs for breeding.

(Mrs Narin H.'s husband is pictured on the right in the photo.)

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell in the market as a new business.

loans.name: Valelia

texts.en:
Valelia S., 49, is married and has 4 children. She has many years of experience growing and selling taro and bananas. She sells to the villagers and the public 2 days per week.

Valelia is a very active woman who puts all of her energy into her business because it is her family's major source of income. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for her plantation, such as chemicals, a back sprayer, fertilizer, and bush knives. She would also like to use part of the loan to purchase supplies and tools (such as bricks, cement, galvanized nails, and a hammer) to make some home repairs.

She expects to earn a weekly profit of 300 Tala (about 125 USD). She had 3 previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Valelia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, back sprayer, fertilizer, bush knives for the taro and banana plantation

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Since joining TYM in 2001, all of Mrs. L.'s previous loan (including the first loan of 2 million VND) has been used on breeding pigs. After 7 years of hard work, her family's economy has stabL. and she has been abL. to expand the business. Currently, her family has create a pond in her yard to breed fishes as well as breeding pigs and ducks. With the help of her husband and two grown up son, the business has achieved a lot of success. Mrs. L. would like to borrow 16 million VND to invest in her farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001, với số cốn vay ban đầu là 2.000.000đ chị Lễ đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Đến nay qua 7 năm tham gia Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị đã ổn định và anh chị đã có điều kiện mở rộng chăn nuôi theo mô hình trang trại. Hiện tại gia đình chị đã chuyển đổi 1 mẫu đất đào ao thả cá kết hợp nuôi lợn, vịt. Công việc của gia đình chị hiện rất ổn định và cho thu nhập cao. Chồng chị ngoài thời gian công tác tại xã cũng giành nhiều thời gian để giúp gia đình chăn nuôi, các con của chị đều đã lớn và có thể giúp đỡ bố mẹ trong phát triển kinh tế gia đình.Chị Lế đang mong muốn được vay 16.000.000 để đầu tư vào trang trại của gia đình.

loans.use: Invest in her farm

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 36 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos; Maribel de 18 y Yubiley de 7, quienes aún son estudiantes.
Se viene dedicando a tiempo completo a atender su tienda de comestibles, desde que migró desde su pueblo natal, hacia la ciudad, decidió abrir este negocio para mantener a sus dos hijos, los cuales demandaban gastos de estudio, alimentación y salud. Ya son siete años en el negocio, tiempo en el cual, Lucia ha ganado experiencia y viene desarrollando su trabajo con mucha alegría, ya que a ella le gusta todo sobre su tienda, lo malo es que no puede pasar mucho tiempo con sus hijos, como ella quisiera.
Lucia quiere que sus hijos estudien y puedan migrar a una ciudad grande, donde puedan tener un mejor porvenir. 
Con el dinero del préstamo implementará su tienda con más mercadería, y que en el futuro mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucia is 36 years old, a single mother of two children; Maribel, who is 18, and Yubiley, who is 7 years old. Both are still students. She works full-time serving in her food store. Since she migrated from the town where she was born to the city, she decided to open this business in order to support her two children, and to cover school, food and healthcare expenses. She has had her business for seven years, in which time Lucia has gained experience and carried out her work very happily. She likes everything about her shop, the only bad thing is that she cannot spend as much time with her children as she would like to. Lucia wants her children to study and to move to a big city, where they can have a better future. With the money from the loan she will fill her store with more merchandise, so that she can increase her future income.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias  V. cuenta con 22 años, es casado no tiene  hijo, vive en pareja con la señora Maria Elizabet Ozuna. Vive en una casa en alquiler que viven mas de 4 años.
Elias es propietario de un taller mecanico, que esta situada actualmente en el barrio Obrero de la ciudad de Pilar entre las calles Alberzoni esq. Manuel Dominguez, lugar donde se realiza trabajos de reparaciones de vehiculos en general, motocicletas, todo tipo de trabajo, cuenta con servicio de auxilio las 24 horas. Esta en el ramo mas de 6 años dando sus servicios a la comunidad en general. Elias nos manifesto que en poco tiempo pudo mejorar sus ingresos y a la ves ofrecerle mayor comodidad a su familia ya que su número de clientes se a incrementado. El deseo de Elias es poder más adelante contar con una ampliación o  una sucursal para poder satisfacer la necesidad de su gran clientela.
texts.en:
Elias V. is 22 years old and married to Mrs. Maria Elizabet Ozuna. They do not have children. Elias has lived in the same home, which he rents, for more than four years. Elias owns an auto repair shop, located in the Obrero neighborhood of the city of Pilar, between Alberzoni and Manuel Dominguez streets. Elias does all kinds of repairs, including motorcycles and vehicles in general. He has an attendant at the shop 24 hours per day. Elias has been doing repairs in the community for more than six years. He told us that the number of clients is growing, and in a little while he'll be able to increase his income and make his family more comfortable. In the future, Elias hopes to expand his shop or open a new branch, in order to satisfy the needs of his many clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a compressor for the shop

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat baji, the wife of A. H., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house where she has been living for the past 20 years. She got married after completing the 8th standard grade. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her eldest son works in a workshop. Her younger son is 12 years old. Her daughter, who is 18 years old, stays at home and does household work. 

Mussarat baji’s husband is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mussarat baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. 

Mussarat baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

She is joined in her loan group by five more members. Samina baji and Uzma baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. Shahida baji wants a loan to buy utensils (plates, glass and spoons) for her hotel (food) business. Ghafooran baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
At the young age of 26, Evelyn C. began finding her niche in the world of business. She is a single mother from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato, who pushed herself to be strong despite the many challenges she encountered.

Sitting in her favorite chair in their living room, she confidently shared her experiences with early motherhood. In an interview she said, “life has never been easy for me, especially now that I have a huge responsibility to my child. I have to wake up early every morning at the same time to earn a living and survive."

She now runs a hog-raising business. She started her project with only one sow, but now earns a profit for every piglet she sells. This profit goes to pay family expenditures, a big help in covering her family's needs. She is requesting a loan to buy feed for her hogs. 

Her youthful exuberance drove her to join CEV. Now she has access to the credit assistance, training and insurance benefits that our organization provides.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma owns a junk shop in their community and is married to Rolly who is a tricycle driver. They were blessed with four children namely: Aubrey- 2 years old, Myka- 4 years old, Ronez- 6 years old and Adrian- 7 years old, and they are all in elementary school. 

With only a small capital, Norma was able to start her own junk shop.  She buys materials that can be recycled like empty bottles, scrap metals, galvanized iron, plastic bottles and wares in their community and other nearby villages. 

Aside from the junk shop, she also manages her bakery store in the village. This serves as their other source of income. She is currently in need of a machine to be used in her bakeshop but does not have excess money to buy one. She is applying for a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 to acquire machine and employ a helper in her junk shop. 
	
She strongly believes that God gave mercy to those who really walk righteously and work diligently. So, Norma and her husband are working hand in hand in order to survive and prepare for the future of their children by giving them a good education.

loans.use: buy machine and employ a helper

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a member of the Imasumacc (“How Beautiful” in Quechua) Village Bank. Florentina is 50 years old and is married with three children. She has a stand in the Nery Garcia Market, where she sells vegetables both in bulk and per kilo. She works seven days a week. Florentina also fattens up cows on her land in the district of Sachabamba.  Florentina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy food for the her cows. Florentina’s dreams are for her children to graduate with professional degrees, to have more livestock, and to produce milk and cheese. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Florentina es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en quechua.
Florentina es casada, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Florentina tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en  donde vende verduras al por mayor y menor, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Florentina se dedica al engorde de vacuno en sus tierras de Sachabamba. 
Florentina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el engorde de vacuno. 
Los sueños de Florentina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener mas ganado y producir leche y queso.

loans.use: Buying cow feed

loans.name: Tuache Uvivu Group

texts.en:
Kamaria has been a bread, nut, katles and juice seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $550. Every day she works at her business for 16 hours. She is requesting loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more breads, nuts, katles and juice for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business to save money and pay school fees for their children.

Kamaria is 47 years old, married, and has four children aged 24, 22, 9 and 5. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Zaina and Asha. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more food (breads, nuts, katles and juice) for her business.

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: Ce dame habite le quartier d’adidogomé est une revendeuse de produits cosmétiques et de beauté dans son quartier,elle fait son commerce dans sa boutique qu’elle a appelée EXTENSION 3000, elle est divorcée de son époux , et elle a deux enfants. Avec ce qu’elle gagne et l’appui financier de son mari elle arrive à subvenir convenablement aux charges de ses enfants. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 1992, actuellement elle a besoin d’agrandir son stock de produits de beauté c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de wages un crédit qui est son premier
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Adidogomé district. She is a retailer of cosmetics and beauty products in her area. She does commerce in her shop she calls “EXTENSION 3000”. She has been in this business since 1992. She is divorce from her husband and has two children. With what she earns plus the financial support from her husband, she manages to provide for her children appropriately. Currently she needs to expand her stock of beauty products. That’s why she’s requesting from WAGES a loan, which is her first one.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Cipriano Nilo

texts.es: El Sr. Cipriano Nilo A. P. quedo huérfano de padre a los meses de recién nacido, se crió con su abuela, solamente curso hasta el 2do básico de escolaridad, se caso a los 17 años de edad, tiene 9 hijos, actualmente solo 2 dependen de él, trabajo como ayudante de albañil, albañil y hace años que se dedica a la venta y colocado de tepes (césped tipo alfombra),  junto con su esposa, es un trabajo difícil ya que ellos personalmente tienen que recoger el tepe con cuidado y con mucho esfuerzo físico. Es un cliente con mucha humildad y con muchas ganas de trabajar.
texts.en:
Cipriano Nilo A. P. lost his father when he was just a few months old and was raised by his grandmother. He studied only up to second grade. He got married when he was 17 and has 9 children, but only 2 are still supported by him. He works as a bricklayer and a bricklayer´s assistant, and some years ago began selling and installing sod (grass cut like a carpet) along with his wife. It is hard work as they have to gather up the sod carefully and it takes a lot of physical effort. He is one of Emprender´s most humble clients and very eager to work.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a used vehicle.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene N. is 37 years old, married to Julio N.; and together they have three children. She has been a PDP-LP member since 2000 and is a good and loyal member of the Paglaum Coop. Arlene pays her obligations on time. In fact, she already made more than ten loan availments and has never missed a single payment. She keeps her little "carenderia" (restaurant) to support her husband's income as well as the day-to-day needs of the family.

loans.use: To purchase stocks for her food vending

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 44 year old woman who lives with her husband and their five children in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Mona has been working as a seamstress for twenty years.

She requested a loan of 500 U.S. dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her sewing. This is the first time that Mona has requested a loan.

Mona is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had to face the competition. In the future, she plans on expanding her business by opening a shop.

loans.use: To purchase thread for her sewing

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
A. Julienne est née à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Julienne est mariée à DJOTCHOU Nounangnon un pêcheur de profession. Julienne est mère de six enfants mais seulement deux (2) sont encore à sa charge. Julienne n’est jamais allée à l’école. Julienne a été élevée par sa grand-mère paternelle pour qui elle vendait de la pâte de maïs et de poissons frits. La pâte de maïs localement appelée akassa, accompagnée de piment et de poissons frits est un repas consommé par beaucoup de béninois. Après son mariage, Julienne s'est mise à son propre compte dans la même activité que sa grand-mère. Julienne a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé pour le compte de son activité. Julienne demande un troisième prêt à ALIDé pour acheter et stocker de maïs pendant que c’est moins cher. Ainsi, Julienne pourra faire plus de bénéfices sur ses ventes. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Julienne A. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Julienne is married to Nounangnon Djotchou, a fisherman by profession. Julienne is the mother of six children, but only two of them are still in her care. Julienne never went to school. Julienne was raised by her paternal grandmother, for whom she sold maize paste and fried fish. Maize paste, locally known as "akassa", accompanied by spices and fried fish, is a meal consumed by many Beninese. After getting married, Julienne began working on her own in the same business as her grandmother. Julienne has already benefited from two loans through Alidé on behalf of her business. Julienne is seeking a third loan from Alidé to buy and stock maize while it is cheaper. This way, Julienne will be able to make a higher profit on her sales. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, the local language of Benin is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, where the GDP per capita is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 bags of maize and one box of fresh fish

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria O. Q. tiene un puesto de venta de refresco de linaza y empanadas desde hace once años en la zona San Carlos del Mercado La Cancha, necesita comprarse una maquina para moler la linaza ya que actualmente muele la linaza con una herramienta manual y esto le esta afectando a su salud. Es separada, sus hijos ya son mayores pero les ayuda con los nietos. Vive en casa de su hijo.
texts.en:
Señora Victoria O. Q. has an empañadas and linseed soft drink stall. She has had this stall for 11 years in the neighbourhood San Carlos del Mercado La Cancha. She needs to buy a machine to crush the linseed, as she currently mashes the linseed with a manual tool and this is affecting her health. She is separated. Her children are already grown up, but she helps them with her nieces and nephews. She lives in her son’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a machine to process linseed

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: khady S. est parent beneficiaire depuis 1999.elle habite a camberene et s'active dans la vente de fripperie.elle sollicite ce credit de 150 000frs pour faire face a l'accroissement de la demande de sa clientele.elle capitalise plus de dix ans d'experience dans ce domaine.
texts.en:
Khady S. is a beneficiary, a parent, and a member since 1999. She lives in Camberene and works at selling used clothing. She is asking for this loan of 150,000 frs to satisfy the increasing demand of her customers. She is banking on more than 10 years of experience in this field.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling used clothing

loans.name: Chham

texts.en: S. H. is a 46-year-old farmer and mother of six children. Five of her children are single, while one is married and lives away from home. To help feed the family, two of her daughters are garment workers in Phnom Penh, while her husband sells a few products for a profit. To earn additional income, S. H. is requesting a loan on Kiva as capital to purchase arecas, beans, and sesames from rural farmers. She will sell them to market sellers at a profit. She and her husband are pictured at their house.

loans.use: To purchase arecas, beans, and sesames from rural farmers

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía H. M. se dedica a la venta de gorditas desde hace un año el lugar donde instaló  el negocio necesita varios arreglos ella quiere ponerle vitropiso y un pintada para que este presentable. Las gorditas las hace de varios guisos y son de maíz y las vende a un precio accesible para el cliente, Desde un principio la gente iba a comprar pensando que vendía pollos por que la por fuera esta pintado con un pollo ya que antes de ella instalarse se vendían pollos asados. Ella quiere cambiar la fachada para que la gente que en ese lugar se vende Gorditas.
texts.en:
Sofia H. M. has been selling gorditas for one year. Her place of business needs a few improvements -- she wants to install a ceramic tile floor and add a coat of paint to make it presentable. Her gorditas are made with corn and served with different stews. She sells her dishes at a price that any customer can afford.

From the beginning, people thought she sold poultry dishes because a picture of a chicken is painted on the outside of her business and the previous establishment sold roasted chickens. She wants to change the facade of her business so that people know that she sells gorditas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make physical improvements to her business (paint & a tile floor)

loans.name: Lizete Venancio

texts.pt:
Lizete Venâncio B. nasceu no distrito de boane tem 36 anos de idade e é mãe de 1 filho de 13 anos que estuda na escola primaria completa de Boane. Estudou ate 7 classe tendo parado devido a questões sociais e tradicionais.

Lizete cresceu na companhia dos seus pais e nunca saiu do distrito. Atualmente é viúva. Aprendeu a fazer negócios há bastante tempo com sua mãe e vende roupa usada e nova de adultos e crianças no mercado central da vila de Boane. O seu negocio está a evoluir bem e adquire a mercadoria na cidade de Maputo a 1.500,00MT cada fardo de roupa diversa e vende a 3.000,00MT cada. Rende mensalmente 3.000,00MT que aplica no reforço do negocio e sustento da família. Poupa num esquema tradicional de poupança rotativa (xitique) uma vez por semana.

Já teve créditos com outras instituições similares em grupos solidários e quando teve informações através de vizinhos sobre os créditos individuais da Hluvuku-Adsema aproximou e solicitou vários empréstimos para a mesma actividade de venda de roupa usada, um de 6.000,00MT e os restantes de 10.000,00MT cada.
Já beneficiou de credito de kiva e tendo concluído sem problemas e o seu negocio conheceu uma melhoria significativa. Vive e consegue sustentar a sua família.

Com o presente empréstimo de 15.000,00MT, pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada e outra nova para responder a demanda do produto. Propõe se a fechar o credito sem problemas para aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de construir uma capoeira para fazer avicultura.
texts.en:
Lizete Venâncio B. was born in the district of Boane. She is 36 years old and is the mother of one son, 13 years old, who studies in the elementary school of Boane. She studied until seventh grade, having had to stop due to social and traditional issues. Lizete grew up with her parents and never left the district. She is a widow at this time. She learned how to do business a long time ago with her mother, and she sells new and used clothing for adults and children in the central market of Boane. Her business is evolving well. She acquires merchandise in the city of Maputo at 1,500 MT for a bundle of mixed clothing, and sells at 3,000 MT per bundle. This yields 3,000 MT each month, which is applied to reinforcing her business and sustaining her family. She puts money aside in a traditional savings system (xitique) once a week. She has already had loans with other similar institutions as part of a group, and when she got information through neighbours about the individual loans from Hluvuku-Adsema, she approached and asked for various loans for the same purpose of selling used clothing, one of 6,000 MT and the rest for 10,000 MT each. She has already benefitted from a loan from Kiva, and paid it back without problems. Her business has realised a significant improvement. She lives and manages to support her family. With the present loan of 15,000 MT, she plans to purchase bundles of used clothing and others of new clothing in response to the demand for this product. She proposes to pay back the loan without problems in order to access more loans with the goal of constructing a chicken coop to raise poultry.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various clothing

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda es una mujer luchadora y dinamica , tiene 55 años de edad . Es madre de 4 hijos, todos independientes. Ella se dedica a venta de productos regionales como son yuca, aji dulce, platano, frejol, naranjas,limones, pues extrae estos productos de su chacra que esta ubicado en el caserio Éxito. Lucinda cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es enfermero de profesión. Ella es socia hace tres años del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Productivas”. Su primer prestamo fue de 300 soles.

Con este crédito de 2,000 soles, piensa invertirlo en la mantención de su chacra y también comprará gallinas para criar.

La meta de Lucinda es tener una bodega en su casa y  seguir apoyando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Lucinda is a dynamic woman and a fighter. She is 55 years old and the mother of four children, all of whom live on their own now. She earns a living by selling regional produce like yucca, chili peppers, platanos, beans, oranges, and lemons. She grows the produce on her small farm located in the tiny village of Éxito. Lucinda also has the support of her husband, a nurse. She has been a member of the community bank “Profitable Women” for three years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, about $100.

With this loan of 2,000 soles, or $700, she plans to invest in the maintenance of her farmland and also to purchase and raise a few chickens.

Lucinda’s dream is to have a wine cellar in her home and to continue helping her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Alice Geglio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her farmland and buy small animals

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is married with two children and she is 30 years old. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria.

Tina has a beauty salon where she makes lovely hairstyles. She also sells drinks and hair extensions in her salon. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Chanrith

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanrith K., age 21(shown in the photo with her husband) and her husband, Mr. Piseth Sot, age 19, just were married in 2009 and have no children yet. The young couple is living in a small village off of National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chanrith sells fish and her husband assists his wife in the business. Chanrith is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for carrying fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for carrying fish to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma D. J., together with her beloved husband, is striving to earn enough income to support the education of their two children who are presently studying in tertiary education. Being parents, they are concerned with the future of their children. They sacrifice everything to send their children to school for they know that education is the only way to find a stable job. 
	The main source of their income is farming. They cultivate their farm lots in two cropping cycles by planting rice and vegetables. Due to the high cost of commodities and school expenditures, they need to earn more income to meet their daily needs and finance the tuition fees and allowances of their children. In this regard, Alma put up a small eatery in their village located at Brgy. Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya to earn additional income. She started this with a small amount of capital in which she can only earn a net income of P 500.00 per week. In this regard, she wants to improve it but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she wants to borrow additional capital from KIVA lenders amounting to P 5,000.00 to be added to her capital to improve her small eatery. She wants to buy more ingredients for her eatery. She believes that with her patience and sacrifices, she will be able to improve her business and support the studies of their two children.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to cook

loans.name: María Fausta

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos en el sector La Iglesia, perteneciente al distrito de Illimo, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella divide su tiempo entre el trabajo de casa y el trabajo en el campo, apoya a su esposo en el cuidado de su parcela donde han sembrado frijol y en la crianza de los animales domésticos que utilizan para su alimentación ya que por la zona la carne es escasa y muy cara.
