Su esposo trabaja como obrero en un molino de arroz de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Con estos ingresos tratan de sacar adelante a su familia.

María se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los que quiere terminar de construir su casa, la cual es pequeña y necesita ser reparada urgentemente porque las lluvias que se han presentado durante las temporadas de verano pasadas han debilitado los cimientos de su precaria vivienda.

Ella es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, su más grande anhelo es poder construir su casa de material noble para que puedan vivir tranquilos y seguros durante las temporadas lluviosas del año. En la foto ella nos muestra el material que ha comprado para terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
María is a 38 year old housewife who lives with her husband and their five children in the La Iglesia sector of the district of Illimo, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She divides her time between housework and working in the field. She supports her husband in taking care of their parcel of land, where they have planted beans, and in the care of the domestic animals they use for food since, in the zone where they live, meat is scarce and very expensive. Her husband works in a rice mill in the city of Chiclayo. With this income they try to move their family ahead.

María is applying with Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1000 new soles with which she wants to complete the construction of her house, which is small and needs urgent repairs because the rains that came during the past spring season have weakened the foundation of her fragile dwelling. She is a responsible and hardworking woman. Her biggest wish is to be able to build her house from strong material so that they can live peacefully and securely during the annual seasonal rains. In the photo she shows us the material she has bought in order to finish constructing her house.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material for a house

loans.name: Mrs. Sareth Khein Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan consists of seventeen people and they all live in Veal Thom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sareth K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fish seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she is asking for a loan to buy more fish to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Prak Ny, is a ferry driver who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sareth K. is 38 years-old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a blacksmith while another one is a laborer. The third one is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Mr. Seng P. and Mr. Okyday C. did not come to take a loan but their wives did, so they are present in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Rita Lorena

texts.es: La Señora Rita C. de 51 años de edad, con más de 10 años de experiencia en la elaboración de repostería y bocadillo, siendo el medio de trabajo con el cual ha salido poco a poco adelante con sus hijos. Al tener conocimiento de repostería ella se ha dedicado a vender por encargos y al público en general su producto gusta a los clientes. Lo inicio con mucho esfuerzo ya que era del poco ingreso que recibía, ella instalo su venta de torta a las ventas del alrededor y vecinos, se requería de financiamiento para ir mejorando el ambiente empresarial que se estaba iniciando, a este tiempo el negocio ha dado giros diferentes de beneficio para la familia ya que ha crecido, estableciendo su productos en colegios y cafetines. Esto implica cambios en los materiales que se utilizan y la comodidad del negocio. Este es el segundo ciclo de financiamiento con el cuales lo invertirá en pequeñas remodelación de la casa para mayor comodidad de su negocio y familia. Con la compra de materiales de construcción como: perlines, zinc, clavos y reglones para cambiar y levantar el techo de la sala. Evitando que se le presente ambiente de robo y perdidas que causaran daños a al negocio y a su vida.
texts.en:
Señora Rita C., 51, has been a pastry and snack merchant for over 10 years. This work has allowed her to see her children get ahead in life little by little. Having pastry-making skills, she began selling based on prior orders and directly to the public; her products are well-liked by her customers. She began it with a lot of effort because her earnings were very low. She began selling her cakes to her neighbors and in areas near her home. She needed financing to continue to improve the business she was starting. Her business has grown and gone through some changes over time that have benefitted her family, like supplying her products to schools and cafes. This requires a change in the materials that are used and the comfort of the business. This is her second financing cycle and she will use the funds for small remodeling projects in her house to increase the comfort level for her family and for her business. WIth the purchase of building materials like zinc and metal sheeting, nails, edgings, she will change and improve the roof on the living room avoiding being exposed to the danger of burglary and losses that could damage her business or her life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to build a roof.

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en: Boldbaatar is 23 years old and lives with his parents and older brother in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His parents are retired and his brother works for a road construction company while Boldbaatar operates a taxi service in his town. He began his business in 2004 with the help of his father and after his father retired, he began operating the business on his own. He learned a lot about operating a business from his father and has had no problem taking on the taxi service. He says, “I am planning on getting married next year so I need to save some money in order to build a house so that I can start my own family.” He is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~425 USD) loan in order to purchase parts for his taxi and some construction materials for his house that will be built next year.

loans.use: to purchase parts for his taxi and some construction materials for his house

loans.name: St. Mary's Group

texts.en: Comfort is a forty-nine year old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. Comfort is a food vendor. She sells pastries, preparing them and supplying them to other retailers. Comfort is the leader of a trust bank group called St. Mary’s. The members of the group are mainly merchants. They are hard working, trust themselves and want the loan to invest in their businesses. Comfort, the group leader, is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Creceremos en quechua.
Olinda es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, de profesión docente, Olinda tiene una tienda en una galería ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, en donde vende ropa variada y calzados, además Olinda vende relojes, casacas al por mayor a las tiendas.
Olinda necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de relojes y casacas.
Los sueños de Olinda son tener una zapatería y tener una escuela.
texts.en:
Olinda is a member of the Wiñarisun cooperative bank, which means “we will grow” in quechua. Olinda is married, 30 years old, has 2 children and is a teacher by profession. Olinda has a store located in a gallery in the city center, where she sells a variety of clothing and shoes. In addition, she sells watches and jackets at wholesale to other stores. Olinda needs a loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles to invest into the purchase of watches and jackets. Olinda’s dreams are to have a shoe store and a school.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To puchase watches and jackets.

loans.name: Alex Mariel

texts.es:
Alex Mariel P. M. tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, y vive con sus padres y 3 hermanos.

El socio pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maiz como los principales cultivos.

Alex se dedica a ayudar a sus padres en los cultivos de maiz, papas, alverja, y habas.  Lo dificil de trabajar en el campo es que hay tiempos el los que no se puede sembrar ni cosechar por las pocas lluvias.  La familia también crece ganado vacuno para vender cuando se crezcan y se gorden.  Venden los productos semanalmente en las ferias en la ciudad de San Miguel.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para ayudar a sus papas en la agricultura.  Para el futuro, desea terminar sus estudios.  Actualmente está estudiando Ingeniería Agrícola en el Instituto 3 de Marzo.  En sus tiempos libres, le gusta ayudar a los instructores en el colegio para darles los estudios a los niños.
texts.en:
Alex Mariel P. M., 22, is single and lives with his parents and three siblings. He is a member of the "San Jose de las Orquideas" communal bank, which is located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the San Jose de Palmas community. Most of the community's residents are corn and potato farmers. Alex helps his parents with their corn, potato, pea and bean crops. What is difficult about field work is that sometimes one can neither plant nor harvest because of the scarce rainfall. The family also raises cattle to sell when they have grown and reached a certain weight. They sell their product weekly in San Miguel's market. He is asking for funding to buy seed, manure and fertilizers to help his parents with their farming. For the future, he wants to finish his schooling. He is currently studying Agricultural Engineering at the 3 de Marzo Institute. In his free time, he likes to help the teachers in the institute teach the children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Sheila's Group

texts.en:
Sheila B. is from the village of Brgy. Baresbes, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 27 years old. Sheila is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Sheila is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Sheila owns and operates a business of providing motorcycle transport services. Sheila has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $135 a month for this activity.

In 2010, Sheila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sheila is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba.
Marcelo es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Marcelo se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, que compra en las ferias. Además Marcelo se dedica a la confección de tejidos en telares.
Marcelo necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado.
Los sueños de Marcelo son que sus hijos sean profesionales y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Marcelo is a member of the community bank Urubamba. Marcelo is married, 50-years old and has 7 children; Marcelo buys and sells cattle that he buys at the fairs. Additionally, Marcelo makes weavings using looms. Marcelo needs a loan of 15000 Soles; the money will be invested in the purchase of cattle. Marcelo’s dreams are for his children to become professionals, and to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle.

loans.name: Rosa Danelia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa C. se dedica a la venta de bebidas en su cafetín que tiene en el Mercado Mayoreo donde a diario vende café, gaseosas, jugos y agua a los clientes que a diario le visitan.

Ella actualmente está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra las bebidas tales como gaseosas, jugos, agua y el café en polvo. Con el crédito se beneficia grandemente porque logra adquirir las bebidas y comercializarlas en su establecimiento y así obtener los ingresos para su mejoramiento del negocio y por ende de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa C. sells beverages in her cafe in the Mayoreo Market. Every day, she sells coffee, soft drinks, juices, and water to the customers who visit her.

She is now applying for a loan which she will invest in purchasing drinks such as soft drinks, juices, water, and instant coffee. The loan will benefit her greatly, because she will be able to acquire beverages and sell them in her cafe and thus obtain income for the improvement of her business and for the use of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beverages

loans.name: Sarangerel

texts.en: Sarangerel is 36 years old and lives with her husband in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her husband live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Sarangerel operates a tailoring business in her town. She produces a variety of clothing, but specializes in the Mongolian traditional robe (deel) with a range of designs. She started her business in 2003 after she graduated from a tailoring course at a local vocational training center. Her business is well-known  in her province and neighboring provinces. Sarangerel started renting her sales counter in 2003 in order to provide service to more customers. When her workload is high she hires another tailor to help with her business. Sarangerel has been planning to expand her business and to hire two more tailors in the future. She sells a deel for 20,000-30,000 MNT and demand for her products is high. Sarangerel is a great businesswoman with a good personality. She is focused on the future and says, “I would like to expand my business and to open my own shop in the future.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase an electric sewing machine and other necessary materials such as silk, fabric, and thread.

loans.use: To purchase an electronic sewing machine.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.es:
Rosita tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Lagunas, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope de la provincia de Lambayeque, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Ella ofrece los productos a sus vecinos, lo cual es de mucha ayuda ya que el caserío donde vive se encuentra a mas de media hora del pueblo de Mórrope y no tienen acceso rápido a productos de consumo diario, por este motivo ella trata de manterer su negocio de la mejor manera posible, ofreciendo productos de calidad y un buen trato a sus clientes.

Rosita nos comenta que gracias a la bodega ella puede ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia, su esposo trabaja como peón agrícola y juntos tratan de solventar los gastos familiares. Adicionalmente ella también cría y vende cerdos con lo que su unidad familiar percibe ingresos adicionales. Precisamente en la imagen nos muestra a una de sus cerdas que ha parido recientemente.

Ella desea ampliar su bodega de modo que pueda seguir atendiendo a sus clientes y aumentar sus ganancias. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de abarrotes para lograr su objetivo.

Rosita es una madre que trabaja siempre buscando el bienestar de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar alguna carrera superior que les permita asegurarse un futuro prometedor. En la zona donde vive ella  es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Rosita, 37, is married and lives with her husband and their three children in the Lagunas settlement, a rural area of Mórrope district, Lambayeque province, located an hour and fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last year she has run a grocery store in her home. She sells to her neighbors which is of great use to the settlement where she lives because it is over half an hour away from the town of Mórrope and there is no convenient access to items of daily consumption. Because of this, she strives to keep her store stocked in the best possible way with quality products and good customer service. Rosita tells us that thanks to earnings from her store she is able to support her family. Her husband works as a farmhand and together they strive to meet household expenses. In addition, she raises pigs to earn additional family income. As a matter of fact, in the photo she’s with a sow that recently gave birth. She wants to expand her store so that she can continue to provide service to her customers and increase her earnings. For this reason, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request an 800 new sol loan to buy stock items for her store. Rosita is a mother who is always seeking her family’s wellbeing. Her greatest wish is to provide her children with the opportunity to study an advanced career that will insure them a promising future. She is well known and liked by her neighbors where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “KILLA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Olga,  ella tiene 25 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de  5 años de edad, Nuestra socia tiene un stand ambulatorio de servicios de llamadas telefónicas a celulares, ella presta este servicio en la esquina de su barrio, tiene 4 celulares recargados con llamadas a cualquier destino nacional y la socia cobra 0.50 centavos el minuto, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con este negocio, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar tarjetas de teléfonos y venderlas y también para recargar sus celulares.
  
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Killa Communal Bank. She lives in the Huanchac distrist, Cusco province, Cusco department. Our member is 25 year old Olga. She is in a common law marriage and has a five year old child. She has a moveable stand providing cell phone call services. She offers this service on the corner in her neighborhood. She has four charged cell phones that can call any national destination. She charges 0.50 centavos per minute. She alternates her activities between the household and this business. She is grateful for and values the support offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy phone cards and sell them, also to replenish the minutes on her cell phones

loans.name: Fuarosa

texts.en: Fuarosa H. is 35 and married with four children. She owns a business selling fried foods in the local community and has two years of experience in this business. Fuarosa needs a loan of WST 1,500 to buy raw ingredients for her cooked foods. She plans to use the earnings from her business, estimated to be 1,500 talas (approximately USD 600) per week, to improve and expand her business. In 2009, Fuarosa joined SPBD and this is her 2nd loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for her cooked foods

loans.name: Ticomo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ticomo lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras  y esforzadas una de ellas es la señora Gloria B. S., coordinadora del grupo, quien desde muy joven ha laborado para llevar el sustento a su casa y sacar adelante a sus tres hijos los cuales ya están casados.

 Ella hace cuatro años se dedica al comercio de ropa y cosméticos de la marca de manera ambulante. Las marcas con las cuales trabaja son  Avon y Arabella,  empresas que ofertan sus productos través de la venta directa y centros de ventas en donde los clientes pueden adquirir diversidad de productos tales como fragancias, productos de tocador, cosméticos, moda casual, lencería, joyería, productos para el hogar y vitaminas.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Antonia Doribel P., ella en el 2005 empezó a  vender ropa usada en los distintos barrios de Managua y María Concepción Chichilla quien comercializa ropa de cama de segunda y nuevas  desde hace seis años.

Ellas están muy agradecidas por las oportunidad que les brindo Adim tanto en la oferta de créditos como en el desarrollo empresarial y de autoestima por medio de los programas de  capacitación los cuales son  Desarrollo Humano con Enfoque de Género, Desarrollo Empresarial con Enfoque de Género, Intercambio Empresarial  y Articulación de Actores. Esto según expresaron les ha permitido administras de manera asertiva su negocio.
texts.en:
The Ticomo group is made up of three hard-working, enterprising and dedicated women. One of them is Gloria B. S., group coordinator, who has worked form a very young age to support her home and raise her three children who are now married. For the last four years she has been an itinerant clothing and brand name cosmetics merchant; she sells Avon and Arabella brand products. These are companies that offer their goods through direct sales and through sales centers where customers can buy a variety of products like fragrances, makeup items, cosmetics, casual fashion, lingerie, jewelry, items for the home and vitamins. Her fellow group members are Antonia Doribel P. who started selling used clothing in 2005 in several Managua neighborhoods and María Concepción C. who has sold new and used bed linens for the past 6 years. They are very grateful for the opportunities Adim has provided both in loans approved and in entrepreneurial and self-esteem training sessions, namely: Human Development, Focus on Gender, Business Interchange and Intercommunication Skills. They stated that these have helped them be more assertive administrators of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina P. is a widow who lives in Barangay Purisima, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a batchoyan (fast-food) business. Rizalina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, She has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, Rizalina is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as an additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save for the future education of her children. Rizalina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda S. is from the village of Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 60 years old, married and has 8 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Rosalinda runs a butcher shop. She has been engaged in her business for 18 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rosalinda joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC which she used as additional capital.

Rosalinda is requesting her fourth loan, for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As addtional capital for her business.

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: Trinidad (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Trinidad está formado por 10 socias quienes luchan día a día para mejorar la situación económica de sus hogares y así brindar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, viven en diferentes comunidades de la parroquia Turi la misma que es reconocida por se el mirador del la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su población ha migrado para ofrecer a sus familias un mejor futuro.

La Señora. María Carmen vive en la comunidad de Asunción que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi, se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo realizando los créditos, ha ingresado al banco comunal gracias a una amiga de su comunidad quien la invito. Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también cría animales como: borregos, chanchos, terneros los mismos que los vende en las ferias de ganado que existen en la ciudad.
La Señora. María Carmen tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 16, 14, 12 y 10 años de edad,  sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y solo su última hija se encuentra en la escuela, su esposo es albañil y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos. Su meta es  seguir creciendo en el negocio de venta de animales.

La Señora Ana Lucia Merchán vive en la comunidad de Hierba Buena que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi, tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene  2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, su esposo es albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros.
Nuestra socia trabaja en un CDI (Centro de Desarrollo Infantil) donde enseña y cuida  a los niños mas pequeños, realiza esta labor hace 4 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de cuyes, pollos y chanchos los mismos que los vende en su comunidad. Es una socia fundadora del banco comunal, los créditos entregados anteriormente le han beneficiado en su hogar y negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado. Su meta es llegar a conseguir un mejor trabajo.
texts.en:
The Trinidad communal bank is made up of 10 members who struggle daily to improve their economic situation so that they can provide a better future to their children. They live in different communities within the Turi Parish, which is known for being the balcony of Cuenca. Its people farm and raise livestock. Much of the population has migrated in search of a better future for their families. Ms. María Carmen lives in the Asunción community, within the Turi Parish, and is in her fourth loan cycle. She became part of the communal bank, thanks to a friend who invited her. Our associate is a homemaker who also raises animals, such as: sheep, hogs, and steer; which she sells in the city’s livestock fairs. María Carmen is 33 years old, married, and has four children, ages 16, 14, 12, and 10. Her three oldest attend high school and the youngest attends elementary school. Her husband works as a mason and by working together they were able to build their house. She will use the money from this loan to buy school supplies for her children. Her goal is to continue to grow her livestock business. Ms. Ana Lucia Merchán lives in the Hierba Buena community, within the Turi Parish. She is 30 years old, married and has two children, ages 5 and 3. Her husband works as a mason. She does not have her own home because they live with her in-laws. Our associate works for the CDI (Centro de Desarrollo Infantil) [Child Development Center], where she teaches and cares for the youngest children. She’s been doing this for four years and works M-F from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM. She also raises Guinea pigs, chickens, and hogs; which she sells within the community. She is one of the founding members of the communal bank. The loans that she’s received previously have helped her home and business and she will use the money from this loan to buy livestock. Her goal is to find a better job.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Schoold supplies / Livestock

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice J., age 29, sells bedsheets, trousers, and dresses at her small shop. She would like to expand her offerings to include earrings and necklaces, and she is requesting a loan for that purpose. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a sewing machine.  

Alice's husband is a builder. They have one child who is as yet too young to attend school.

loans.use: To buy and stock earrings and necklaces for sale

loans.name: Adolfo Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Adolfo tiene 30 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y compra de ganado, este negocio consiste en comprar y vender ganado, el realiza sus compras en comunidades ya que aquí consigue al ganado a precio mucho más favorable, siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos a su familia. Sus inicios se dan por su Papa quien le enseño este oficio y cuando tenía la edad de 7 años le regalo un ternero y así poco a poco fue logrando comprar vacas, toros y ternero y tener su propio negocio, por lo que no es la primera experiencia que ha tenido con crédito pues ha sido reconfortante para su negocio. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para la compra de terneros, vacas, toros entre otros.
texts.en:
Sr. Adolfo is 30 years old and makes his living by buying and selling cattle. He purchases the animals in the community since he is able to get a very favorable price.

Adolfo is always looking for ways to generate income for his family. He started in this business with his father, who began teaching him when he was seven years old. His father gave him a calf and over time Adolfo was able to buy cows, bulls, and more calves to start his own business. This is not his first experience with loans since they have been beneficial for his business.

At the moment, Adolfo is requesting a loan in order to buy calves, cows, bulls, and other types of livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves, cows, and bulls

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
N. Emmanuel, aged 30 years, with a family of two children, has been operating a retail shop in Ikoba trading centre, Kyenjojo  selling general merchandise for over three years. Here he trades in a variety of household items like sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil, and much more merchandise, earning him a profit of 1,560,000 Ugandan shillings. His main drawback is that he has a limited stock of products in his shop that cannot satisfy the customers' demand. 

Therefore he is looking forward to increasing his stock when he gets this loan and also expanding into a wholesale shop. This will help him earn more revenue and sustain his daily needs as he envisions improving his family’s standard of living and further starting up a produce-selling business in the area.

loans.use: purchase more stock for the business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita Q. is a married woman who lives in Purok 1, Lawis, Brgy. Mainggit, Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fish vending  business. Her husband, Dionisio Q., who is 38 years old, works as a grinder to earn his living. They have 9 children who are 5 months to 17 years old. Two of their children are already working to help the family, while the other 5 children are currently going to school.

Anita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Anita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future and her children's education. Anita Q. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Luz De Lourdes

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer comerciante, dedicada al trabajo, madre de tres hijos, casada. Su negocio es una pulpería en donde lleva varios años trabajando, negocio que comenzó con poco y que gracias a su tenacidad y empeño ha logrado evolucionar y con los financiamientos de Afodenic, que fue el paso para crecer.
Ahora cuenta con más  productos, ya que invirtió en ropa interior, cosméticos, sandalias y proporciono más granos básicos.
Con este financiamiento comprara: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, golosinas, carnes, pollo, lácteos así como ropa interior, cosmético. Logrando a si mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Luz is a merchant dedicated to work.  She is married and has three children.  Her business is a grocery store that she has had in operation for many years.  She started out with little and thanks to her tenacity and dedication has managed to evolve and with Afodenic loans had the means to grow.

She now stocks more products because she invested in clothing, cosmetics and sandals and also more basic grains.

She will use this loan to buy sugar, rice, beans, corn, sweets, meats, chicken and dairy products as well as underwear and cosmetics hoping thereby to improve sales.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, dairy products, snacks, meats, chicken and other products to improve sales.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael Rodríguez P.  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena donde se dedica a vender ropa mediante un sistema muy particular, compra las telas e insumos y manda a fabricar la ropa especialmente femenina, aprovechando el taller de confecciones  que tiene su madre  desde hace mas de 20 años y que por ser el negocio de Rafael muy  rentable,  le aporta un porcentaje de utilidad a ella.
Este es su cuarto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la cual pertenece hace un poco más de tres años  y que le ha ayudado a crecer como independiente y como empresario. Igualmente con las utilidades producidas por el negocio, ha logrado comprarle una maquina de confeccionar a su mamá, generado gran unidad familiar, porque su gran sueño es hacer una  fuerte alianza de trabajo con toda su familia, abrir nuevos mercados para ampliar su espectro productivo, aunque su mayor desafío es lograr juntar todo el capital para lograrlo. Con su credikiva Rafael comprará telas, adornos, hilos y detalles que llevará al taller de su madre para confeccionar vestidos femeninos ya encargados, aprovechando que se acercan las festividades de final de año y él aspira a aumentar su clientela y sus utilidades en esta temporada de gran movimiento comercial .
texts.en:
Rafael Rodríquez P. lives in the city of Cartagena.  He sells clothes there in a very unique way.  He buys the fabric and supplies.  He then orders the clothes to be made, especially women’s clothes.  He takes advantage of his mother’s seamstress shop, which she has had for over 20 years.  Rafael’s business is very profitable, and he gives a percentage of the profits to his mother.

This is his fourth loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He has belonged to this organization for a little over three years.  It has helped him grow independently and as a businessman.  With the profits from his business he has managed to buy a sewing machine for his mother.

This has generated great family unity.  His big dream is to make a strong work alliance with all of his family and to open new markets to increase his productive presence.  His biggest challenge is to get together the capital to accomplish this.

Rafael will use the loan to buy fabric, decorations, thread, and accessories to take to his mother’s shop to make the women’s garments that are on order.  He will take advantage of the end of the year festivities that are approaching.

He aspires to increase the number of customers he has.  He also wants his profits to increase during this time of the year when there is great commercial activityt.

loans.use: Buy fabric, decorations, thread, and accessories to take to his mother’s shop to make  women’s garments

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran lives in Kot Radha Kishen. It is a small city located near Kasur Pakistan and famous for its dairy industry. She is 35 years old and lives in a 3 room brick house with her family. She moved here 15 years ago with her family.  She is married to M. H. who is a carpenter by profession and makes furniture. He is excellent in his art and makes beautiful furniture. Due to his quality of work and good designs, people approach him and give him a good number of orders. 

In order to financially support her husband, Sughran does embroidery works. She has a number of clients in her local area and earns good income by completing the orders on time. She has given birth to 2 daughters. Her eldest daughter is studying in 5th grade while the younger one stays at home. 

Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy wood, nails and a furniture polisher  that will enable him to make furniture of different designs for his clients. Sughran is hopeful that an investment will allow her husband to offer a greater variety of furniture to his customers and will enable him to fulfill larger orders on time. 

She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit rating and never missed a meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails and a furniture polisher for a furniture making business

loans.name: Sumbwe Tukole Bukozi-Mpigi Group

texts.en:
39-year-old S. Prossy has been on common ground with Sumbwe Tukole Bukozi Group-Mpigi for the last 7 years. Over the course of these years, her means of survival has been a clothing sales business in Mukwano Arcade, Kampala. All of this while she has been selling high quality designer ladies' garments such as skirts and blouses.

Prossy says she started bearing a hand in this business undertaking because of the sway of her sisters. Previously she dedicated most of her time to a brick laying business venture, which she says is now more of a second fiddle, eke out business. Monthly this business generates 120,000 shillings for her.

With this loan Prossy says she is going to buy more first-rate clothes that she will re-sell over time.

loans.use: The purchase more first-rate clothing for resale

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a widowed woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, she has been operating a restaurant business at the market.  Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Kibibi faces a major challenge of competition in her business. She hopes to expand and start a hotel business. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil, and sugar

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niña se dedicaba a la agricultura, hoy se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos. Es así que cultiva papa, habas trigo entre otros productos más y junto con  su familia la ayudan en la siembra y en la cosecha. Todos trabajan arduamente, ya que de ello depende para que obtengan regulares ganancias. Por otro lado, cría animales, como: ovejas, asnos y  bueyes que cada cierto tiempo lo venden. En estos últimos años ha recuperado lo invertido en sus cosechas  por lo que desea seguir dedicándose a la agricultura por muchos años más. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar.
texts.en:
Francisca is 44 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and two children.

Francisca has been farming since she was a little girl.  It has now become her source of income.  She grows potatoes, beans, wheat and other crops.  Her family help her with her sowing and harvesting.  They all work very hard together since they depend on this work for regular income.  Francisca also raises animals such as sheep, donkeys and oxen which she sells every so often.  Recently Francisca has recouped the money that she has invested in her harvests and, for this reason, she would like to continue farming for many more years.

This is Francisca's first loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being part of her community bank because all its members are people that she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.  Francisca is grateful to the people who will fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying sacks of manure for her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure for the upcoming sowing season

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita T. is from the village of Cogon, Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old. Estelita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Estelita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, snack foods, canned goods & toothpaste in the local community. Estelita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Estelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Estelita is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like instant noodles and junk foods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Estelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like instant noodles and snack foods

loans.name: Erika Idalia

texts.es:
Erika, tiene 25 años de edad, reside en San Carlos departamento de Morazán, ella vive con su familia su hija, su madre y hermanas, se dedica a vender minutas en las afueras del centro escolar de la colonia Santa Barbará, perteneciente a San Carlos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para preparar las minutas, los cuales son jaleas de diferentes sabores, hielo, leche condensada, vasos y cucharas, este préstamo le dará estabilidad para contar con material suficiente para continuar en su trabajo, ya que de este negocio es que mantiene a su hija y ayuda a su familia para los gastos.
Sueña con crecer a su hija con todo lo necesario, además de trabajar para que ella pueda estudiar y superarse teniendo mejores oportunidades de superación.
texts.en: Erika is 25 years old and lives in San Carlos, in Morazán department, with her daughter, her mother and her sisters.  She sells light meals outside a school in Santa Barbará neighborhood, in San Carlos and is requesting a loan to buy supplies for preparing her meals.  She will buy different flavored jellos, ice, condensed milk, glasses and spoons.  This loan will give her stability as she will have the supplies she needs to continue in her work.  Through her business, Erika supports her daughter and helps cover her family's expenses.  She dreams of her daughter growing up with everything she needs and she also plans to work so that her daughter can study and improve herself by having better opportunities in life.

loans.use: To buy different flavored jellos, ice, condensed milk, glasses and spoons

loans.name: Thiev

texts.en: Thiev P., 41 years old, is a humble villager living in the province of Kompong Tom. She is married and blessed with three single children who still live with Thiev P.. To earn a living, Thiev P. sells many kinds of vegetables, which she either buys in bulk from her supplier or grows. Her husband also helps her to pick up the vegetables in the mobile place for selling. In order to earn extra profit and to make the business more successful, Thiev P. will be using the loan she requested to buy a large quantity of vegetables for selling.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Саидова Мавлуда проживает в районе Дангара. Ей 39 лет. Разведена. Имеет 3 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Уже год как занимается торговлей. Она в основном продает одежду, платки и носки. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Mavluda S. lives in the Dangara region. She is 33 years old, divorced and has three children. She lives with her parents. It has been a year as she started in the retail business. She mainly sells clothing, scarves and socks. She is taking out the loan to increase variety of her merchandise.

loans.use: To increase variety

loans.name: Rosemberg

texts.es: Rosemberg G. de 20 años es un joven emprendedor y muy estudioso, que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas  en su negocio llamado “Donde Rosemberg”, el cual inició hace dos años vendiendo deditos por bandejas; como es muy estudioso y proyectado al futuro,   hizo un curso de comidas rápidas y acudió a la ayuda de su padre, quien le facilitó un dinero con el cual  compró su carro de perros calientes y algunas sillas;   fue así como empezó a incluir entre sus comidas rápidas, perros calientes , salchipapas, hamburguesas, picadas de carne asada y de pollo; en la actualidad  lo ayuda un familiar y aprovecha el punto para vender también minutos a celulares que son otro ingreso mas; él realiza sus compras de contado y esta decidido a crecer permanentemente, por eso acude a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo pues necesita hacer mejoras a su carro de perros y comprar materias primas para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Rosemberg está muy orgulloso de su negocio porque le ha ayudado a pagar su universidad y está concentrado en hacerse un profesional del derecho y fortalecer su estilo empresarial logrando modernizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosemberg G., 20, is a young, studious, entrepreneur.  He makes and sells fast food in his business called “Donde Rosenberg.” He started two years ago selling deditos (cookies) by the tray.  However, because he’s very curious and forward looking he took a fast food preparation course and asked his father for help.  His father gave him the money to buy a hotdog cart and some chairs.   

This is how he started to include hotdogs, salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausage), hamburgers and grilled meat and chicken skewers to his fast food.  A relative currently helps him with the work.  He also takes advantage of his sales point to sell minutes of cell phone air time which is an additional source of income.  He pays cash for his purchases and is determined to grow permanently.  This is why he’s asking Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for his first loan because he needs to do some improvements on his hotdog cart and buy raw materials to increase his working capital.

Rosemberg is very proud of his business because it’s helped him pay his university expenses.  He is concentrating on becoming a Lawyer and to strengthening his business style trough modernization.

loans.use: to improve his hotdog cart and to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Carmen Liliana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos tres de  los cuales ya son mayores de edad y una niña de 10 años que estudia en  escuela, tres de sus hijos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es ebanista.

El esposo tiene un taller de ebanistería en el cual realiza una gran variedad de trabajos con la madera como por ejemplo: camas, muebles, puertas, cajoneras, anaqueles entre otras muchas obras, trabaja bajo pedido todos los días desde las 8h00hasta las 16h00 y cuando tiene muchos encargos hasta más tarde, nos cuenta que lleva 20 años que su esposo se dedica a esta actividad y que gracias a Dios nunca le ha faltado trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar madera, pinturas, clavos, selladores entre otros productos que se necesitan para fabricar sus productos.

Su meta es tener un negocio con más tecnología.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Proyecto” (New Project) communal bank meets every two weeks in Manta’s Circunvalación neighborhood.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by national and foreign tourists alike.  It is one of the country’s and America’s most important ports situated on the shore of the Pacific Ocean.

Carmen is a founding member of the bank and she likes it because interest rates are lower than in other credit institutions.  She’s 43 years old, married and has four children three of whom are already adults and a 10-year-old daughter who goes to school.  Three of her children still live with her.  Her husband is a cabinet maker.

Her husband has a cabinet making shop where he does a great variety of jobs with wood, for example: beds, furniture, doors, chest of drawers, and shelving, among many others.  He works to order every day from 8am until 4pm and, when he has a lot of orders, even later.  She tells us that her husband has been in this line of work for 20 years and, thanks to God, has never lacked work.

This loan is to buy lumber, paints, nails and sealants among other products needed to manufacture his products.

Her goal is to have a business with more technology.

loans.use: to buy lumber, paints, sealants, nails, etc.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 27 years old and married with two children between the ages 1 and 4 years old. Her husband is a driver. Angelique has been selling bananas and Irish potatoes, as shown in the picture, for two successful years. She currently employs one person and she operates her business from 8am until 9pm every day except Saturday.

Angelique has requested a loan through Kiva's partner, Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more bananas and Irish potatoes to sell. She hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to reinvest in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas and Irish potatoes for sale

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 26 years old and has two children who are six and eight years old. She sells second-hand clothes in the market and has had her business for the past six years.  She has used some of the profit she made to buy a piece of land. She is requesting this loan in order to buy more clothes for resale.  She plans to reinvest any additional profit she makes back into her business.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro S. Agüero, tiene la edad de 32 años, está casado  y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el dinero aumentar el inventario a su posesión, el cuenta con una distribuidora a su posesión. El quiere dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y generar las ganancias para seguir creciendo con su empresa.  El pretende generar una mejor calidad de vida para su bienestar y generar un base consolidada de su empresa para ser de distribución el al zona sur. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Alejandro S. A. is 32 years old, married and lives with his wife who is his top priority. This loan is intended to increase the inventory in his possession.  He has a distributor for the inventory. He wants to better serve customers and generate earnings to keep growing with his business. He intends to build a better life for his welfare and to generate a consolidated base in his company for distribution in the south.  This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't had prior loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given a loan with great convenience and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to expand his inventory.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Sarakhon

texts.ru: Сарахон проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него 6 детей. Он имеет средне - специальное образование, бухгалтер. По специальности проработал 10 лет. Сейчас Сарахон занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается 4 года. Кроме того в свободное время он предоставляет услугу. У него имеется мастерская, где он занимается ремонтом автомашин. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Sarakhon lives in Hamadoni. He is 42 years old, married, and has six children. He has a vocational education as a bookkeeper. He worked in his profession for ten years. Now, Sarakhon works in animal husbandry.  He fattens and sells cattle. He has been doing this work for four years. In his free time he provides a service.  He has a workshop where he repairs cars. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: Для закупа крупнорогатого скота

loans.name: Lozi

texts.en:
Lozi is a married woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a mango selling business, selling at the market to her town dwellers. Lozi faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation from the rural to urban area for sales. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 15,000 Kshs, she plans to purchase sacks of mangoes and pay for transport costs. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of loan products.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of mangoes and pay for transport costs.

loans.name: Dinora Del Socorro

texts.es:
Dinora es una pequeña comerciante que trabaja junto con su esposo en la elaboracion de cocinas de metal electrica, y la venta de carne, el cual lleva siete años con las ventas.
Estas cocina las vende en su casa de habitacion a precios accesibles y otras por encargo las cuales son vendida en un mercado de la capital, pues es un producto muy demandado por ser muy util en la cocina y mas para la poblacion de bajo de recursos ya que el gas esta ah altos costos. Y no alcanza para comprarlo. Ha elevado sus ventas con mas produccion, gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en  doce ciclos, mediante los prestamo. 
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara: seis laminas lisas, docientos espirales,alambre, enchufes, galon de pinturas, galon de cener,  yipson, estonbol. Para la fabricacion de docientas cocinas electricas.
texts.en:
Dinora is a small merchant who works with her husband making electric metal cookers and selling meat, which she has done for seven years.

She sells her products out of her house at reasonable prices, and also sells the cookers at the market in the capital city since it is a product in very high demand.  It is very useful in the kitchen and popular among low-income earners because gas is very expensive.  

She has increased sales by increasing production thanks to loans received from Afodenic on 12 occasions.  This new loan will be used to buy six flat sheets, 200 spirals, wire, plugs, paint and other materials to make 200 electric cookers.

loans.use: To buy materials to make electric cookers such as: flat zinc sheets, electric plugs, and other items.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents and two siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a barber shop since 2007, with 5 years of previous experience working in the same field. He learned this occupation when he was very young. As with the majority of Lebanese guys, he helps his family with his income. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase needed tools and supplies in order to improve his shop and be able to offer better services to his clients. In the future, he is planning to purchase a laser machine to attract more customers and earn higher income.

loans.use: to purchase needed tools and supplies.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es soltera tiene 34 años, vive en una comunidad urbana en un distrito llamado la Matanza en la provincia de Morropon en le departamento de Piura al norte del Perú. Ella vive en casa propia en la habita con sus padre.

Mariela se a dedicado al comercio de abarrotes, pues desde hace 3 años ella ha instalado una bodega en su  domicilio. Allí ella ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad el ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

Mariela esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para que ella pueda adquirir mercadería para su negocio, como arroz azúcar, maíz, entre otros y de esta manera ampliar su negocio y percibir mejores ingresos para el beneficio de su familia. 

Mariela es una mujer responsable y de buen carácter  que desea salir adelante, con su trabajo y esfuerzo, ella posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales dentro de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mariela is 34 years old and single.  She lives in an urban community, in a district called La Matanza, in Morropón province, in Piura department, in the north of Peru.  She lives in her own home together with her parents.

Mariela has been selling groceries for three years.  Her store is located in her home.  There she sells her neighbors a range of basic household products and groceries.  She currently has regular and loyal customers.  Thanks to her business, she has been able to support her family and get them ahead in life.

Mariela is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy more merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, corn, etc.  In this way, she will expand her business and make better income for the benefit of her family.

Mariela is a responsible and good-natured woman who would like to get ahead in life through her hard work and effort.  She has very good personal and work references from her community.

loans.use: to acquire more merchandise for her business such as groceries and household products

loans.name: Samuel Warui

texts.en:
Samuel is 41 years old, married, and they have three children aged between fifteen years old and five years old whom they would like to give quality education to the university level.

Samuel runs a shop in which he sells second-hand auto spare parts. He has been running this business for the last ten years. He says the business is profitable and the major challenge he has are financial constraints.

He is using his loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy auto spare parts to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in future own many auto spare parts shops. He describes himself as very patient and persistent.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Bulak Indah Group

texts.en: Eni lives in Cilincing. She is already married and has 3 children. In 2005, she started selling Ketoprak, a type of food that contains vegetables. Doing this business, she can help her husband to increase the family income. She has requested 2,000,000 Indonesian rupiah to pay for more ingredients for Ketoprak. She plans for business expansion and in the future she wants to repair her house and give her children a better education than she had.

loans.use: to pay for Ketoprak ingredients

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 38 años, está casada con víctor de 48 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Victoria siempre ha priorizado la calidad de sus productos agrícolas antes que todo, es por ello que sus compradores lo valoran mucho y se van satisfechos con el producto que ella les ofrece. Es por ello que siempre esta en constante cuidado con sus sembríos introduciendo nuevas técnicas agrícolas que le puedan generar productos de alta calidad. Hace 10 años que empezó con esta actividad, cuando sus padres le ofrecieron un pequeño terreno, ahí plantó cacao, pero gracias a la ayuda de su pareja sacaron provecho de la tierra que le cedieron, pero sabe que debe trabajar más para lograr tener más ganancias y con ello cubrir los gastos de su familia. Ahora que su terreno de cultivo aumentó de manera considerable, de igual forma mejoró sus ventas con respectos a los otros años. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto ratifica su compromiso de cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,300 soles que solicita, lo invertirá para contratar peones para podar sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en: Victoria is 38 years old and is married to Victors who is 48 years old and with whom she has 3 children. Together they live in their own house located in the district of Pichari. Victoria has always put the quality of her agricultural products before everything else, and this is why her customers value her so much and are so satisfied with the product she sells. For this reason she is always careful with her crops, introducing new agricultural techniques that can yield high quality products. 10 years ago she began this business when her parents gave her a small parcel of land she planted cacao. Thanks to her partner's help she profited from the land that was given to her. She knows that she must work more to earn more income and to cover the family's expenses. Now that her farmland has appreciated considerably, she has similarly improved her sales compared with other years. This is her third loan with MFP, and so she proves her commitment to repay her debts on time. With the 2,300 soles that she asks for, she will hire workers to prune her cacao plants.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Borrower Bayasgalan is a 33-year-old married woman who lives with her family in a district without basic infrastructure near Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. 

Bayasgalan supports her family, by operating a clothing retail stall business at largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She has been doing this for 7 years. She sells clothes which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. She also sells clothing which she makes herself. 

She is an ambitious lady who wants to expand her business as well, so she is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase more clothing for autumn.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell for this fall/autumn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, deodorant, cosmetics.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 36 años habita en el Centro Poblado “Villa Ashaninga”. Ahí formó su familia junto a Augusto su esposo desde hace 15 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos todo ellos menores a los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia. Con la seriedad y coraje que la caracteriza, ella comenzó a forjar su economía en la “agricultura”, la principal actividad de su familia. Con ayuda de su esposo mantiene su siembra de café, el cual cosechan una vez al año, obteniendo ganancias considerables, pues cuenta que sus cultivos son jóvenes y no requieren de mucho mantenimiento, pero ella los fertiliza constantemente para mantener su calidad. Asimismo se dedica durante el año, al negocio de miel de abeja de la selva, cuyo costo es muy alto, pues tienen propiedades curativas. Vende un promedio de 20 kilos diarios; cuenta que ya tiene 8 años de experiencia en esta actividad, donde tiene clientes fijos. Además Augusto, su esposo, trabaja en el trasporte público con un motocarro, cubriendo las rutas Pichanaki a Sangani donde también obtiene ganancias diarias. Ahora el objetivo de esta familia, es mejorar su nivel de vida y expandir su negocio de miel. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Naranjales” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Carmen de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para la limpieza de la maleza que crece en sus cafetales, además de calaminas para techar uno de los cuartos de su casa.
texts.en:
36-year-old Carmen lives in the village of 'Villa Ashaninga'.  There she formed her family together with her husband of 15 years, Augusto.  The couple have three dependent children who they care for and educate in their own home.

With the seriousness and courage that she is noted for, Carmen started creating her own household finances by working in agriculture, the main business activity of her family.  With the help of her husband, she grows coffee which she harvests once a year, making considerable profits.  She tells us that her crops are young and don't require a great deal of maintenance.  However, she fertilizes them constantly to maintain their quality.  During the year, Carmen also works selling rainforest-bee honey.  The cost of this honey is very high because it has curative properties.  She sells an average of 20 kilos a day.  She tells us that she has 8 years experience in this business and has regular customers.  In addition, Augusto, her husband, works in the public transport business with a motorcycle taxi, covering the Pichanki to Sangani route.  This also makes them daily profits.

The current aim of this family is to improve their standard of living and expand their honey business.  Carmen belongs to the 'Los Naranjales' community bank and this is her fourth loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your support so that she can continue achieving her goals.  She pledges to make her loan repayments punctually.  With your support, Carmen will invest the money she has requested in buying tools for weeding her coffee plantations.  She will also buy sheets of metal so that she can roof one of the rooms in her house.

loans.use: to buy tools for weeding and to buy sheets of metal for her house

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 26 years old and lives in Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. She has a snack vending business in the school and earns approximately PHP 700 each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan of  7,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending. Rose has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending.

loans.name: Rofich

texts.en:
Rofich and his wife, Symas, (pictured together with their grandchild) have been married for more than 30 years and have four children - three sons and one daughter. Three are married and the other one is in school. They live about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Rofich's family is Cham Muslim. The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia.

Rofich and his wife sell recycling materials. Rofich’s son who is married wants to live in a separate home, but he does not have money to make the building. Hence Rofich decided to request a loan of $500 to build a house for his son.

loans.use: To build a house for his son who is married.

loans.name: Rita Del Carmen

texts.es: Rita Del Carmen es pensionada, ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, inodoro, pega, clavos, cemento entre otros. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y quiere realizarle estas mejoras a su hogar pues son muy necesarias. A pesar de que ya no trabaja con lo poco que obtiene quiere mejorar cada día su vivienda, los esfuerzos constantes le han ayudado a sobrevivir. Sueña con ampliar cada día su vivienda.
texts.en: Rita Del Carmen is a pensioner.  She is applying for this loan so that she can buy construction materials such as zinc, a toilet, adhesive, nails, cement, and other supplies.  Rita is a very responsible woman who wants to make necessary improvements to her home.  Even though she is no longer working, Rita wants to use what little she has to make improvements each day to her home.  Her constant efforts have helped her to survive.  She dreams of expanding her home each day.

loans.use: to buy zinc, a toilet, adhesive, nails, cement, and other supplies.

loans.name: Cegerina

texts.en:
Cegerina is a 40 year old business woman, who lives in Juba. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 20 and 8.  All of them go to school. 

Cegerina runs a food store. She has been in the business for 5 years. She has no employees. Cegerina heard about Finance Sudan through the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more food items like cassava flour and maize flour. Aside from this business, Cegerina  has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Cegerina would like to have a food store and a good stock.

Her major challenges include home expenses and school fees.   

Cegerina says that, she is happy that Finance Sudan opened her eyes because she did not know about loans.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like cassava flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua has been selling maize at the village of Besease, near Elmina, for six years. She is married to a farmer and has three children. Ekua assists her husband in providing for their family. Her loan will be used to purchase bulk maize to sell. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tailor supplies.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta de 45 años es una mujer soltera y vive contenta. En la ciudad de Lima vive su única hija, Mariluz de 16 años. Ahora Jacinta vive sola en su casa propia, en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Palomar, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Jacinta es una mujer admirable. Su fuerza y decisión ha hecho posible que eduque a Mariluz en la capital del país. No le importa vivir sola, pues sabe que los sacrificios al final traerán buenos resultados. Gracias a la agricultura, a podido salir adelante y solventar sus gastos. Cuenta con terrenos propios de cultivo, donde tiene sembrado café, plátanos y palta.  Predominando la producción del producto bandera se su zona, el café. La faena es dura y cansada, por esa razón tiene que contratar personal para la limpieza, abonamiento y cosecha de sus productos. Los meses de mayo y junio son cruciales en el negocio de los granos de café. Los compradores ya saben como contactarla. Jacinta no se preocupa de las ventas solo de la producción.
Es consciente que sola no se sentirá feliz. Así que después de ahorrar el dinero necesario viajará a la ciudad de Lima para vivir con su hija. Pero afirma que no descuidará sus cultivos, dejando a personal encargado para su mantenimiento. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café”, y éste sería su crédito número 2 de MFP, por lo que agradecería su apoyo. Por su parte menciona ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas, como lo fue en el ciclo anterior. Con el dinero podrá comprar bolsas de abonos para sus cultivos, así también pagará los servicios de los operarios a quienes contratará para la época de cosecha.
texts.en:
Jacinta, 45, is single and lives contently. Her only daughter, Mariluz, is 16 and lives in the city of Lima. Jacinta now lives alone in the house she owns in the community of Santa Rosa de Palomar in the province of Chanchamayo. Jacinta is an admirable woman. Her hard work and decisions have made it possible that Mariluz is educated in the capital. She doesn't mind living alone because she knows that ultimately her sacrifices will bring good results. Thanks to farming, she has been able to get ahead and cover her expenses. She has her own farmland where she plants coffee, plantains and avocado. In her region, coffee dominates the production. The work is hard and tiring, so she has to hire workers for cleaning, spreading manure and harvesting her products. The months of May and June are crucial for the coffee bean business. The buyers already know how to contact her. Jacinta isn't worried about her sales, just about her production.

She is aware that she won't be happy alone. After saving enough money, she will travel to Lima to live with her daughter. She will leave workers in charge of maintaining her crops, so they don't go uncared for. 

Jacinta belongs to the communal bank "Aroma de Cafe" and this will be her second loan with MFP, whom she thanks for their support. She will be punctual in her repayments, as she was in the previous cycle. With the money she will buy bags of compost for her crops and will also pay the wages of the laborers that she will contract during the harvest.

loans.use: to buy sacks of compost and contract day laborers.

loans.name: Ma. Morita

texts.en:
Ma. Morita is 55 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Morita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a ready-to-wear retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Ma. Morita has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ready-to-wear retail business for four years and earns additional income from fish vending.

Ma. Morita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: 0201021-Hợp Tân-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish sauce. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish sauce to resell. 

Minh is 55 years old and she is married with 4 children. She is the leader of a 8-member group, the 0201021-Hợp Tân Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2010, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Minh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Minh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Minh hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: To purchase fish sauce to resell.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, aged 18, 17, 14 and four years respectively.
