For the past three years, she has had a scrap business, which earns her a monthly income of KES 15,000. She wants to buy more scrap materials and pay her children's school fees, so she has requested a loan of KES 30,000. 

The anticipated profits will assist her in paying the school fees for her children. Her dream is to buy a plot and open up a big wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials and pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne âgée de 39 ans, a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Jeanne est mariée à un comptable du nom de Apollinaire. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par le couple. Pour cette raison, Jeanne  vend depuis quinze ans des liqueurs, des boules l’akassa(pâtes de maïs fermenté) et des poissons par la technique de distribution. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Jeanne achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Jeanne sollicite pour une quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des vivres et des condiments.

loans.name: Kamilahon

texts.ru: Камилахон, 55 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством, полеводством и садоводством на 2 Га земли. Благодаря упорному труду, Камилахон на сегодняшний день имеет 1 корову. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Камилахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистой продукции. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for land cultivation and growing organic products

loans.name: Osaruwmense

texts.en: Mrs. Osaruwmense I. is 39 years old; a market trader who specializes in the sale of baby wears for the community. She is married with four (4) children she said that if given the loan it would help her boost her business

loans.use: To buy more baby wears for sale

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah lives in Nkurankan, Eastern Region, Ghana. She operates a retail shop in her community. She has no capital to put into her shop. She is seeking a Kiva loan of $850.00 to help her buy goods and expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Michael A. is married and has two children. He had been working as a carpenter before joining Life in Africa. When he is not working at LiA, Michael works as a part-time carpenter to support his family.

Michael moved from Amuru to Gulu because of the growing conflict and dangers in Amuru. When he first moved to Gulu, he found life to be difficult, but when he began working as a carpenter again, he found the transition to be easier. He helped build the materials necessary to construct the Awere Secondary School, which offered education for displaced children. Currently, Michael leads the construction of all of Life in Africa’s buildings at the WE Gulu Center.

Currently Michael is employed with Life in Africa as the production manager. He began this job as a volunteer because he saw it was necessary to aid in the organization of the producers. His work was satisfactory, and he eventually began getting paid. He is happy with the Life in Africa program because it has greatly changed his standard of living and his family life. He can now raise over 300,000 ushs/month for his living.

Michael plans to use his loan of 150 USD to purchase a phone set. He will place the phone under the charge of his wife, and he believes that by operating the phone, he will be able to make 70,000 ushs. The money he makes from his public pay phone would be used to help pay for domestic necessities such as food and his loans.

He plans to repay the loan after a period of 3 months.

loans.use: buying pay phone set.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Adrine wants to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Wayan

texts.id:
An age of over half a century does not dampen Wayan N. to still be productive. Her wish to provide education as high as possible also pushes her will on her pig farming business that she has started years ago. By raising 4 piglets to fatten Wayan N. provide a living for her family from the profit she made. Every 6 months Wayan N. could profit Rp1,200,000 (about $130) that she used for daily living expenses and schooling expenses for her daughter who is still in Middle school. To repair her non permanent hut situation also was done so that the family could live more proper. Wayan N. is very thankful for the DINARI loan, so that her plans to increase the number of her animals, and to raise a mother feedstock could be fulfilled.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usia yang sudah melewati setengah abad tidak menyurutkan semangat Wayan N. untuk tetap bekerja. Keinginan untuk bisa menyekolahkan putrinya setinggi-tingginya juga memacunya untuk tetap menjalankan usaha beternak babi yang sudah dijalaninya bertahun-tahun. Dengan memelihara 4 ekor penggemukan Wayan N. memenuhi kebutuhan hidup keluarganya lewat keuntungan- keuntungan yang diperolehnya. Dalam setiap enam bulan Wayan N. mendapat keuntungan Rp 1200.000,- yang kemudian dipergunakan untuk mencukupi biaya hidup sehari-hari dan biaya sekolah putrinya yang masih di SMP. Memperbaiki keadaan rumahnya yang belum permanen juga sedang diupayakannya supaya keluarganya bisa menempati rumah yang nyaman. Wayan N. sangat berterimakasih atas pinjaman modal usaha yang diberikan Dinari sehingga rencananya untuk menambah jumlah ternaknya dengan memelihara penginduk bisa terpenuhi.

loans.use:
To buy piglets for fattening and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi penggemukan dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en:
Pavel M. and his wife live in Khoost, Ukraine. Pavel owns a car and works as a taxi driver. He has been in this business for 4 years. His monthly profit currently amounts to around $400.

Pavel is requesting a loan of $200 to fix his car. Without the credit, he would not be able to afford to make the repair. Pavel wants to keep his business and work as a taxi driver because he loves getting to know other people who are traveling different places.

loans.use: Repair taxi

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane’s "hotel" (aka pub) is a good place to chill with a beer if you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. It’s the kind of place where you kick back on a plastic chair under a tree, with a bad local beer in hand (sorry Tanzania), the aroma of roasting ‘mishikaki’ (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to anyone and everyone who happens to wander by.

Jane opened the business in 2005 and requires a loan of $425 to expand her business by purchasing some new furniture and additional stock (her happy customers have drunk the place dry!) Jane is an independent young woman with a ten year-old daughter, Harinet and she thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback arrangement as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are therefore termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase furniture and stock for her pub

loans.name: Ni Made

texts.id:
It is the norm in Indonesian villages that women should stay home to take care of children and clean home while waiting for husbands to come home from work. This is not the case for Ni Made S.. She lives in a village, and her husband works for the local government. Ni Made S. wants to help her husband in earning better living for her family. With startup funding of $110, Ni Made S. opened a kiosk selling snacks and soft drinks. She bought small racks, thermos flasks and various snacks and drinks. Because her location is close to the village primary school, there are many school kids that buys her products. In a day, Ni Made S. can earn $3 profit. Ni Made S. is seeking $550 loan from Dinari Foundation. This fund will be used to renovate her kiosk as it needs improvement and has no walls. Besides that the loan will be used to increase offering variety such as instant noodle and meatballs that her clients often requested. She hopes that she will earn more business with better and more hygienic kiosk condition and with better product offerings.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sudah menjadi opini publik, khususnya di pedesaan, bahwa seorang wanita hanya tinggal dirumah untuk merawat anak dan membersihkan rumah sambil menunggu suami datang dari tempat kerja. Hal ini tidak berlaku bagi Ni Made S.. Walaupun tinggal di pedesaan dan suaminya bekerja pada Instansi Pemerintahan, Ni Made S. ingin membantu perekonomian keluarganya dan memiliki hasil dari jerih payahnya sendiri sehingga ia tidak hanya mengandalkan penghasilan suaminya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 1.000.000.- , Ni Made S. membuka usaha warung yang khusus menjual aneka kue dan minuman ringan. Modal itu ia belikan sebuah rak kecil, gelas, termos es, aneka kue dan minuman ringan. Karena lokasinya dekat dengan Sekolah Dasar, banyak anak – anak yang berbelanja diwarungnya sehingga dalam sehari Ni Made S. bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 25.000.- Saat ini Ni Made S. memohon pinjaman sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- di Yayasan Dinari. Dana ini akan ia gunakan untuk memperbaiki warungnya, karena yang saat ini kondisinya kurang baik dan belum ada dindingnya. Selain itu, dana tersebut akan digunakan untuk menambah fasilitas warung berupa mie instant dan bakso sesuai permintaan dari pelanggannya. Dengan kondisi warung yang lebih baik dan hyeginis serta fasilitas warung yang ditambah, Ni Made S. yakin usahanya akan berkembang lebih maju.

loans.use: To Renovate Kiosk

loans.name: Dorotea's Group

texts.en:
Ricardina, Dorotea, and Juana have been part of the community bank “8th of September”  between six months and one year.  They all live in the district of Acosyinchos, which is one hour away from the city of Ayacucho.  In the community bank they have learned how to care for their health, invest their money, and how to run their businesses more efficiently.
Ricardina is 31 years old.  She is married and has five children.  Ricardina raises and then butchers pigs.  She then sells them to people in her village.
Dorotea is 37 years old.  She is married and has two children.  Dorotea, together with her husband, cuts firewood and kindling.  She sells is to middlemen who take it to Ayacucho and to the coast.  Dorotea would like to open a bakery.
Meanwhile, Juana is 35 years old.  She is married and has four children.  Juana sells a variety of grains in the city of Ayacucho.  She buys the grains in the town of Acosyinchos.  In addition, Juana occasionally sells meat.
Ricardina, Dorotea, and Juana need loans of 450, 450, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy pigs, eucalyptus wood, barley, wheat, corn, and quinoa.
One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Ricardina, Dorotea, and Juana plan to use their savings to educate their children, and if there is an emergency.  Their dreams are that their children will study and have a better life then they do.

loans.use: Ricardina, Dorotea, and Juana need loans of 450, 450, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy pigs, eucalyptus wood, barley, wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Maria Angélica

texts.es:
Maria Angélica has been a single mother of six children for the past 12 years. She has been selling clothes in a local market for 25 years. However, her business isn’t restricted to this field. Twelve years ago, she encountered the opportunity to be part of a school supplies fair and took her chances. From February to May, she now runs a bookstore at the fair. During those four months she is exclusively devoted to this business, resuming clothes sales the rest of the year.

She destined part of the income to her children, while the rest was invested back in her business or saved in order to buy a strip of land. Maria Angélica is very proud of having built four rooms in the land she acquired with her savings, which she now rents to four families. When it comes to her children, tiredness doesn’t exist and her strenght never falters.

Even with all she has accomplished to date, she still dreams of building a bazaar at her house, which would be more profitable and require less hard work than selling her products at the fair or the market.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Angélica es madre soltera de seis hijos desde hace doce años. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en un mercado hace veinticinco años. Aunque no es el único rubro al que se enfoca, hace doce años, al ver la oportunidad de formar parte de una feria de útiles escolares se animó y, de febrero a mayo, maneja una librería en la feria. En estos cuatro meses se dedica integra a este negocio y retoma la venta de ropa en los meses restantes.

Si bien el dinero que ganaba de su trabajo en gran parte lo destinaba a sus hijos, otra parte lo reinvertía en sus negocios y lo que restaba lo ahorraba para la compra de un terreno. Hoy en día, Maria Angélica se siente orgullosa de haber llegado a construir cuatro habitaciones en aquel terreno que llegó a comprar y que ahora lo alquila a cuatro familias. Y es que cuando se trata de sus hijos no hay fuerzas que le falten y cansancio que exista.

Con todo lo logrado hasta ahora, ella sueña aún con construir una tienda bazar en su casa, porque es más rentable y además porque el trabajo no es tan pesado como la venta de sus productos en el mercado y la feria.

loans.use: Set up a bazaar at home.

loans.name: Idalina

texts.es:
Mrs. Idalina O. is married to Mr. Alberto Samaniego. Together they have two children.

She has been running a business in her home for 7 years. She and her husband both work to support the family, since her children are still underage. Idalina runs a general store, where she sells all kinds of basic foodstuff, such as herbs, sugar, milk, bread, noodles, canned goods, cleaning supplies, etc. The store has many customers and is well-known in the area because of the owner’s excellent service.

The loan being requested is for the purchase of a freezer, since Idalina needs it in order to keep her products fresh, and to increase her variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Idalina O. esta casada con el señor Alberto Samaniego, tienen dos hijos.

Ella tiene un negocio en su domicilio particular desde hace 7 años y juntos trabajan para el mantenimiento de su familia, ya que sus hijos aún son menores de edad. El negocio que tiene Idalina es una despensa, en donde comercializa todo tipos de insumos de primera necesidad como yerba, azúcar, leche, pan, fideos, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza, etc. Tiene mucha clientela y es muy reconocido en la zona por la buena atención de la dueña.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar un congelador ya que necesita para mantener sus productos frescos y también ampliar así la variedad de productos para la venta.

loans.use: Purchase of freezer

loans.name: Santos Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge is married with one son, 11 years old. He began his business when he realized he was not able to cover his family's expenses with his salary. 10 years ago he purchased a small plot of land outside the city, and began to raise chickens. In 2002, hurricane Isidoro destroyed his chicken coops and he had to rebuild. Little by little he has been rebuilding, but now he needs to invest in more chickens and chicken feed in order to be fully operational.

He is requesting a loan, which he will repay in 6 months, so he can continue to run his business. We can help Jorge continue to improve his situation.

Jorge, es casado y tiñe un hijo de 11 años, empezó su negocio al ver que no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos familiares con su sueldo de empleado, por lo que hace 10 años compro un terreno a las afueras de la ciudad y ahí construyo gallineros para la crianza de pollos, pero en el año 2002 el huracán Isidoro se los destruyo, poco a poco ha logrado ir reconstruyendo los gallineros, ahora necesita invertir en pollos y alimento para tener el ciclo completo.

Para ello solicita un préstamo por US $725 que pagara en 6 meses, para así poder continuar con su negocio. Apoyemos a jorge a salir adelante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CHICKENS AND CHICKEN FEED FOR HIS BUSINESS.  AFTER HURRICANE ISIDORO DESTROYED HIS CHICKEN COOPS IN 2002, HE HAS HAD TO SLOWLY REBUILD.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
S. Jamila is 39 years old, married, and has two children.
Jamila earns income selling such goods as batteries, blades, machine twist and treads, and pens. In addition, some days of the week, she sells blankets in a local market. Jamila has been in this business already for eight years. Her husband, pictured in the photograph, helps and supports her. Like all mothers, Jamila hopes that her children will be able to obtain higher education; threrefore, she and her husband are working very hard, and their business is successful in providing sufficient income for the family. Currently, Jamila needs a loan to be able to expand the business and to purchase new goods for sale. Therefore, she is asking for US$300 for a term of 3 months. Having borrowed from IMON already several times, and having demonstrated herself as a reliable client, Jamila promises to manage also this loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Expansion of a retail business and purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Atiae

texts.en: Atiae F., 39, is married with four children. She has many years of experience making banana chips, which she sells to the public four days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Atiae’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to stock up on inventory for her business.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable oil, plastic papers and bananas to make banana chips

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 36 years old. She is a married woman with 3 children aged 19, 12 and 7 months. She became a snack seller in 2007. She works everyday from 6am to 10pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Joyce has previously taken out 1 successful loan from President Fund Tanzania to start her business. Joyce now requests a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Greetings from Hussein in Gisenyi town in the north of Rwanda! Hussein is 35 years old, married with three children.

Hussein earns his living by driving a motorcycle-taxi. He transports people on the motorbike around Gisenyi town. He also transports luggage to and from local markets. Besides his transportation business, his wife operates a small shop in town where she sells various home use items. He earns about US$ 135 from transporting people on his motorbike.

Hussein is looking for a loan worth 502,265 frw to buy a new motorbike because the one he owns is getting old. He will be repaying this loan on monthly basis over 8 months.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to use for his business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita inició el negocio cuando su esposo se quedo sin trabajo, y ante L. falta D. ingresos económicos que le permitiera tener el sustento básico para sus hijos decidió vender productos por catalogo. Comenzó en el año 2000, cuando una comadre le presto sus catálogos y le empezó a ayudar a vender, después elL. fue creando sus clientes y decidió independizarse y hacer L. ventas directamente, obteniendo así mejores ingresos.

ElL. necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagar en 6 meses para comprar el nuevo catalogo D. temporada primavera verano, y mercancía que tiene pendiente D. surtir.
texts.en:
Margarita began her business when her husband was without work, and under the lack of income that would permit her to proviD. a basic living for her children, she decided to sell products by catalogue. She began in the year 2000, when a godmother of her children lent her her catalogues and she began to help selling. Afterwards, she was growing her client base and she decided to become independent and to do sales directly, thus obtaining a better income. She needs a loan of US $375 that she would repay in 6 months in order to buy a new catalogue for the spring and summer seasons, and so she can front the cost for the merchandise that she has already taken orders for on credit.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and a new seasonal catalogue

loans.name: Keov

texts.en: Mr. Keov V. is a villager in Boeng Basak Village in Kampong Cham Province. He helps his wife, Mrs. Va Sinat, with her food-selling business. Because this business is going well, they want to expand it; so Mr. Keov V. decided to ask for a loan to buy ingredients to make the delicious food for his customers. Mr. Keov V. is 45 years old and the father of two children.  One child is attending the local school, while the other is two years old, too young to work or study.  Mr. Keov V.'s wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make delicious food for his customers.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita A. G. is 32 years old, married, and the mother of one child who is currently in school. She lives with her family in Tema in the Greater Accra Region of Ghana. She is a trader who has been trading in lace clothes, women's slippers, and dressing bags for the past five years. She requests a loan to augment her working capital to buy more stock to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to earn more income to support her family. Rita is a member of a community group called “Morning Star” Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of lace clothes, dressing bags, and slippers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 52 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells cosmetics. She started this business in 2001. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says, "thanks" to all of the people that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Diamantes Group

texts.en:
The Diamantes (“Diamonds”) Village Bank is beginning its fourth loan cycle with 21 group members.  The group members are involved in a variety of businesses. They sell plastics, cell phones, dry goods, clothing, gifts, cosmetics, sweets, grains and animals. Some sell from home or on the street, while others sell from catalogues or on special order.

Viviana is 35 years old and lives with her partner and their child. Viviana has a store in her home, where she sells vegetables and dry goods with the help of her mother. Viviana needs a loan of 300 soles to buy rice and sugar.  Patricia is 35 years old and single. She sells catalogue cosmetics on credit to friends and family members. Patricia needs a loan of 600 soles to buy lipliner and perfumes. Felicitas is 63 years old and married with five children. Felicitas sells clothing in different regional markets, to which she travels every week. Felicitas buys cheese at these markets and resells it from door to door. Felicitas needs a loan of 600 soles to buy baby clothes. The group members are requesting different loan amounts, of 300, 600, 900 or 1000 soles. The group is requesting a total of 11,800 Peruvian Soles.  They will use the loans to buy rice, sugar, milk, cheese, grains, meat, t-shirts, sweaters, lotions, vegetables and sweets.  The group members dream of expanding their businesses, of opening their own stores, and of sending their children to school to study professional careers. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

El Banco Comunal Diamantes inicia su cuarto ciclo con 21 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. plásticos, celulares, verduras, abarrotes en general, ropa, regalos, carne, cosméticos, golosinas, cereales, venta D. animales. Sus ventas los realizan en sus domicilios, ambulantemente y también a través D. catálogos y pedidos. 
Como es el caso D. Viviana que es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Viviana tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. verduras, abarrotes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su mama. Viviana necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar. 
Por otro lado Patricia es soltera, tiene 35 años y vive con su padre, Patricia venD. cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos, familiares y venD. al crédito. Patricia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lápiz labial, perfumes. 
Mientras que Felicitas es casada, tiene 63 años y 5 hijos, Felicitas venD. ropa en las diferentes ferias D. la región a donD. viaja todas las semanas y D. las ferias compra quesos que venD. D. casa en casa. Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ropa D. bebe. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total D. 11,800 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche, quesos, cereales, carne, polos, chompas, perfumes, cremas, verduras, golosinas. 
Los sueños D. las socias son hacer crecer sus negocios, tener una tienda, educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar, milk, cheese, grains, meat, t-shirts, sweaters, lotions, vegetables and sweets.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Soeurn S. is a villager in Pong Toek village in Kampong Cham province. She owns a small general store where she sells grocery goods. She is a 54 year-old widow with a child attending the local school. Although Mrs. Soeurn S. tries to work hard, she still lives in poor conditions. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Soeurn S. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding to increase her income to support her family living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía recibe una renta mensual del Magisterio ya que es profesora jubilada. Es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta.
Vive en la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz, en anticrético
El crédito será destinado para el aumento de un anticrético (Anticrético es una figura legal por la que el dueño de casa, a cambio de una suma estipulada de dinero, concede una habitación, o un departamento completo, o toda la casa a un inquilino que podrá vivir por un lapso de dos años en dicho inmueble y al cabo del tiempo del contrato, el dueño de casa se compromete a devolver el dinero original) y poder ampliar su vivienda y sus condiciones de habitat.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Sofia receives a salary from the university because she is a retired professor. This is the only source of income on which she counts on. Sofia lives in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz in "anticretico". ["Anticretico" is a legal arrangement by which the owner of a house, in exchange of a stipulated sum of money, grants a room, an apartment or a home to a renter who is allowed to live there for a period of two years and at the end of the contract term the owner of the house promises to return the original sum of money] The loan she is requesting will be used to increase the "anticretico" to allow her to expand her home. This is the second time that Sofia requests a loan from IMPRO. Her credit history qualifies her as a client 1 which means that she has a good record of repaying her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of money for an "anticretico" contract.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 41 años, vive en su propia casa con su esposa y sus dos hijos; Sheyly de 19 y Yonat de 14, lo que más desea es darles buenos estudios superiores a sus hijos.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. Cuando Miguel tenia 21 años, tuvo que dejar la universidad y buscar un trabajo, puesto que no tenía el dinero necesario para continuar con sus estudios, así fue que se dedico a trabajar en varias cosas y después de intentar en muchos trabajos, encontró el ideal. Miguel se siente feliz siendo taxista y no se puede quejar, ya que este trabajo le da el dinero necesario para mantener a su familia. Ya lleva 10 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es la libertad que tiene en su trabajo, ya que puede conducir tranquilamente su taxi por las calles de Puno en busca de clientes, pero lo que menos le gusta es arreglar su carro cuando sufre algún desperfecto. Miguel anhela tener un negocio más rentable, tal vez un restaurante o una bodega, aun no se decide, pero lo que sí sabe es que tiene que trabajar duro para lograrlo. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es el único varón y siente que tiene el compromiso de ser muy responsable. Con el dinero que solicita arreglará su auto para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miguel is 41 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their two children; Sheyly, who is 19 years old, and Yonat, who is 14. What he most desires is to give his children good higher education. When Miguel was 21 years old, he had to leave the university and look for a job because he didn't have enough money to continue his studies. After this he worked a variety of jobs and after trying many jobs he found the ideal one. Miguel feels happy being a taxi driver and he can't complain since this job gives him the money he needs to support his family. He has worked at this job for 10 years and he most likes the freedom that this job gives him, since he can calmly drive his taxi through the streets of Puno looking for customers. His least favorite part is fixing his car when there is something wrong with it. Miguel desires to have a more profitable business, maybe a restaurant or small grocery store, he still has not decided, but he does know that he has to work hard to achieve that. This is his first loan with MFP, he knows he has to repay it on time because he does not want to cause problems for the members of his community bank, of whom he is the only male and he feels he has the obligation to be very responsible. With the money he requests he will fix his car to be able to provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn B. lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is happily married and has three children. Her husband is a painter and tricycle driver. She started her backyard hog-fattening business with three piglets. Now Roselyn is raising a sow with the help of her mother who attended a hog-raising seminar.

Four years ago, Roselyn became a member of PMPC and the co-op became a partner in her livelihood project. She is very involved and a hardworking mother.

Roselyn is applying for a loan of Php 25,000 to purchase feed for her piglets and hogs. Her future plan is to be able to expand her backyard hog-raising business, to build her own house (since she is living with her parents), and to be able to send her three children to college and allow them finish their studies.

loans.use: Purchase additional feed for her piglets and hogs.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol has owned a grocery store for four years. Carol is a 36-year old divorced woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her child. She has requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Carol has requested a loan.

Carol sells a great variety of products. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and people from her region. She has not faced difficulties since she first started this business. In the future, she plans on improving her business and increasing her income.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a grocery store

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es: Eduarda tiene 53 años, desde que enviudó ha sacado adelante a sus 4 hijos, quienes viven con ella en la casa que pudo construir con su trabajo. Su habilidad está en sus manos y la creatividad que también posee le abrió las puertas para dedicarse a la decoración, y con el tiempo la incentivaron a especializarse en la elaboración de manualidades y decoraciones para diversos eventos y compromisos. Desde hace 16 años no deja de trabajar, ya que las personas solicitan sus servicios para eventos sociales. Por las tardes exhibe sus preciosas decoraciones en su casa, tratando siempre de estar preparada para el momento que tenga que decorar los salones de recepción, pues a veces son impredecibles algunos eventos. Asimismo, está pendiente de la moda y de los últimos cambios en decoración, y trata de especializarse estudiando algunos cursos al respecto. Todo este sacrificio tiene como fin instalar una tienda junto a dos amigas, quienes tienen los mismos deseos de exponer diversas decoraciones para el hogar, y que para el futuro formen una gran empresa. Este es su catorceavo crédito con MFP y desde que formó parte de su grupo ha tratado de participar con sus compañeras, quienes son personas comprometidas por el desarrollo del banco comunal. Los 1000 soles que solicita le servirán para adquirir algunos materiales para seguir elaborando  diversas decoraciones e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Eduarda is 53 years old and, since becoming a widow, has supported her 4 children who live with her in a house she managed to build through her work. Her ability lies in her hands and creativity, which opened doors to dedicate herself to decorating. Over time, this gave her incentive to specialize in making handicrafts and decorations for various events and milestones. She has not stopped working for 16 years now, as people solicit her services for special occasions. In the afternoons, she exhibits her precious decorations in her house, trying always to be ready if called to decorate a reception hall since sometimes events are unpredictable. Likewise, she is always aware of current trends and latest changes in design, and she tries to specialize in her craft by taking classes in this area. All of this sacrifice is aimed to help her open a store with two friends, who have the same desire to provide a diverse range of decorations for the home and they hope to create a large enterprise in the future. This is her fourteenth loan with MFP and, since she became part of this group, she has tried to participate with her colleagues who are very dedicated to the development of the cooperative bank. The 1000 soles that she requests will serve to acquire some materials so she can continue making her decorations and grow her income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make her decorations.

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokunthea K. is a villager in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is a teacher in a local school. Her husband, Mr. Chhuon Chrey, is a company employee. This couple has two children, one of whom stays at home to do housework while the other is attending the local school.

Now Mrs. Sokunthea K. wants her first child to learn motorbike repair but she does not have enough money to support him. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She hopes to provide a better life for her child and improve her family’s living afterwards. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To pay for her first child to learn motorbike repair

loans.name: Juana Elsa

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92709&_tpos=5&_tpg=1
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Juana  con los ahorros  adquirió, un puesto donde vende carne de res, carnicería JHOANNA,      
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de mercadería para su negocio, siempre debe surtir de mondongo, hígado, bofe, que compra Importados por cajas.
Aprovecha que está en Finca para invertir cada vez más.
Continua con su sueño de comprarse una cámara frigorífica.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92709&_tpos=5&_tpg=1 Juana is a member of the "Avancemos Juntas" village bank. With her savings, Juana has been able to open a store called Carniecería Jhoanna, where she sells meat. Juana needs a load of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy merchandise for her store. She always needs to keep tripe, liver and lung in stock and she buys them imported by the case. She makes use of her Finca loans to invest a little more in her store each time. Her goal continues to be to one day purchase a walk-in freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda Q. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Belinda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Belinda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Belinda is just starting this business.

In 2009, Belinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will used to purchase pig feed and other supply. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Belinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is a businesswoman. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials. She sometimes sells by hawking: a personal selling method that she says makes her goods move very fast.

She is 45 years old and a married mother with three children. All her children are in school. She is supporting her family with the proceeds she makes from her business. She has 15 years of experience in sales, but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds.

She hopes this loan will enable her to revive the business and bring in more profit. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. It is her desire to save more money to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de los Ángeles U. tiene 54 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Maria es una mujer muy humilde y le gusta trabajar. Su actividad económica es una pulpería hace mas de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella inicio ofreciendo golosinas en general, productos lácteos y gaseosas. Ha logrado obtener muy buenos resultados ya que ha logrado obtener muy buenos ingresos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de jugos, granos básicos, pan, galletas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es realizarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles is 54 years old and has two children she is responsible for. Maria is a very humble woman who likes to work. Her livelihood is a small grocery store that she has run for more than seven years. She began by offering candies in general, milk products, and carbonated drinks. She has succeeded in obtaining very good results and income.

The financing she requests is for capital to buy juices, basic grains, breads, and cookies, amongst other things. Her wish is to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick Clarke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old and married with a child. She is a hair dresser, and she also sells kitchen utensils. Her salon is open daily from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

She hopes for a loan of 140,000 NGN to buy more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to LAPO and all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils to sell in her salon

loans.name: Tang

texts.en: Tang L. is 43 years old and father to seven children: six are single and the other one is married and has already started a new family. In the beginning of 2002, Tang L. has been working in building apartment. He also assists his wife's handicraft work, to weave bamboo basket for sale. The family's living conditions are not comfortable due to their house is cracking down frequently. With this difficulty, Tang L. has decided to seek a loan to add to his personal saving to buy housing equipment in order to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy housing equipment in order to build a new house

loans.name: Ndidi

texts.en: Ndidi is 30 years old, single, and has no children. He sells automobile spare parts to earn a living. He hopes to expand this business by working hard to lift his business out of poverty. He has been in the business for four years. He is requesting a loan for N60,000 to purchase more automobile spare parts to sell. He expresses his gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more automobile spare parts to sell

loans.name: Said Pacha

texts.en:
Said Pacha is an old man. He is an uneducated man, but he has lots of experience. He has a retail shop in Jalalabad that he has been involved in for more than 10 years. Before this loan, he worked in agriculture in his own town. He now has the responsibility of his family. During the last 10 years he tried many times to enlarge his shop but he was unable. When he found AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint stock Company) in Jalalabad he was very happy and decided to apply for a loan.

Now he is requesting an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis to enlarge his shop and to further his business. With more success and strength in his business, he will make a good monthly income for his family.

Sayed Pacha wants to thank lenders around the world and to thank Kiva and AFS. He would like to say thanks from all who support him with this fantastic loan process. 
He says that people in Jalalabad, Afghanistan have been faced with lots of difficulties and he would love to see more success with this program in the future.

loans.use: He wants to comlete his stocks.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 50 years old and a hog-raiser from the village of Marobbob Amulung, Cagayan. She is married to Eduardo, and they have seven children: Ludivina, 28 years old, a college graduate and a domestic helper in Hong Kong; Natalia, 27 years old, a high school graduate and a farmer; Joey, 25 years old, at high school level and also a farmer; Evangeline, a 23-year-old high school graduate; Marilyn, a 21-year-old high school graduate; Nimfa, 18 years old and a college student taking up Hotel and Restaurant Management; and Shelo, 18 years old and a college student taking up Criminology. 

Josefina used to engage in a retail business. However, due to lack of capital, it did not survive, so she was forced to close it because she couldn't meet the demands of her customers. 

She then decided to venture into the hog-raising business which is located in their back yard. With the small capital from her store, she purchased a few hogs. She hopes to increase her number of hogs but she needs more capital. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will give her the chance to make her business productive by lending her 10,000 PHP. This will be of great help in making her business profitable.

loans.use: To buy more hogs for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem P., 27, is a humble villager who lives in Reusey Keo commune, in Phnom Penh city. She works as a teacher at the local public school and typically earns a salary of $120 a month to help provide her family’s food needs. She is a single woman and currently lives with her young sister, who works as a Civil Service officer for a ministry.

Hem P. has been planning to operate a café business for years, but she doesn’t have enough money to start it. That is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva through HKL. She will be use her loan to build a shop in front of her home where she will operate a café.

loans.use: To build a café in front of her home

loans.name: Consulacion

texts.en:
Consulacion S. is from the village of South Western Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children.

Consulacion owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Consulacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

location.town: South Western Poblacion Calamba Mis. Occ

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is fifty-eight years old. She is a married woman and has six children. All of her children are in school. Abena lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. She is a trader. She trades in cereals (maize). Abena purchases bags of maize from nearby communities and supplies the product to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to other towns to supply. Abena has been in business for six years and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize.

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA”, Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Saylla, ubicado a 30 minutos en bus local de la ciudad del Cusco. Saylla es lugar de los restaurantes más famosos al aire libre, aquí se pude venir cualquier día de la semana a disfrutar del paisaje mientras se saborea de un deliciosos plato típico de Perú y en especial de a ciudad del Cusco, el chicharrón, (elaborado a base de carne de cerdo son trozos de 3 a 4 acompañadas con papas doradas y choclo dulce o salado con una ensalada de cebolla y hierba buena tipo menta).

El socio es el Sr Inocencio, tiene 48 años de edad, es casado con la socia Hermila, tienen 3 hijos de 17, 10 y 1 y medio de edad, nuestro socio es chofer, el trabaja con su carro propio haciendo servicio de pasajeros en las rutas de Cusco a Urcos, el socio también colabora con la atención del negocio familiar de la Chicharronería, venden también trucha frita o al vapor o al horno, caldos de gallina y chairo.  Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para el negocio familiar.

El socio agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Inocencio is a member of the “Ahorro es Progreso [Saving is Progress] - Saylla” communal bank. The community of Saylla, where Inocencio lives, is a 30-minute bus ride from Cusco. It is famous for it’s open-air restaurants serving traditional Peruvian dishes, such as chicharrón (pork rinds) with golden potatoes, sweet or salty corn, and a salad of onion and peppermint. Inocencio is 48 years old. He is married to Hermila and they have three children of 17, 10 and 1½ years. Inocencio has a taxi service. He has his own car and provides passenger service between Cusco and Urcos. In addition, Inocencio helps out with the family business, a restaurant selling chicharrón as well as trout (fried, steamed or baked), chicken soup, and chairo [beef stew]. This loan will be used for supplies for the restaurant. Inocencio is grateful for the opportunity provided by this loan, and promises to make his payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant supplies

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
La Sra. Paquita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 69 años y es madre D. 05 hijos, todos ya independientes y presenta estudios hasta sexto grado D. primaria.

La necesidad D. sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella deciD. iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. gallinas vivas, criadas en su propia casa. Con su primer crédito  D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró pollitos bebes, alimentos balanceados,  donD. comenzó vendiendo poco a poco y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes, que ya conocen D. la actividad que realiza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará, huevos para hacer poner a sus gallinas, alimento balanceado y vitaminas, para mantener sanos a sus animales y libres D. cualquier enfermedad.

Paquita, se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, cree que vale el sacrificio que está haciendo día a día, su sueño es ser una gran empresaria D. ventas D. gallinas. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  muchas mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paquita belongs to the communal bank “Las Brisas”, in the Bellavista district, Bellavista Province, in the Department of San Martin. She is 69, married, and the mother of 5, all independent. She went to school through the sixth graD.. The need to help her children get ahead, and thanks to her spirit and the entrepreneurial energy that she has, she decided to start her own business of selling live chickens, raised in her own house. With her first loan of 300 new sols, she bought chicks, and well-balanced food. She began selling the chickens little by little, and became well-known by the customers who were familiar with the work that she was doing. With this 2,000 new sol loan, she will buy fertilized eggs for her hens, balanced food, and vitamins to keep her chickens free of disease. Paquita feels very satisfied with her work, although it is hard and she has to get up early. She believes that it is worth the daily sacrifice she is making towards her dream of becoming a big businesswoman selling chickens. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for offering her and many women the support so that they can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs and balanced food to keep her chickens healthy

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. P. owns and operates a café in the village, catering to citizens living around her community. Through her business, she is able to feed her family. She also depends on her husband's income as a military policeman in the Ministry of the Interior. P. has been blessed with three children, two of whom are married while one is single and attends high school. P. wants to improve her business and is asking for a loan to accrue capital for her café. With any remaining money from the loan, she will decorate her shop.

loans.use: To accrue capital for her café

loans.name: Mrs. Sileng Vann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sileng V. is a weaver I. her village and her husband, Mr. Samnieng Ouy, is farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support the family. Aside from this, he is a government worker also. I. order to expand their business, Mrs. Sileng V. decided to seek a loan to buy more silk for weaving. This couple does not have a child who lives as a member of the household. 

Sixteen people, who are villagers I. Pea Ream village I. Takeo province, make up this village bank. Mrs. Sileng V. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas en su casa, ubicada  al pie de un cerro, al sur de la ciudad.Es una mujer muy trabajadora, enseña diversos tipos de danzas a niños de su barrio, en su tiempo libre;  además paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, de una reconocida marca. Este trabajo lo  realiza  caminando por los cerros cercanos al lugar donde vive, buscando nuevas clientes. Durante  el verano es muy tedioso, ya que el calor es sofocante, pero  tiene éxito en sus ventas, ya que trabaja mediante  crédito, aunque muchas veces no le pagan oportunamente, pese a eso sigue en la lucha diaria, pues quiere salir adelante. Para el futuro se ha propuesto instalar  una  librería en su casa, donde viene alistando el puesto  con la ayuda de su esposo, que es  albañil, ya que desea iniciarse  inmediatamente en este negocio al que le tiene mucha confianza, y claro sin dejar la venta de cosméticos. Está segura que le irá muy bien, ya que es muy conocida por la zona donde vive.Es el  sexto préstamo que tiene y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible  el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además se compromete a seguir liderando a sus demás compañeras de crédito; para motivarlas a que no se atrasen en los pagos de sus cuotas.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  útiles escolares, para que siga adelante  el proyecto de su librería.
texts.en:
Martha is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters at home, which is located at the foot of a hill in the southern part of the city. She is a hardworking woman who teaches different forms of dance to the children in her neighborhood. In her free time, she sells a well-known brand of beauty products. This work requires that she walk through the hills where she lives in order to find new customers. During the summer the work can be very tedious and the heat is suffocating. Nonetheless, she is successful with her sales. Since she offers products on credit, her customers often do not pay on time so every day is a struggle for her to get ahead. In the future, she plans to open a bookstore in her home and will enlist the help of her husband, who works as a mason. Martha wants to start this business immediately and is very confident about pursuing it without having to abandon her cosmetics sales. She is sure that it will go well because she is very knowledgeable about the area where she lives.

This is the sixth loan Martha has received and she is very grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue to work. She also promises to continue leading the other members of her Communal Bank and motivating them not to fall behind in their payments. Martha plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of school supplies so that she can move forward with her bookstore project.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies to stock her new bookstore

loans.name: Kyehemba Turihamwe Group Of Kyenjojo

texts.en:
It’s now two-and-a-half years since an evergreen and enterprising N. Christopher embarked on his produce sales business in Kyakaitaba in Kyenjojo district.

With nostalgia, this 47-year-old happily married father of seven kids recalls how his business basked in high profit returns at its onset. Times have changed, however, as his business now has diminishing returns. A testament is the 30,000 shillings he is earning now. This is in sharp contrast to the 100,000, he says he was making at the start of his business.

There is always a story connected with people in western Uganda who, despite laboring under such tough times, find a way of educating their children. Christopher is no exception. What he is looking forward to now is the prospect of enhancing his business by buying more maize, beans, cassava and other crops with the proceeds of this loan.

loans.use: To buy additional produce like maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: EL SR. FREDY, CASADO CON LA SRA. AIDA ELLA ES AMA DE CASA COM 3 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, EL SR. FREDY NACIO EN CHUQUISACA EL 3 DE DICIEMBRE DE 1973, HACE 9 AÑOS QUE EL COMPRO SU PARCELA EN EL TIGRE A 7KM DE EL TORNO, EN LA CUAL EL TRABAJA AGRICULTURA, TAMBIEN TIENE SUS SITRICOS COMO NARANJA, MANDARINA, JAPONESA, ETC. SOLO MANTIENE EL HOGAR RAZON POR LA CUAL TIENE QUE TRABAJAR DURO, ALGUNAS VECES RECIBE AYUDA DE SU ESPOSA Y DE SUS HIJOS PERO GENERALMENTE TRABAJA SOLO, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA SEMILLAS DE PAPA PARA SIEMBRA YA QUE ES TEMPORADA DE SIEMBRA UNA VES QUE LO COSECHA LO COMERCIALIZA EN EL MERCADO DE LA ZONA LE VA MUY BIEN CON LA VENTA DE PAPA, ES MUY RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADOR SIEMPRE ESTA VIENDO QUE PRODUCTO SEMBRAR SEGUN SU  TEMPORARA, SU SUEÑO ES EL DE TERMINAR SU CASITA PARA BRINDAR COMODIDAD A SU FAMILIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DLE CREDITO.
texts.en:
Fredy is married to Aida, who is a housewife. They have three schoolaged children. Fredy was born in Chuquisaca on December 3rd of 1973. Nine years ago, he bought a parcel of land in El Tigre 7 KM from El Torno. He farms there. He has his citrus trees, such as oranges, tangerines, yuzus, etc. He is his family's only support, and that is why he works very hard. Sometimes, his wife and children help him but generally he works alone. With the money from the loan, he will buy potato seed to plant, since it is planting time. Once he harvests them, he will sell them in the area market. He does very well selling potatoes. He is very responsible and hardworking. He is always looking for which product to plant according to the season. His dream is to finish building his little house in order for his family to be more comfortable. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have put in him by extending him this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds to plant potatoes

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “KILLA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Anastacia,  ella tiene 36 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de  18, 8, 5 años de edad, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista; La socia tienen un pequeño restaurante y ella atiende desde almuerzos y cenas, también vende gaseosas y extras, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para ampliar su negocio, ella quiere romper una pared y ganar mayor espacio para aumentar mesas en su restaurante. 
  
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner is a member of the Killa village bank and lives in the Huanchac district of Cusco, Peru. Her name is Anastacia and she is a 36 year old single mother with 3 children who are 5, 8, and 18. She juggles her household duties with her work as a retail businesswoman. She runs a small restaurant where she sells lunch and dinner; she also sells soft drinks and other extras. She is seeking the loan to expand her business locale; she would like to tear down a wall and have more space to put more tables in her restaurant. She is grateful for the support she is receiving and promises to repay her debts on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her restaurant locale

loans.name: Melly

texts.en: Melly M., 60 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by fishing and fish vending. She lives Canlinday, Barangay Culipapa, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental, with her husband, Anecio, who is 60 years old, and their four children, who already have their own families. Melly has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and fish-vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Melly is now borrowing PHP 29,000 to use as additional working capital for her business. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Melly aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es: Augusto, de  53 años, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos.Desde hace 6 años, se dedica a la venta de baterías para autos, en un pequeño local ubicado dentro de un taller mecánico. Como estudio  mecánica, esto le brinda la ventaja de aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que ofrece, pues conoce del tema.  Le gusta  mucho su trabajo y le dedica prácticamente todo el día, solo descansa para su refrigerio, y como  tiene clientes fijos, que le compran de vez en cuando las baterías, para sus movilidades, obtiene regulares ganancias. En el futuro se proyecta a instalar su negocio  en la avenida principal, para hacerlo más vistoso, pues ahora siente que esta algo  escondido, al estar dentro del taller de autos.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene  con MFP, y siempre se ha caracterizado  por ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.Augusto tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  cantidad de baterías para abastecer a sus clientes y de esta manera busca mejorar sus ingresos, para seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Augusto, 53, lives in his own house with his wife and two children. For the past 6 years he has sold car batteries in a small locale located in a machine shop. Because he trained as a mechanic he has the advantage of being able to advise his customers regarding the products he offers because he’s versed in the topic. He enjoys his work very much and spends most of the day at it; he only rests to take in some refreshment. Because he has regular customers that buy vehicle batteries from him occasionally, he has a steady income. In the future, he would like to set up his shop on the main avenue so that it will be more visible because he now feels it’s a bit hidden away being inside a car repair shop. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he has always been very responsible with respect to repayments. Augusto plans to use the requested funds to buy a quantity of batteries to supply his customers thereby seeking to improve his income in order to continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy batteries to stock his shop.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is a 56-year-old, married woman who supports her family by buying and selling used clothes. She lives in Villa Hergon, Brgy. Rizal, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She is pictured here with big bales of used clothing, which she buys from wholesalers to resell in her stall.

She has been a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)-Project Dungganon since 2006. With the help of loans from NWTF and through her own hard work, she has improved her living conditions in recent years. By working hard at her used clothes business, she is gradually ensuring that her family is economically stable. She now earns an average income of 12,000 PHP.

Evelyn is seeking a loan in the amount of 29,000 PHP ($625) to expand her business operations. Notably, this would be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan, which was also in the amount of 29,000 PHP and which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Evelyn aspires to continue to improve her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, NWTF is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 per day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, which is a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand her business operations

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarun H., is 38 years old and her husband, Mr. Pech Luk (both shown in the photo), is 43 years old, have been married since 1997 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. The family is living along national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 
Sarun and her husband are farmers, they grow mangoes on their farmland in the village. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $200 to purchase pesticide to prevent her mangoes from insects.

loans.use: To purchase pesticide to prevent mangoes from the insects.

loans.name: Dora Griselda

texts.es: Dora Griselda H. de 22 años de edad, reside en el centro de San Agustín, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su abuela de 66 años de edad y junto a su abuelo de 74 años de edad. Dora es una joven trabajadora, la cual en miras de colaborar en su hogar y sobretodo poder sostener a sus abuelos, ya que ellos son de avanzada edad y ya se les dificulta trabajar, colocó un molino en su hogar, en el cual se dedica a moler frijoles, maíz, ingredientes para salsa y muchos otros alimentos más, cuenta con la ventaja que es el único molino en las cercanías de su hogar y posee muchos clientes, debido a que existen varias ventas de pupusas y tortillas, cuyas propietarias de estos negocios llegan día con día a moler los ingredientes para elaborar estos alimentos. Dora solicita un préstamo, ya que desea poder comprar otro molino, el cual le permita atender a más clientes, ya que en ciertas horas del día el negocio se satura, impidiendo que atienda a más personas, los cual es negativo para ella. Así mismo desea poder darle el mantenimiento necesario al molino que ya posee y comprarle todos los repuestos necesarios para que realice un mejor trabajo.
texts.en:
Dora Griselda H., age 22, lives in the center of San Agustín, which is in the Usulután department. She lives with her 66 year old grandmother and her 74 year old grandfather. Dora is a hard-working young woman. She works hard to help out at home, and, above all, she works to be able to support her grandparents. They are elderly, and it is hard for them to work. She put a mill in her house, and she uses it to grind beans, corn, salsa ingredients, and a lot of other food. She has the advantage of having the only mill in the vicinity of her house. She has a lot of customers due to the fact that there are various people selling “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) and tortillas. The vendors go to her everyday to grind the ingredients to make the food. Dora is requesting a loan because she wants to be able to buy another mill. The new mill will allow her to take care of more customers. At some hours of the day the business is swamped, and that gets in the way of taking care of more customers. That is a negative for her. She also wants to be able to provide the needed maintenance on the mill that she already has. She will buy all of the replacement parts that are needed to do a better job.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for a mill and buy a new mill

loans.name: Adjowoa

texts.en: Madame Adjowoa D. sells 'pagnes', colorful wax-printed cloth that is worn and used by the majority of Togolese women. Madame D. has been selling 'pagnes', walking through the streets and carrying them on her head, since 1990. She has requested a loan of 500,000 CFA in order to purchase more stock. This is her first time taking out a loan. Madame D. is a widow and she has one child.

loans.use: To purchase 'pagnes' to sell

loans.name: Aoussi

texts.fr: B. est une dame de 45 ans très dynamique, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.en 1999 elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de céréales, plus tard elle associé à ce commerce la vente d'ignames pour pouvoir réaliser de gros profits.  elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville d'anié. son anciennété dans ce commerce lui en a donné une parfaite maîtrise. elle a djà obtenu chez WAGES un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite un deuxième crédit pour pouvoir acheter 5 tas de tubercules et 6 sacs de maïs, le reste sera destiné à assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
B. is a very dynamic lady, with 45 years of age. She is married and has two children. In 1999 she began selling grain, later associated with the yam sale, in order to increase the revenue. She buys her products in the interior of the country, in the city of Anie. With all the years of experience she has become an expert trader. She received from WAGES a previous loan, that she fully repaid, and now she is requesting a second one to purchase five lots of six bags of potatoes and corn each; the rest of the loan will be used to cover the costs of transportation.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grain and yam

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Suad is a housewife and mother of two sons and one daughter. Suad's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who also has a small grocery store in the city. Suad helps her husband by working in the store when he is at his daily work.

Suad and her husband wanted to improve the shop and add few shelves and fridge with a display window, so Suad came to FATEN to take a $1,000 loan for this purpose. 
Suad and her husband are working hard to secure their kids future and are saving to have a bigger store which serves more customers.
Suad's husband appears in the picture here in the store as Suad is a conservative woman who is not comfortable having her picture published.

loans.use: Improve the store

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia D. is from the village of Birayan, Rizal. She is 60 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Antonia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, particularly in raising hogs to sell. Antonia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Antonia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Antonia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for hog raising. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Antonia from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising.

loans.name: Isabel Martha

texts.es:
Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para Superar en el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar. Este lugar es visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros.
 
Aquí encontramos a la señora Isabel, ella tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y tiene 7 hijos  los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos vive en su casa aun. Su marido está muy anciano y ya no trabaja.

Ella tiene un restaurante en su casa, el mismo que está ubicado frente al malecón de San Jacinto, trabaja todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 18h00 y en tiempo de temporada playera hasta las 22h00,  prepara una gran variedad de platos y su especialidad son los camarones y el pescado  apanados con ensalada y patacones. Ya tiene 20 años en su negocio y dice que hay temporadas bajas pero que en la temporada playera todo se recupera.

Este crédito es para comprar productos que sirvan para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya tres años y siempre le ha gustado por las reuniones ya que en ellas se divierte con sus amigas.
 
Su deseo es seguir trabajando y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days the Communal Bank “Esperanza Para Superar” (Hope to Overcome) meets in the beautiful resort town of San Jacinto, which is surrounded by a beautiful beach and where the Portoviejo River meets the sea. This place is visited by many domestic and foreign tourists.

Sra. Isabel is 66 years old, married, and has seven adult children, one of whom still lives at home with her. Her husband is elderly and no longer works.

Isabel has a restaurant in her home located on the waterfront in San Jacinto. She works every day from 8am to 6pm, and during the beach season she works until 10pm. Isabel prepares a wide variety of dishes and her specialties are breaded shrimp and fish with salad and plantains. She has been in business for 20 years and says that there are slow moments, but is able to recover everything during the beach season.

This loan will be used to buy products for serving the food she prepares. Isabel joined the Communal Bank three years ago and has always enjoyed the meetings because she has fun with her friends. Her wish is to continue working and enjoy good health.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Khat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khat M., a 40-year-old married woman, is the group leader of this loan, having been selected its by four members, all of whom are residents of Preaek Ruessei village in Kandal Province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose.

M. and her husband, Mr. Hout Thall, earn their living by selling fast food in the local village, making good profits that enable them to support their three children, all of whom are students in the local school and also helpers in their parent business. In order to increase income to improve the family living standards, M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to expand her fast food enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to expand her business

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 30 years old. He sells clothes in Nairobi for both men and women. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase both ladies' and gentlemen's clothes for resale. David is hardworking and plans to open more outlets in the next five years. He is married and a father to two young children.

loans.use: To purchase both men and women's clothing

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn B. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 57 years old. Merlyn is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, breads, instant noodles, biscuits & junk foods in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
