HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Maritina

texts.en:
Maritina is a married woman with seven children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has been operating an M-pesa (mobile money transfer) services for the past three years.  Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Maritina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open another business in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil for her retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil for retail shop

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta C. is from the village of Brgy. Mauan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya.  She is 38 years old.  Julieta is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of fruits and vegetables in the local community.  Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Julieta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Julieta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Julieta from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia L. is from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Alicia is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over sixteen years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and shampoo. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and shampoo

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis tiene 36 años tiene un hijo de tres años de edad al cual le pasa una pension mensual Luis actualmente se encuentra separado vive solo en casa de su hermana ubicado en la Urb Santo Domingo el se dedica al transporte aproximadamente diez años actualemte cuenta con un vehiculo propio, el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para la compra de radio base para su auto, se le otorga el credito por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Luis is 36 years old and has a 3 year-old son who he provides with a monthly allowance.  Luis is currently separated and lives alone in his sister's house which is located in Santo Domingo development.  Luis has been providing transport services for approximately 10 years.  He currently owns his own vehicle and will use his loan to buy a two-way radio for this vehicle.  He is being provided with a loan because he has good references and he also has both the will and ability to repay his loan.

loans.use: To buy a two-way radio

loans.name: Ochgerel

texts.en:
Ochgerel, 27, is married and lives with her husband, mother and son in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on land they recently purchased. Her mother is retired and her three year old daughter goes to kindergarten. 

Ochgerel opened a food shop and her income has become more stable. She is planning to enlarge her shop and expand her business. She is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I would like to purchase more food as the price will get higher in the coming season." She is requesting a loan of 400,000 MNT for this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase more food for her shop

loans.name: Lorry

texts.en:
Lorry is a 27-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fish vending business. She lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Lorry is borrowing PHP 11,000 to fund her business operations. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Lorry aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Juan Manuel Fernando Mark

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Juan; El socio tiene 44 años de edad, el socio  es Casado; el socio tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 11 años de edad; el socio es guía de Turismo; el socio es una persona muy responsable y disciplinado, actualmente el socio continúa trabajando en Turismo y ahora que comienza la temporada alta el socio se está organizando y desea comprarse nuevos zapatos para sus caminatas, comprar una casaca, también renovar su equipo de viaje personal. El socio desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de su equipo de viaje personal para así continuar trabajando en su gran pasión  que es el turismo. El socio invertirá el préstamo en la compra de su equipo de viaje.

El socio se encuentra satisfecho con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juan is a member of the "AMAUTA" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Juan is 44 years old, married, and has two children aged 14 and 11.  He is a tourist guide and a very responsible and disciplined person. He is currently  working in the field of tourism and now that the peak tourist season is beginning, he is getting organized.  He would like to buy new shoes for his hiking excursions, a jacket and he would also like to renew his personal travel gear. 

Juan would like to invest this loan in buying personal travel gear so that he can continue working in his true passion which is tourism.  He will invest his loan in buying travel gear.  Juan is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make his repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy travel gear

loans.name: Dawoud

texts.en:
Dawoud is a father of four daughters and five sons. Dawoud owns a grocery store in Bethlehem city. Dawoud's children are school students and soon some of them will start university, therefore Dawoud needs to increase his income.

Dawoud took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger variety of goods and change the arrangement of the store by adding shelves and display windows.

Dawoud appears in the picture here in his store.

loans.use: to pay for goods and purchase shelves and display windows.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La señora Elena se dedica a la elaboración de masitas y también prepara almuerzos; el crédito lo requiere para comprar un equipo buffet para mantener la comida caliente y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos familiares.  Vive en casa en alquiler ubicada en al zona de Villa Fatima de la ciudad de La Paz, es divorciada y  no tiene hijos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2008.
texts.en: Elena's business is making pastries.  She also makes lunches.  She requires a loan to buy a hot plate to keep her food warm and offer a better service to her customers.  This is Elena's source of income that she uses to cover her family expenses.  She lives in a rental house in the Villa Fatima neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  She is divorced and doesn't have any children.   She has been a client of IMPRO since 2008.

loans.use: to buy a hot plate to keep the food that she prepares for her customers warm

loans.name: Ingrid Del Rosario

texts.es:
Ingrid  vive con su esposo y su hija de 24 años  en el municipio de Galapa,  lugar donde tiene una miscelánea y  vende mercancía al detalle como  prendas de vestir de bajo costo, papelería, cosméticos  y productos por catálogo de varias revistas;  este negocio  lo  inició en el año 2008, cuando decidió experimentar con una pequeña vitrina,  que  adquirió de segunda mano  y unas cuantas mercancías con las que la surtió. Ingrid también ha trabajado eventualmente como promotora de salud en el hospital de Galapa, donde muchos de sus habitantes  son sus clientes  y acuden a ella para hacer sus compras en épocas especiales, cuando necesitan  dar obsequios en fechas especiales o adquirir productos de papelería; Ingrid  y su esposo de oficio albañil  han logrado educar a su hija,  que está próxima a recibir su grado como abogada. 
Su sueño ahora se concentra en ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en un almacén, donde toda la gente de su pueblo consiga lo que está buscando; por eso mientras ella aspira a ganarse una importante clientela con su buen servicio y teniendo productos que necesitan sus clientes, va ahorrando para permanentemente hacer inyecciones de capital de trabajo que contribuyan a este fin; actualmente contribuye con su trabajo en los gastos del hogar; el capital de trabajo de su negocio está representado en gran parte por sus inventarios  y  maneja ventas a crédito muy bajas debido a una mala experiencia del pasado que le enseño a que “es mejor ganar poco, pero vendiendo de contado”.   Este es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el surtirá  su negocio con mercancías dirigidas a la mujer,  para despertar el interés de sus clientes en hacer sus compras con motivos del día de las madres, que a todas las familias entusiasma mientras a Ingrid se le incrementan las ventas en este bello día.
texts.en:
Ingrid lives with her husband and 24-year-old daughter in the town of Galapa where she has a general store selling at retail items like low cost clothes, stationery items, cosmetics and assorted catalogue merchandise.  She started the business in 2008 when she decided to experiment with a small display case that she bought used and a few items of merchandise that she stocked it with.  Ingrid has also occasionally worked as a Health Promoter at Galapa’s hospital where many of its residents are her customers and come to her to make seasonal purchases when they need gifts for special occasions or when they need stationery items.  Ingrid and her husband, who is a bricklayer, have managed to educate their daughter who is about to receive her law degree.

Her dream now is concentrated in expanding the business turning it into a large store where all the people from her town can find what they are looking for.  Because of this, while she hopes to gather an important clientele with her good service and by having what her customers need in stock, she will save up to be able to make permanent capital infusions toward this end.

She currently is able to contribute to household expenses with her work.  Her business’ working capital is mostly represented by her inventory.  She handles very few credit sales because of a past bad experience that taught her “it’s better to earn less but to sell for cash.” 

This is her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’ll use it to stock her store with merchandise aimed at women to awaken customer interest in making Mothers Day purchases which excite all families and increase Ingrid’s sales on this lovely day.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Eduard Yesid

texts.es:
La falta de recursos para continuar con sus estudios motivó a Eduard Yesid R. R. a darle vida a su propio negocio. Motivado por las ganas de salir adelante y por la necesidad de contribuir  a cubrir los gastos del hogar, este joven emprendedor decidió empezar a vender productos por catálogo a sus amigos, vecinos y conocidos, pero sus aspiraciones van allá pues en el futuro espera tener un gran almacén que sea reconocido. 

Por ahora y empezando a dar los primeros pasos para cumplir sus sueño, Eduard necesita de un préstamo para comprar una vitrina y sus primeros productos para la venta, así irá construyendo paso a paso su futuro.
texts.en: A lack of resources for continuing his studies has motivated Eduard Yesid R. R. to bring his business to life.  Motivated by the will to get ahead and by the need to contribute toward the expenses of the home, this enterprising young man decided to begin to sell products through a catalog to his friends, neighbors, and acquaintances.  However, his aspirations extend further and in the future he hopes to have a big department store that will be well-recognized.  Right now he is beginning to take the first steps toward fulfilling his dream.  Eduard needs a loan to buy a display cabinet and his first products to sell.  In this way, little by little, he will build his future.

loans.use: To buy a display case and personal care products to begin his business

loans.name: Twubakane Group

texts.fr: Jean Pierre est client d’ACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Twubakane, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est de 3 ans secondaire, il est marié, il a 3 enfants entre 6 et 1 an, 2 de ses enfants vont à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Jean Pierre va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de riz en paiement de main d’œuvre et achat d’engrais chimique. Sa stratégie est d’augmenter la surface à cultiver et l’utilisation des felitilisants pour augmenter la production agricole. Dans l’avenir, il veut être capable de s’autofinancer et éduquer ses enfants  jusqu'à l’université et avoir l’électricité dans sa maison. Jean Pierre est aussi éleveur des petits bétails.
texts.en: Jean Pierre has been a client of ACB since 2011.  He is a member of the Twubakane group.  He was born in Rwanda and has three years of secondary education.  He is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 6 years.  Two of his children are in school.  This is his first loan cycle.  Jean Pierre is going to use the loan to pay for labor costs and to buy chemical fertilizers for rice farming.  His strategy is to increase his cultivable land and to use fertilizers to increase his production.  In the future, he wants to be able to self-finance, educate his children up to the university level, and to have electricity in his home.  Jean Pierre also raises small livestock.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his planting

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a widow with 7 seven children, all of whom are grown up. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, Mbodze has operated a coconut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality. During the dry hot season the availability of coconut for sale is low compared to the rainy winter season. She dreams of expanding and starting another business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 Mbodze wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 51 años de edad. Actualmente, Elena vive en la misma ciudad donde nacio junto con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. Elena tiene un pequeño Bar – Restaurante y tiene un nombre peculiar “Tronco Seco”, ella atiende el local desde las 2 de la tarde hasta que el último cliente se vaya del local. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Elena requiere el préstamo para comprar cerveza, cigarrillos y otras cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Elena was born in the city of Cusco, Peru, and is 51 years old. She currently lives in Cusco with her husband and four children. Elena manages a restaurant and bar called “Tronco Seco” which is open from 2pm until the last customer leaves her establishment. She has been in business for several years and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Elena is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy beer, cigarettes, and other items.

She is a responsible and hardworking individual. These qualities prompted her fellow members to extend an invitation to her to join the Communal Bank “Hatun Rumiyoc”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase beer, cigarettes, and other items.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de quatre femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et 4 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenus au marché Château de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le commerce d’articles divers : des habits (pagnes wax et bazins), des fruits (banane et mangue), de l’arachide et du bois de chauffe. 
Dans le besoin d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 8ème prêt solidaire. 
Oumou, qui est la deuxième femmes debout à droite, une écharpe noire au cou, vend de l’arachide durant toute l’année dans le quartier Hamdallaye et au marché Château de Ségou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs d’arachide en gousse frais en gros avec les producteurs à Seribala. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile, en ambulant  et au marché Château de Ségou à une clientèle mixte.
Oumou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
Group Danaya is composed of four married women, mainly from polygamous families. They are on average 46 years old with four children each. They all live in the Hamdallaye area in Segou (Mali's fourth administrative region), and they got to know each other through their for-profit activities at the 'Chateau de Segou' market. The group members trade in various items: clothes (wax-style and brocade fabrics), fruits (bananas and mangoes), groundnuts and firewood.
Needing to increase their working capital, the group members decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their eight solidarity loan.
Oumou, the second woman from the right in the picture, wearing a black scarf, sells groundnuts year round in the Hamdallaye area and in the 'Chateau de Segou' market. She plans on using her loan to buy three bags of fresh unshelled groundnuts wholesale from Seribala growers. She retails to a mixed-gender clientele from her home, door-to-door and in the 'Chateau de Segou' market, and accepts cash or credit.
With this loan, Oumou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA, which will be used to reinvest in her activity and to pay for her children's healthcare.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita es  una persona  muy trabajadora  nos  comenta  que  hace   tiempo  intentaron  robar  en  su  domicilio  , ocasionándole  daños  a  las  ventas y  en  el  techo  de   una  habitación,  es por  ello  que   requiere  de nuestra   ayuda  para reparar los  imperfectos  ocasionado  por  los ladrones, agradece el  apoyo  brindado para la  realización de  su  proyecto y  la  posibilidad  de ofrecer a su  familia una  mayor  seguridad.
texts.en: Margarita is a very hard-working person.  She tells us that some time ago some people tried to burgle her home.  They caused damage to the windows and the roof of one room.  For this reason, she needs our help to repair the damage caused by the burglars.  She is grateful for the support she is being given to carry out her project and the possibility she has to provide her family with greater security.

loans.use: to buy windows and repair her roof

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Cette cliente travaille comme agent de santé communautaire dans le village, elle est salariée et fidèle cliente de la caisse. Généralement elle bénéficie de cridit pour des besoins sociaux. Ce crédit lui permettra de prendre en charge les frais de hospitalisation de sa soeur malade.
texts.en: This client works as a community health agent in the village. She has a salary and is a faithful client of the branch office. Generally, she takes advantage of a loan for social reasons. This loan will allow her to pay for the hospitalization costs of her sister who is ill.

loans.use: to pay for one of her sister's hospitalization.

loans.name: Kaja Group

texts.en:
Mbonea, who is in his late 30s, is married with four children who go to school. He has been selling fresh fish from door to door for three years now. He works from 11a.m to 3 p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania. He wants to use the funds to buy more fish and to pay school fees as well. His dream is to one day be able to rent a shop where he can sell his fish in one place.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kaja", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and to pay school fees as well.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is married with one child. She is fifty-one years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur.

She is a farmer and has a business at the same time to earn a living. She has been doing this since she got married. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

In the future, Felicidad hopes that she can provide the needs of her family everyday.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is a widowed business woman. She is 58 years old and thankful because at her age, she still enjoys her business buying and selling banana and charcoal. According to her, she sells the banana and charcoal four times a week because she has a contact person from another village who comes to get it. This way, she minimizes her fare in going to and from the market, because the fare is expensive as they are far from the market.

Esperanza plans to buy stock of charcoal and banana to increase her profit but she doesn't have enough money. In this regard, she is requesting for additional capital amount of P15,000 (Philippine Pesos) to invest in her buying and selling business. Through this loan amount she is requesting, she could attain her goals in her business and family.

loans.use: to buy additional banana and charcoal stocks for her retail business

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna Isabel tiene 29 años, vive en Unión Libre vive con elconyugue y los seis hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol gandúl.

Reyna  Isabel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Sus productos los Compra y los vende en Ventanas sin ningun inconveniente.

Solicita el crédito para poder sembrar maíz, arroz y frédjol gandúl, el cliente comprara semillas, insumos y fertilizantes abonos agrícolas  para mantener los cultivos en buenas condiciones.  Con el apoyo del crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda para poder suplir las necesidades y poder combatir las plagas de los cultivos.

La relación familiar ha mejorado porque ha podido aportar económicamente para los gastos de los estudios de los hijos.
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel, 29, is in a common law relationship with her spouse and six children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “San José de los Amarillos” communal bank are located in the hamlet of Amarillos belonging to Ventanas Canton.  They are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Reyna is a corn and rice farmer. She buys her products at the Murillo Supply and sells there too.

She is asking for the loan to be able to plant corn, rice and pigeon peas.  She will buy seeds, supplies and fertilizer to keep her crops in good condition.  Support from the previous loan was of much help to her to be able to meet her needs and to combat the infestations in her crops.

Family relations have improved because she’s been able to contribute economically towards her children’s educational expenses.

In her spare time she enjoys going out on excursions and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Ana Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Ana Marisol vive en la ciudad de Salvación del departamento de Madre de Dios.   

La señora Ana Marisol es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene una hija, ella es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene un pequeño hotel en la ciudad de Salvación donde brinda servicios de hospedaje a los extranjeros y personas que llegan a la ciudad, ella tiene cuartos simples, dobles y matrimoniales y los precios van desde los 10, 15 y 35 soles. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Ana Marisol requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento al hotel.  

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación. 

La selva de Madre de Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques de Madre de Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos de Madre de Dios la caza es abundante. La selva de Madre de Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se puede navegar en canoas o lanchas.  (En la fotografia la socia esta acompañada de su esposo).
texts.en:
Ana Marisol lives in the city of Salvación in the department of Madre de Dios.

She is married, and she and her husband have one daughter. She is a hardworking woman who wants her family to have a better life. She has a small guesthouse in Salvación where she offers lodging to foreigners and other people who travel to the city. She has single and double rooms and her prices are 10, 15, and 35 soles a room. She's had the hotel for several years now and it's going very well. Ana Marisol is requesting a loan to do some maintenance and repairs on the hotel.

The members of the Nueva Generación village bank meet every 30 days in the city of Salvación.

The Madre de Dios jungle is stunningly beautiful and rich in natural resources. Abundant wildlife makes hunting easy in its vast, mysterious forests. Majestic rivers cut through the Madre de Dios jungle and are navigable by canoe or boat. (In the photograph, Ana Marisol is accompanied by her husband.)

loans.use: to pay for maintenance for her hotel.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, age 51, is a farmer in Kitale, Kenya. He has been involved in farming for the past 10 years and it is his only source of income. His farm produces milk, vegetables, and eggs, which are sold at the local market.

Moses has requested his first loan through Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of 61,600 KES. 41,600 KES will allow him to purchase and insure a dairy cow, and 20,000 KES will assist him in constructing a dairy unit for the same. He says the loan will enable him to generate income, provide for his family's basic needs, and improve their living standards.

Like other local farmers, Moses notes that finances for farmers are hard to come by, and he appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's intervention on their behalf.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Abduhoshim

texts.ru: Абдухошим проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 33 года. Он женат. Имеет троих детей. Его жена работает продавщицей. Сам Абдухошим имеет среднее образование. Он у себя дома занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности он занимается семь лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Abduhoshim lives in the region of Shahrituz. He is 33 years old, married and has three children. His wife works as a salesperson. Abduhoshim has secondary education. He breeds cattle at home. He has been in this business for seven years. He is taking out the loan to buy large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es: José, de nuevo ha solicitado  un crédito, debido a la buena atención de nuestra institución y por la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, comprara mas mercadería como: ropa para niños, damas y caballeros y medicina natural, el objetivo de él es seguir mejorando en sus ventas y tener variedad para ofrecerles a los clientes, Estos prestamos prestamos le han ayudado a fortalecer mas su negocio pues se incremento la clientela y obtuvo mejores ingresos, este avance le permitió vivir mejor con su familia, facilitarles lo que más necesitan que anteriormente no tenían.
texts.en: José is again applying for a loan due to the good care he received from our institution and also because he needs to invest in his business. He will buy more merchandise such as: children's, ladies' and men's clothing and natural medicine. His goal is to continue improving sales and offer variety to his customers. These loans have helped him strengthen his business more as there has been an increase in customer numbers and he has earned more income. This loan allowed him and his family to live a better life, providing them with what they most need and previously lacked.

loans.use: to buy children's, ladies' and men's clothing as well as natural medicines.

loans.name: Amoka

texts.en: Amoka is a kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) seller and a fishmonger at Kwahinkrom. She has been in this business for three years now. She is married to a mason and has four children. She assists her husband in providing for their children. Amoka will use her loan to purchase maize and fish in bulk. With her new profits, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize and fish in bulk.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en: Evariste is 50 years old and has nine children who range in age from 3 to 22. All of them are in school. He earns a living by selling charcoal in a shop he has run for the last 25 years. He is applying for this loan to buy more sand and stones to make into bricks to sell to his customers. Evariste plans to use the profits made possible by this loan to plant trees which he will use in the future. His goal is to double his profit in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy sand and stones to make into bricks.

loans.name: Leticia Liliana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Leticia, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de  8 y 7 años que  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, sobre todo en las mañanas ya que a estas horas están sus hijas en la escuela y se le hace más fácil realizar sus recorridos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene dos años y medio  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, le gusta su trabajo ya que no le impide estar con sus hijas y ayudarlas cuando la necesitan.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos ya que quiere aprovechar las ofertas y ventas en este mes que es muy bueno. Lleva más de 2 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The “Camino Al Progreso” meets every two weeks in the city of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its arts known nationally and internationally.  It’s a place known for its famous straw hats.

Here we meet 25 year old Leticia.  She’s married and has two daughters, ages 8 and 7, who attend school.  Her husband works as a mason. 

She’s works as a housewife and sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women), in order to earn her own income and be able to help out her husband with the household expenses.  She works three days a week, mostly in the mornings while her daughters are in school.  This makes it easy for her to make her runs.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  She’s been doing this for two and a half years and things have gone well for her.  She enjoys her work because it doesn’t prevent her from being with her daughters and helping them when they need it.

This loan will be to buy perfumes, creams, and cosmetics so that she can take advantage of the special offers and sales this month.  She has been part of the communal bank for two years and she likes it because the loans are easy to get.

Her dream is to provide the best for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Huatajata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER DE HUATAJATA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Remedios es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pescado, venta de verduras, venta de ganado, venta de charque, venta de papa.

La señora Remedios, indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de red para la caza de peces que adquirirá de La Paz y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia ya que ella es casada y tienen cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
The “NEW DAWN OF HUATAJATA” cooperative will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer.  As part of the focal center of Copacabana, it is comprised of ten members, and led by a management board of which Remedios is president.  The businesses that the members of the cooperative carry out are varied, but among them we have:  fish sales, vegetable sales, livestock sales, charque (dried llama meat) sales, potato sales.

Remedios indicates that this is the first time they are working with Pro Mujer, and that she joined the institution through the invitation of a promoter.  Currently, she has a business selling fish that she has had for years, having learned the trade from her family.

The loan that she will now take out is for the purchase of a net for catching the fish she will acquire from La Paz, and then sell in the markets.  This form of work permits her to generate the income to support her family, as she is married and they have four children.

loans.use: buy a net.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.  Delia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Melanie has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Melanie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past two years, she has operated a poultry business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors. She dreams of expanding her business. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to pay for school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay for school fees

loans.name: Yudy Patricia

texts.es:
Yudy proviene de una familia que siempre se ha dedicado a las actividades de la agricultura y producción agropecuaria, es por esto que gracias a sus padres adquirió el conocimiento del cuidado de ganado y vacas lecheras. Yudy se encuentra casada y es madre de 2 hijos de 3 y 8 años de edad, a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer todo lo necesario. Debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para sostener los gastos de su hogar, Yudy inició su negocio comprando una vaca lechera la cual le genera diariamente ingresos por la venta de la leche que produce, y gracias a esto puede contribuir económicamente con los ingresos del hogar. Yudy, actualmente tiene la posibilidad de que su cliente le compre más leche de la que puede producir con una sola vaca, es por esto que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una vaca lechera para aumentar su capacidad de producción de leche y poder generar mayores ingresos.

Yudy espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente y pueda de esta manera ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Además, espera que sus hijos puedan acceder a una mejor educación y en un futuro puedan tener una estabilidad económica. Yudy tiene el sueño de que su negocio les brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de su casa propia y así poder ofrecerles a su esposo y sus 2 hijos mayores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Yudy comes from a family that has always worked in farming and agricultural production, so thanks to her parents she acquired the knowledge of cattle and dairy cow care. Yudy is married and the mother of two children aged 3 and 8, whom she has always wanted to provide with everything they need.

As her husband's income is not sufficient to cover their household expenses, Yudy began a business by purchasing a dairy cow which earns her income on a daily basis from the milk that she produces.  Thanks to this, she is able to contribute financially to the household expenses.

Yudy currently has the potential for her customer to purchase more milk than she is able to produce with just one cow, and for this reason she is hoping that a loan will provide her with the possibility of purchasing another dairy cow to increase her milk production capacity and allow her to generate better income.

Yudy hopes in this way that her income will increase considerably, and in this way she can provide her family with a better quality of life.  She also hopes that her children will be able to have access to a better education, and that in future they will have financial stability.  Yudy has the dream of her business providing the possibility of being able to purchase their own home, and in this way being able to provide her husband two children with better opportunities to progress in life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to increase her milk production capacity and be able to earn more income.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Mrs. Rose Igbinoba is 57 years of age with three (3) children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells clothes for the public. The amount requested above is for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to start a pig-rearing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve her farming business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana enjoys what she does for a living. She has her own little business selling women’s clothing at the Rushski Market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Married and the mother of two, she has been in business for about nine years. Her business has been a valuable source of income through the years. Tatyana has been helping her youngest child with his college expenses and also helps her parents when she can. Her husband recently retired as a school teacher, but Tatyana plans to keep working and developing her enterprise. She has requested a loan for $1,000 to increase the assortment of clothing she has available to sell.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is married with a 4-year-old daughter. He lives in Berdyansk with his family. Andrei has a small business where he sells paintings, office supplies, and toys and offers copying and computer services in one of the departments of the local mall. He has always had a passion for art which is why he has chosen this sphere of trade.

Andrei is a skillful entrepreneur – knowledgeable in commerce, consistent, polite and friendly with customers and a true man of integrity. Moreover, Andrei also has a unique talent – he can captivate a client which helps him compete with other businessmen working in this same area of trade. He has been in business for just one year. However, he already has about $7,000 in inventory. His monthly turnover capital is around $5,000.

Andrei is requesting a loan of $500 to increase his inventory and turnover capital. He is hoping to invest generated profit in his daughter’s medical treatment. His little girl has suffered ill-health since she was born. Andrei is also planning to spend a portion of his business income on the construction of a Christian church where he is a pastor. He believes his main goal as a Christian believer is not only to share his passion for art and painting with his customers, but also to share his faith in Jesus with them. We believe Andrei’s serious approach to business matters, his wise stewardship and honesty will ensure prompt repayment of this loan.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha who is a trained nurse is a very active 52-year old member of her community.  She is married and lives with her husband and five of their children in Rongo, Kenya. Tabitha is very well-known within her community for her compassionate work. Her main business and source of income, however, is the clinic and community pharmacy, which she has managed for the past 15 year’s years.  Given her reputation and the location of her clinic/pharmacy, her business has flourished.  The most commonly purchased drugs in are those to treat malaria, diarrhea, asthma and upper respiratory infections.  Tabitha credits her success to hard work and the assistance she has received from KMET through three previous microfinance loans.  She plans to use the funds from her next loan of US $1000 to expand both her businesses.

loans.use: Purchase stock of drugs

loans.name: Rahabu

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Rahabu S., who lives in the rural town of Mlandizi, about 30km outside of Dar es Salaam, where she has run a business selling clothes since 2006. Rahabu is requesting a loan of $350, which she will use to travel to downtown Dar es Salaam where she will purchase her stock in bulk at wholesale prices. Rahabu is married to husband Jubex with whom she has four children, Estel, 16, Glibeth, 12, Jemsi, 9 and Happy, 3. The whole S. clan send their greetings and thanks.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback arrangement as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are therefore termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing stocks

loans.name: Boimatov

texts.en:
Boimatov M. lives in Spitamen; he is married and has 7 children.  Boimatov M. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and he recommended himself as a serious and strongly-motivated client.  Loan sums are continually increased, which shows business stability and income increase.  

Mr. Boimatov M. is very experienced in this business (about 20 years).  He is a foreman by professional background.  He has a wide business assortment including the livestock raising and selling, milk production and work out.  He dreams to purchase a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and sour-milk goods production (he supplies it to the bazaars).  It is planned to include in the assortment the following milk and sour-milk products: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd, etc. 

Now Mr. Boimatov M. requests a loan of $900 for the horn pedigree bull and the pedigree milk cow purchase that will allow him to significantly increase the family income and permit him to plan further business developments and assortment widening.

loans.use: T purchase a horn pedigree bull and pedigree milk cow.

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es:
Doña Teófila is a fighting woman that has not allowed the passage of years to diminish the value of her work and as such has always set a solid example for many youths of today. She was born in a clearly agricultural family of Pampas in the city of Huancavelica that taught the hard work of tilling the land and also the joint effort of an arduous work. She has been dedicated for 30 years to agriculture; sowing corn, potatoes and beans in an independent way. When her marriage moved her to the city of Huancayo she continued being dedicated to the agriculture for short periods. In that time it was necessary to do it that way so that her children could study in the city. Her great wish is to collaborate with the studies of her small grandchildren and for this reason she travels periodically to Pampas to verify how the crops are doing. At harvest time she works to market directly in the wholesale market of her locality in order to obtain the profits. Teófila requests a loan to acquire a greater quantity of fertilizer with the objective of improving the quality of her products. Support Teófila and her desire to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Teófila, es una mujer luchadora que no ha dejado que el paso D. los años disminuya el valor D. su trabajo y es así que siempre se ha mantenido con fuerzas siendo un ejemplo para muchos jóvenes D. hoy. Nació en una familia netamente agricultora D. Pampas en la ciudad D. Huancavelica que le enseñó el duro trabajo D. labrar la tierra y también el esfuerzo conjunto D. un trabajo arduo; se dedica desD. hace 30 años a la agricultura, sembrando maíz, papa y habas D. manera independiente al contraer matrimonio se desplazó a la ciudad D. Huancayo y siguió dedicándose a la agricultura por temporadas, en aquella época era necesario hacerlo D. esa manera para que sus hijos puedan estudiar en la ciudad. Su gran anhelo es colaborar con los estudios D. sus pequeños nietos y por esta razón viaja periódicamente a Pampas para verificar como están los cultivos y en el tiempo D. cosecha se dedica a comercializar directamente en el mercado mayorista D. su localidad para luego obtener las ganancias. Teófila solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad D. abonos con el objetivo D. mejorar la calidad D. sus productos.. Apoya a Teófila y sus deseos D. trabajar arduamente.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve the quality of her crops.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Fifteen years ago, upon moving to her new house, Diana saw the opportunity to sell, at night, food from a moving stall. For fourteen years, she has sold “salchipapas” (hot dogs and French fries) and she has been gaining customers who happily are not lacking. Initially, the idea to start this small business was to give her children food and education since, even with her husband’s income, they did not always have enough. Now that two of their three children have finished high school, she is thinking of continuing to work with the idea of investing in a bigger business. Nevertheless, the income from the sale of food is the only one she has. Besides this, she and her husband receive money from two mototaxis that they bought two years ago. Her dream is to open a restaurant on the main street of her town. For this, she would like to buy one more mototaxi and make it work well.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Una vez que se mudo a su nueva vivienda, hace quince años, Diana vio la oportunidad de vender, por las noches, comida en un puesto ambulante. Ella vende “salchipapas” (papas y hot dog fritos) desde hace catorce años y se ha ido ganando clientes que, felizmente, no le faltan. Inicialmente la idea de poner este pequeño negocio era darles educación y alimento a sus hijos, ya que con el ingreso económico de su esposo no siempre fue suficiente. Ahora que dos hijos de sus tres terminaron el colegio, piensa seguir trabajando con la idea de invertir en un negocio mucho más grande. No obstante, el ingreso de la venta de comida no es el único que tiene, además de eso, su esposo y ella reciben el dinero de los dos Mototaxis que compraron hace dos años. El sueño de ella es poner un restaurante en una avenida principal de su distrito. Para ello le gustaría comprar un Mototaxi más y hacerlo trabajar también.

loans.use: Purchase a mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in purchasing more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine M. is a 40 year-old resident of Benzi Beach in Dar es Salaam. She has run a bar and restaurant in the area for the past five years. She is in need of a loan to help her expand the restaurant and bar to accommodate more customers.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant and bar

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura D. lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She was brought up in an intelligent family―her father is a doctor and her mother works in the registry office. Mrs. D. is very well educated, and she works at the local rural school. She also participates in her family's livestock business where she helps take care of the animals and also does the milking.

Mrs. D. is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $625.00 US so she can purchase one more pedigreed bull.

loans.use: To buy one more pedigreed bull

loans.name: Asiasiga

texts.en: Asiasiga F., 55, is married with five children. She has many years of experience in the pancakes, porkcakes, ice cakes, etc. making and selling business. She sells to the village and general public 5 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~$125 USD). SPBD loans are Asiasiga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve her business and help out with family expenses.

loans.use: Asiasiga would like to purchase flour, sugar, salt, onion, soy sauce and also flavors for her ice cake for her food making and selling business.

loans.name: Sikudhani

texts.en:
Sikudhani is 26 years old, married, and has a child who is 5 years old. Sikudhani started selling clothes in 2006. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business, earning a monthly profit of about US$40.

In the past, Sikudhani has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes to receive another loan which she will use to buy more clothes (khanga and vitenge) for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes (khanga and vitenge) for sale

loans.name: Lilliam Mayela

texts.es:
Lilliam lives in the San Judas neighborhood, is 40 years old, single, and has three beautiful children ages 10, 15, and 20 years old. She has had to be successful for her children and that is why she had the initiative to open a small snack shop to support her children. She began with only selling soda pop and refreshments now she also sells cosmetics to her customers. She sells quite a few of these products as she stocks a variety at reasonable prices. She has been selling for 20 years, with little difficulty because she keeps her prices low. Her oldest son supports her not only with work but with moral support. With the money she is seeking she will invest in the purchase of cosmetics as she has various orders and she wishes to serve her customers well.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Lilliam habita en el barrio San Judas, tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y tiene tres hermosos hijos de 10,15 y 20 años de edad, ella ha tenido que salir adelante por sus hijos y es por eso que tuvo la iniciativa de poner un cafetín para poder sustentar a sus hijos, comenzó sólo con venta de gaseosa y refrescos ahora vende también cosmético a sus clientes, este producto se vende bastante ya que son de mucha variedad y de costos accesibles, tiene veinte años de experiencias en las ventas, con un poco de dificultad por que las ventas se ponen bajas. Su hijo mayor la apoya bastante por que ya trabaja tanto económico como moralmente. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para invertir en la compra de cosméticos ya que tiene varios encargos y desea darles un buen servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics to invest in her business

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José Ángel inició el negocio por la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia y así mismo para obtener ingresos ya que por el momento no cuenta con otro empleo. Empezó dando el servicio a sus amistades y poco a poco se fue metiendo mas a este negocio y es así como hoy forma parte de una base de taxis de la ciudad y con esta actividad ya tiene mas de tres años.

El necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para la reparación de la maquina de su carro.
texts.en:
José Ángel started in the business due to the need to help his family get ahead and, concurrently, to obtain income given that he did not have any other employment. He started providing the service to his acquaintances, and he slowly became more involved in this business. This is how he came to now making up part of a fleet of taxis in the city. He has been involved in this activity for more than three years.

He needs a loan of $375 USD, to be repaid in six months, to fix the engine of his car.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fixing the engine on his taxi.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam C., 53, is a widowed farmer who lives with two of her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a farmer and raises cows to earn a living and is able to make US$ 4 per day. She is aided by two of her children who are employed as garment factory workers.

At home she still takes care of her elderly mother and father. She says every month she pays around US$ 35 and US$ 5 on utilities. Sam C. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase wood to rebuild a proper stable for her cows.

loans.use: To rebuild a proper stable for her cows

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience A. is 30 years old, married, and the mother of one child. Her child is eight years old and is currently in school. For the last year, Patience has sold frozen foods in the local market to support her family.  She says demand for fish is high but she does not have sufficient capital to meet the demand. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods, so she can earn enough income to support her child's education. She is a member of the group called Saints. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Lufuka C –Nambooze Sarah Group

texts.en:
Jovial and friendly, Sarah N. is a matooke (plantain) vendor in Lufuka market. She purchases her stock from up country suppliers three times a week in order to meet the demands of her customers. The business earns her a profit of UGX 80,000 per week from which she pays a market fee of UGX 20,000 per month. She has pride in the business because she began small, but in less than five years, she managed to purchase a plot of land in one of the Kampala suburbs, an achievement deemed impossible through matooke vending. She is therefore using the loan to purchase more bunches of matooke because her customer base increases due to her politeness and excellent customer courtesy.

Sarah is 35 years old and is a single mother of three children between ages 14 and 18. She also looks after her late brother’s three children. Her side income is a small restaurant that she operates in the same market with the help of two lady employees. She looks forward to accumulating some money and starting the construction of a modern residential house on her plot. Her greatest desire is to educate her children to university levels.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of matooke.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Nueva Vida (“New Life”) Village Bank. Rosa is 70 years old. She is married and has nine children. Rosa grows vegetables on her land in the Pongora community, located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. She works with her husband and their farmhands. Rosa also travels to regional fairs, where she buys grain to resell in local markets. Rosa needs a loan of 600 soles to buy different grains. Her dream is to improve her business. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida. 
Rosa es casada, tiene 70 años y 9 hijos, Rosa se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras en sus terrenos D. la comunidad D. Pongora que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Actividad que realiza junto con su esposo con la ayuda D. peones. Además Rosa viaja a las ferias en donD. compra cereales que luego venD. en los mercados. 
Rosa necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cereales variados. 
El sueño D. Rosa son mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy grains

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira has a small shop in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for many years. She belongs to the Tawakal kwa Mola group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $53 and she works for 12 hours each day. She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more rice and oil for her store. She hopes this loan will help her increase her profit and expand her business.

Samira is 36 years old, married, and has four children aged 13, 10, 9 and 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more rice and oil for her store.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.es: Dennis se dedica a la agricultura independientemente desde hace 2 años, el principal producto de su cosecha es la papa, la cual vende a los principales mercados tanto para su ciudad como para la ciudad capital. De esta manera percibe las ganancias de 6 meses de trabajo continuo y esforzado, lo bueno es que en todo este tiempo su esfuerzo ha dado buenos frutos por lo que tiene planes de mejorar su producción para los próximos meses. Es la primera vez que Dennos tiene un préstamo con MFP, fue admitido para formar parte de su banco comunal por han notado que es un joven trabajador, responsable y puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando es para arrendar un puesto en el mercado de su misma localidad, y  de esta manera tener una plaza disponible para ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Dennis has worked as an independent farmer for the last two years. His principal crop is potatoes which he sells in the main markets of his town as well as in the capital city. In this way he earns money for six months of continuous hard work. The good thing is that his hard work has borne fruit so he has made plans to increase production in the following months. This is the first time that Dennis has asked for a loan from Kiva partner MFP. He was allowed to join the community bank as members noted that he is a hardworking young man and is responsible and punctual in paying back the loan. The money that he is asking for is to lease a stall in the market in his town so he has a regular spot from which to offer his products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a stall in the market

loans.name: Sayu Komang Artamiati

texts.id:
Melalui Lembaga di desanya Sayu Komang Artamiati mendapatkan dana yang ke dua dari Yayasan DINARI.  Dengan modal itu Sayu Komang Artmaiati sangat terbantu untuk menambah modal usahanya warungnya.usaha warung sudah rimulai sejak lama.barang dagangannya yang dijualan yaitu aneka macam snak makan ringan,keperluan sehari-hari,aneka macam alat tulis.
Barang dagangan didapat  dari pasar negara dan ada beberapa  produk yang sudah biasa diantar oleh pelanggannya.warungnya terletak dilokasi rumahnya jadi bisa diawasi dari rumahnya.Buka warungnya biasa setelah bangun pagi dan setelah bersih bersih rumah,marulah mulai aktifitas diwarungnya sampai sore,tap sesekali dapat ditinggal untuk mengerjakan pekerjaan sebagaiman ibu rumah tangga lainnya. 
 Penghasilannya memang tidak terlalu bersar,tapi cukup untuk memcukupi keperluan sehari-hari . keuntangan bersih antara R.30.000,- s/d 50.000,- dapat diterma dalam setiap harinya dari usaha inilah sayu komang Artmaiati dapat membatu pendapatan /penghasilan dari suaminya yang sebagia tukang.
texts.en:
Through the village agency, Sayu Komang Artamiati received second funding from DINARI foundation. That funding significantly assists Sayu Komang Artamiati to increase funding for her small store business. This small store business was started long ago, merchandise available for sale includes a variety of light edible snacks, daily needs, and a variety of writing instruments. These merchandise are obtained from the state market and the supplier usually delivers several of the products. Her small store is at her home thus always watchful over it while at home. The store is opened from after waking up in the morning and after cleaning the home; commence her store activities until late afternoon, except every now and then to carry out her other household chores. Earnings indeed are not very much, but are sufficient to cover daily need. Daily net earnings from this store of between Rp.30.000,- to 50.000,- Sayu Komang Artamiati is able to supplement her husband’s income/earnings as a craftsman.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa M. is 50 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her family lives in a "ger" (a yurt or nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolian central provinces. Her family proudly owns the plot of land where they have been living for last twenty years.

Since 1999, she has been running a retail business in which she bakes cookies and biscuits at home and sells them by going door to door. After several years of running her tiny business, she started renting a cafe located in a school building and, she now sells to the students at the school. Besides baking and selling biscuits, she also prepares a variety of meals especially made for children.

Tsetsegmaa is a very caring person who is well respected by others. Her hope is to have her own cafe one day. Tsetsegmaa is requesting a loan to buy flour, oil and sugar to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil and sugar

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 27 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y su querida hija Mereida de 4 años, quien es el motivo fundamental de todos sus esfuerzos. Sin dejarse vencer por el inclemente clima, Nancy sale muy temprano en compañía de su esposo para recolectar la leche de vaca de los ganaderos de su zona, luego de haber terminado con esta tarea, comienza a preparar los sabrosos quesos que llevará a vender al día siguiente a los mercados de Juliaca y Huancane. A Nancy le gusta mucho elaborar queso, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil es conseguir la cantidad de leche necesaria para preparar los 30 quesos que produce diariamente. Para el futuro anhela tener una tienda muy grande en la ciudad de Juliaca donde pueda vender sus deliciosos quesos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y espera no fallar en los pagos de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida y solidaria. Nancy planea invertir los 1000 soles solicitados en incrementar su capital de trabajo para comprar más leche y mejorar los implementos con los que prepara sus quesos.
texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her beloved 4-year-old daughter Mereida, who is the motivating force behind all of Nancy's efforts. Despite harsh weather conditions, Nancy and her husband go out very early in the morning to collect milk from the ranchers in their area. After this task, they set to work preparing flavorful cheeses to be sold the following day in the markets of Juliaca and Huancane.

Nancy really enjoys making cheese, and has done this work for seven years. The hardest part of her job is collecting enough milk every day to produce thirty blocks of cheese. In the future, she would like to have a large store in Juliaca where she could sell her delicious cheese.

This is Nancy's first loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she plans to be punctual with its repayment. She is known as a very trustworthy and loyal member of her community bank. Nancy will use the 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles from this loan as working capital to purchase more milk and better tools for cheese making.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo B. is 64 years old and married with five children. She has a farm where she raises pigs to sell. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 nairas to purchase more pigs. She says thanks to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more pigs

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia “Ely” B. was only able to finish her elementary education because her parents were no longer able to finance her studies. Her husband is William B., and they were blessed with four children. They live happily in a rural community located in Barangay Abinganan of Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Their children are presently studying in secondary and elementary school. Ely and William work hard to support and finance their children’s studies, for they want them to earn a degree someday.

Her husband, William, works as a laborer in the Public Market of Bambang while Ely is engaged in buying and selling vegetables at Bambang Public Market. She is requesting a loan in order to help improve her business and earn a higher income. Right now all of her income gets spent on necessities for daily living and her children’s education. As a result, she is unable to finance any growth on her own and is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 as additional working capital.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa T. is forty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, a son and two daughters. Two are in senior and junior high schools while the last born is in primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a mason. Theresa trades in second hand clothes. She deals in clothes and bed sheets. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells them at the market square in her community, and also treks to other markets to sell. Theresa has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles.

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mr. Phy S., 24, is a good father caring for a lovely young child. He and his wife currently earn their daily income by selling fresh fish in Psa Tmeiy Market located in Siem Reap Province. This young couple retails fish that they buy in bulk from their wholesale suppliers who are fisherman who fish in Tunle Sap River. They have been running this business for over nine years and earning an average of US$ 5 profit per day.

Approaching fishing season, the fish is commanding the lowest price. Therefore, Phy S. requested a loan for capital to order various type of fish at the cheapest price, which he can sell at higher prices.

loans.use: To order various types of fish

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es: Doña Rosita como lo conocen en su comunidad es originaria de departamento de Totonicapan su principal fuente de Produccion de dicha comuninidad es la artesania tipicas en la elaboracion de cinta, perrajes, morrales etc. Ella aprendio dicho trabajo  de su querido padre en la epoca de los ochenta y nonventa donde la tipica a nivel de Guatemala hera reconocido  que hasta la fecha lo siguen produccioendo, hoy necesita de un credito en donde  lo invertira en la compra de hilos, tintas, conos, para la elaboracion de su producto.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosita, as she is known in her community, is from the department of Totonicapan. Her main source of income is producing traditional Guatemalan handicrafts like headbands, shawls, shoulder bags, etc. She learned this craft from her beloved father in the 80’s and 90’s, when handicrafts were popular in Guatemala. Until now, handicrafts are still being produced. She needs a loan which will be invested in purchasing thread, dyes, and yarn cones to make her products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
Remia L. and her husband used to plant vegetables for their family's consumption; however, they realized that they could also sell them in the market and earn extra income. Remia is from San Jose Village, Brgy Calumangan, Bago City. She is 38 years old, married with two children of school age.

This couple plan to buy fertilizers with their twelfth loan, borrowing 4,000 PHP from NWTF-Project Dungganon. They hope they can produce more than their previous harvest.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of – not just a few – but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life which can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 45 años, vive con sus dos hijos en la casa que su ex esposo le dejó hace diez años. Se dedica a la fabricación de adornos para el hogar, siendo las manualidades una de las habilidades que posee y que desde hace poco logró descubrir, gracias a una amiga quien le enseñó hacer este tipo de trabajos decorativos. Con el tiempo, María aprendió a elaborar diversos objetos novedosos, los cuales tuvieron gran acogida en los mercados de su localidad. Debido al incremento de sus pedidos, con los que no podía cumplir decidió asociarse con una amiga para trabajar en pos de incrementar sus ganancias. María compra la mercadería en el centro de la ciudad y luego de terminados sus artículos los lleva a los mercados de su localidad donde tiene clientes muy fieles, así también lleva su mercadería a las ciudades alejadas de la capital donde la demanda es mayor y los ingresos más satisfactorios. Sin embargo, sus deseos de superación la motivan a seguir trabajando con mucho ánimo con la finalidad adquirir un puesto de venta fijo dentro de algún mercado donde pueda ofertar la gran variedad de diseños que elabora junto a su socia. Este sería su treceavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera de la confianza para obtenerlo, pues así podrá concretar su proyecto. María solicita la cantidad de 1000 soles para realizar sus compras, al por mayor, de los materiales necesarios para sus adornos y manualidades.
texts.en:
María, 45, lives with her two children in the house that her ex husband left her ten years ago. She makes decorations for the home. She has a talent for handicrafts. She discovered this a short while ago thanks to a friend who taught her how to make this type of decorations. With time, she learned to make diverse new objects. They were well received in the regional markets. Due to the increase in orders, which she could not complete, she decided to work with a friend in order to increase her earnings. María buys the merchandise in the center of the city. When she has finished the articles, she takes them to the markets in her area where she has loyal customers. She also takes her merchandise to the capital’s neighboring cities where there is greater demand and the income more satisfactory. Nevertheless, her desire to improve motivates her to keep working enthusiastically to be able to eventually get a fixed sales location inside of a market. There she could sell a great variety of designs that she makes together with her colleague. This is her 13th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She confidently hopes to get it in order to firm up her project. María is asking for 1,000 PEN to buy wholesale the necessary materials for her decorations and handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make decorations

loans.name: Villa Cochabamba Group

texts.es: El grupo “Villa Cochabamba” esta representado por la señora Marlene y conformada 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como venta de frutas, empanadas, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, y entre los varones a la elaboración de pan, y a la albañilería.  La competencia dentro de sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios con la compra de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro de la institución pero están contentos de que se les brinde un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Marlene represents the Villa Cochabamba Group, which is comprised of 12 members. They work at different activities like selling fruit, empanadas, and groceries in neighborhood stores. The men in the group make bread and are bricklayers. The competition in their fields is high. Because of this, they know how to get ahead in their work. The loan is for the growth of their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools to improve their incomes and allow them to give their families a better quality of life. As far as the members’ loan experience goes, this is their first loan cycle with the Institution. They are happy to be offered economic support that helps them generate greater income and improve their families’ quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Salimont

texts.en: Salimont is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She sells provisions and crates of eggs. She has been in this business since the year 2000.
