She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more provisions and crates of eggs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and eggs to sell

loans.name: Nargis Group

texts.en: Nargis is the leader of this group, which has six members. Each member is seeking a loan to expand their business, so they are requesting a group loan of 60000 Afghani. Nargis and Jameil are seeking funding to expand their husbands' taxi services.  Aliah wants to take a loan for the business of quilt making. Sheela and Shokori would like a loan for their husbands' general stores. Nadara wants a loan for the business of carpet weaving. The group members thank AFS and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Melanda

texts.en:
“Achieving success in life is not that easy, due to many struggles that you will undergo,” says Melanda B.. She is married to Antonio who manages their rice farming and, at the same time, he is a carpenter within their village. The couple would like to have a better standard of living. This is why they are striving hard to provide for the needs of their family. 

Through her business she is able to provide for their daily needs. According to Melanda, she wants to buy additional merchandise for her store so that she can also generate a bigger income. But, due to insufficient capital, she would like to ask for additional capital from the KIVA lenders in the amount of PHP 5,000. She is hoping and praying that this loan amount she is requesting will be granted for her business expansion and improvement.

loans.use: For additional capital to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Pompeo

texts.en:
Pompeo S. is 41 years old. His family lives in Barangay Marobbob Amulung,Cagayan. He is happily married to Alice who is a public school principal in their community. They are blessed with three children: Olive,13, Mary-joy,11,and Luis, 10. 
Pompeo and his wife decided to invest into a junk shop business which they are now managing together. They collect and buy scrap materials like old newspaper, used bottles, metal, plastic bottles, old boxes etc. and sell those to bigger enterprises. With the desire to expand their business, they have decided to request a loan from the KIVA lenders amounting to Php7,000 for additional working capital. Despite the financial crisis they are encountering in their business, Pompeo believes that with their strong faith in God they will succeed.

loans.use: Additional capital for his junk shop business

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem M. is 46 years old and married to Chor Nak, 47, a former construction worker. They live in Reusey Keo commune, in the capital of Phnom Penh. They have five teenage children, two of whom are married and have their own homes, and three of whom are still dependent on their income.
Nem M. is a fresh fish seller. Recently, her husband has faced difficulties attracting customers for his motorcycle services, and his income is declining due to his existing motorcycle breaking down frequently. Therefore, Nem M. is requesting a loan to replace her husband’s broken motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: To replace her husband’s broken taxi motorcycle

loans.name: Emin

texts.en: Emin A. is a hardworking man who has dedicated himself to making his business prosper through great effort. Nine years ago he began his grocery business, which is located in an open market. Over the years, he has improved the structure of his business. Emin is married and has an adorable daughter. His wife actively helps Emin and he feels happy and satisfied to work together with her. Thanks to his friendly and easy-going character, he has been able to expand his business and clientele. Now Emin is applying for a 1600 AZN loan to purchase more merchandise and to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Gabriela

texts.es:
Carmen, es empleada y trabaja en un punto de llamadas, para solventar los gastos de alimentación y estudios ya que es soltera e independiente.
Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Sopocachi bajo de la ciudad de La Paz,  vive en la casa de sus abuelos.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de una computadora para reducir sus gastos de estudios ya que la mayor parte de sus trabajos en su instituto es a computadora porque esta estudiando auxiliar en contabilidad.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro
texts.en:
Carmen is an employee, and she works for a phone center in order to pay her food and educational expenses. She is single and independent. Her home is located in the Sopocachi area below the city of La Paz. She lives in her grandparents’ house. The loan is to buy a computer to reduce her educational costs. The major part of her work in her institution is on a computer because she is studying to be an accounting assistant. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Don Luis Alberto tiene  tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad, todos trabajan, solamente depende de el un nieto que sus esposa y el lo tienen a cargo, trabaja como guarda de seguridad desde hace  siete años,  el esta solicitando su quinto credito para construir una habitaciòn  para tener mejor comodidad para su nieto y el resto de familia, el se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre responsable, honesto y muy trabajador en sus dias libres se dedica a cultivar la tierra, su sueño es tener mucha salud , trabajo y que sus hijos sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto has five grown children who all work. The only one who is dependent on him is a grandson that he and his wife are raising. He has worked as a security guard for seven years. He is asking for his fifth loan to build a room to make his grandson and the rest of the family more comfortable. He has been characterized as being a responsible man who is honest and hard-working. On his days off he cultivates the land. His dream is to have good health, work, and that his children become good people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Nery Cecilia

texts.es: Nery Cecilia M. A. de 47 años de edad, posee una venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, ganchos para el cabello, mochilas y otros productos más. Desde hace 10 años que ella cuenta con este negocio, gracias al cual ha logrado sacar adelante a su hija y brindarle la ayuda necesaria de manera económica a su esposo, los cuales residen junto a ella en el municipio de Soyapango, lugar en el cual esta ubicado su negocio. Nery solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio y de esta misma manera comprar nuevos productos como papelería y accesorios escolares, lo cual se vende mucho. Nery siempre se ha destacado por ser muy visionaria, quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecino quienes aseguran que es una persona quien trabaja mucho y se esfuerza por mejorar su negocio cada día, todo con el fin de mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Nery Cecilia M. A., 47, sells clothing, shoes, cosmetics, hairpins, backpacks and many other items. She has had this business for 10 years and it has allowed her to raise her daughter and help her husband economically; they live with her in Soyapango, which is where her business is located. Nery needs funding to stock her business, in particular with new items, like stationery and school supplies, which sell very well. Nery has always been very visionary and has very good references from her neighbors, who attest to the fact that she is a hard-worker who strives daily to improve her business in order to better her family's economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stationery and school supplies.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn E. is from the town of Metro Bamban Subdivision Anupul, Bamban, Tarlac. She is 31 years old. Jocelyn is single. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

location.town: Metro Bamban Subdivision Anupul Bamban, Tarlac

loans.name: Nelly Lisseth

texts.es: Nelly Lisseth R. C. de 27 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive en compañía de su madre, sus dos hermanos y su pequeño hijo de un año de edad. Nelly posee un comedor, el cual esta ubicado en su propia casa, lugar en el cual se encarga de elaborar deliciosos desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales comercializa con las personas que viven en los alrededores. Así mismo ella posee un car wash en el cual sus hermanos se encargar de atenderlo, cuyas ganancias son repartidas entre los tres. Nelly solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para invertir en el Car wash,  comprando todo las herramientas necesarias para lavar carros, así mismo comprar verduras, bebidas, granos básicos, los cuales sean de mucho ayuda en el negocio de comida, en el cual recibe la ayuda de su madre. Debido a que ambos negocios son familiares, y de los cuales dependen por completo, Nelly desea mucho poder mejorar sus ingresos a través de sus negocios, de manera que pueda mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly Lisseth R. C. is 27 years old and resides in the town of Ilopango, located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her mother, her two siblings, and her young son who is a year old. Nelly operates a diner in her home. It is a place where she prepares delicious breakfasts and lunches, and sells them to people who live in the surrounding areas. She also has a car wash that her siblings are in charge of managing. The revenues from this business are split among the three of them.

Nelly is requesting a loan to invest in her car wash. She will buy all the necessary equipment for cleaning cars. At the same time she will purchase vegetables, drinks, and grains that will be of great help to her food business. Her mother helps her with running the diner. Since both of her ventures are family businesses, they depend on each other completely. Nelly greatly desires to improve her income through both of her businesses so that she can achieve better financial stability for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her diner & equipment for her car wash

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José Israel R. M., quien  Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo,  y  estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado dos crédito con CEPRODEL durante dos  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: zinc, perlines, pintura para una parte del techo de su casa ya que el que tiene se encuentra en mal estado. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Israel R. M. works as a janitor at the Eastern Market in Managua. He is married and has four dependent children who are in school. José has received two loans with CEPRODEL over a two year period and invested the proceeds in making improvements to his home.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as zinc, crossbeams, and paint to repair part of the roof of his house because it is in bad condition. His goal is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc, crossbeams, and paint to repair part of the roof of his house

loans.name: Progrès Plus Group

texts.en:
Bernard B. is 53 years old, married and the father of four children, whose ages range between 12 and 23 years old. All of them attend college. He is the leader of the community bank named “Progrès Plus” which is French for “Progress”. Progrès Plus comprises 24 members who are united in solidarity in receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses. Bernard has been a micro-entrepreneur since 2003. He runs a general store to the south-west of Kinshasa. He works hard with good management skills in order to achieve his goal of one day opening a large store in his locality. He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business which earns him $130 per week.

Bernard is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having obtained and correctly repaid six loans. With his next loan, he will increase his stock of merchandise by buying two sacks of rice, ½ sack of salt and two bags of soap and reselling them at a profit.

loans.use: To increase his stock by buying rice, salt and soap

loans.name: Rosas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Rosas inicia su quinto ciclo con 16 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. quesos, jugos D. frutas, golosinas, abarrotes en general, artículos D. plásticos, medicina, cosméticos y comida.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Nelly que es presidenta del Banco Comunal, Nelly es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Nelly tiene un cafetín en un colegio D. su barrio en donD. venD. golosinas, frutas y comida, actividad que realiza 5 días a la semana, además Nelly trabaja en una institución. Nelly invertirá su préstamo en la compra D. golosinas. Los sueños D. Nelly son ampliar su negocio y comprar un terreno para construir su vivienda.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total D. 9,900 soles.
texts.en:
The “Rosas” (Roses) Communal Bank is starting its fifth loan cycle with 16 members. They have different businesses selling cheese, fruit juices, candy, groceries, plastic items, medicines, cosmetics, and food.

Such is the case with Sra. Nelly who is the Communal Bank president. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children. Nelly manages a cafeteria at a neighborhood high school where she sells candy, fruit, and food. She operates her business five days a week. In addition, Nelly works at an institution. She will invest her loan in the purchase of candy. Nelly dreams of expanding her business and buying a plot of land so that she can build a house.

The members need different loan amounts ranging from 300 PEN, 600 PEN, to 1000 PEN, for a total of 9900 PEN to the entire Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Carnelian

texts.en:
Carnelian M. is from the town of Purok 11, Poblacion, Valencia City. She is 48 years old and single. To make a living, Carnelian has a clothing business selling ready to wear and slightly used clothing to local community members. Carnelian has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Carnelian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carnelian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used  to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Carnelian is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Carnelian from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, juice, and water

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina A. was born in 1981.  She lives in Getahovit village, Ijevan region. Irina is married and has two preschool-aged children. Since 2001 Irina's family has engaged in beekeeping and cattle-breeding, the income from which help them to keep their young family. Also with farming income they bought a car which they use to move their farm animals to mountains.

Irina needs a 400,000 AMD loan to buy 4 or 5 calves for her farm. Irina and her husband intend to move these calves to mountains in summer months, and sell them in autumn. 

In the photo you can see Irina, her husband and her son.

loans.use: To buy 4 or 5 calves for her farm

loans.name: Tupe

texts.en:
Tupe L. is 29 and married with three children (ages 2 - 6).  She owns a business of selling cooked food like sopu bones, fried chicken and cooked taro that mix with coconut cream.  Tupe has two years of experience in this business.  Tupe needs a loan of WST $1,500 to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Tupe joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tupe's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: María Jesus

texts.es: María Jesus es casa con Don Lorenzo tienen 6 hijos, María tiene una cría D. cerdos pollos y una cabra los venD. cada quince días en la feria del puebo se le llamara feria porque alli todos los domngos hay un lugar especifico para vender animales los jueves y también domingos, es donD. ella aprovecha para vender sus animales D. eso ella obtiene ganancias porque compra pequeños a los animales y les da un mes D. plazo o menos para que crezcan y los venD.. Solicita el crédito para seguir negociando con animales, aparte D. vender animales también borda blusas tipicas. Agradece a FAPE / KIVA por brindarle su apoyo. Su sueño es tener una gran granja.
texts.en:
María Jesus is married to Don Lorenzo. They have six children. María raises pigs, chickens, and a goat and then sells her animals every fifteen days at the town fair. She has a specific place for selling animals on Sundays and Thursdays. With her earnings she also takes advantage of the opportunity to buy smaller animals to raise so that she can sell them within a month’s time, more or less.

María is requesting a loan to continue with her animal business. In addition to selling animals, she also embroiders traditional blouses. She thanks FAPE and Kiva for the support they have provided. Her dream is to have a large farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more animals

loans.name: Ismelda Esther

texts.es: Ismelda Esther R. R. de 25 años tiene un tramo en el mercado Oriental de la ciudad de Managua en el cual vende toallas, cortinas, ropa de camas, etc. Ella inició hace 4 años con la ayuda de su esposo y desde entonces alquilan el local en el que se encuentran, su sueño es que dicho local sea propio y más grande y que sus hijos de 7 y 3 años lleguen a ser profesionales y gocen de todas las cosas que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Ismelda Esther R. R. is 25 years old and has a space at the Eastern Market in the city of Managua where she sells towels, curtains, bedding, and other products. She started this business four years ago with the help of her husband. Since then, she has rented the space that she occupies. Her dreams include having her own space that is much larger, seeing her children (ages 7 and 3) become professionals, and enjoying all the things she never had.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Evangelina; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y  tiene 2 Hijos; La socia tiene terrenos donde cultiva maíz, papa y alfalfa y también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos y los vende en las diferentes ferias que se realiza en el distrito de Calca, la socia quiere mejorar el terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos y fertilizantes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Evangelina, 45, is married and has two children. She’s a member of the “CAPAC QOYA” communal bank located in Coya district, Calca province, Cusco department. She has fields where she grows corn, potato and alfalfa. She also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs that she sells at the various markets that take place in Calca district. She’d like to improve her fields so is asking for funds to buy manure and fertilizers. She is grateful to all those who are part of this dream by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Eon

texts.en: The person in the photo is Mrs. Eon R., age 31, who has been spending her life cultivating crops. Eon R. has known this skill since she was single. She is now married and has three young kids. Two of her kids are enrolled in school and the other one stays at home. Eon R. also receives help from her husband who works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. Eon R. desires to plant potatoes and peanut crops on her own farmland during this approaching farming season and is asking for a loan to be used to purchase items such as fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds to begin growing.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds to begin growing.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda P. is a married woman who lives in Masulog, Brgy. Basak, Lapu Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a restaurant and a sari-sari (general store). Her husband, Florencio P. Jr, who is 45 years old, helps his wife run the businesses. They have two children who are 12 and 18 years old and both are currently going to school. Imelda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Imelda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 4,800 PHP, thus improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP which she intends to use to purchase raw materials so that she can continue to save up for future house repair, her children's education and for the business. Imelda P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Beberly

texts.en:
Beberly A. is from the village of Mapulog, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Beberly owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs and chickens for sale. Beberly has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Beberly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Beberly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Nhean's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of nine members and is located in Preaek Bak village in Kandal province. Mrs.Nhean N., 63 years old, is the village bank president, having been selected by the members of the village loan. Each member of this village bank loan will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.

N. and her husband, Mr. Kim Ngoun, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate peanuts and corn for a living. They face a problem with the farm because they do not have enough money to support it. Thus, N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine to pump water and fertilizer to cultivate rice. This couple has five children: four are farmers and the other is a student.

loans.use: To buy a water machine to pump water and fertilizer to cultivate rice

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian wants to buy cooking fat, wheat flour, sugar and charcoal and thus she is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000. She operates "Mama Mandazi" stall where she makes and sells mandazi (doughnuts). She has been in this good business for 12 years and hopes to own a shop in five years. She has a desire to buy a piece of land in future. Lilian is married and the mother of two adults.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, wheat flour, sugar and charcoal

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is a housewife who stays at home and attends to her household responsibilities. She is a very dependable lady and knows her responsibilities as a mother and a wife very well. 

She is a resident of Multan, which is a historic city located in Punjab province of Pakistan. She lives in the area named Islampura, with her family, in a 2-room brick house. She moved here 16 years ago. Shameem has a son and 2 daughters.  Two of them are in school. The youngest daughter, who is just 4 years of age, has not yet started to attend school.

Shameem is married to M. A., who drives a [motorcycle-powered] rickshaw. He provides transport services to his passengers within the city. He also provides pick up and drop off services for school children. 

Shameem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to repair his rickshaw. His rickshaw is unreliable and doesn’t run for long hours, which is affecting his income. With a fully repaired rickshaw, he will be able to do his work more efficiently and make more money. 

Shameem is hopeful that a loan investment will be profitable for her husband and it will result in good profits for him. This is her first loan application.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil, peppers, onions, tomatoes, rice etc

loans.name: Floramie

texts.en: Floramie T. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Bungtod, Brgy. Manlayao, Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: pig fattening, a general store and Jeepney transportation. Her husband, Arsenio T. Jr., who is 41 years old, works as a Jeepney driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children, who are 14 and 18 years old. Floramie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Floramie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loans from NWTF helped her increase their family's monthly income to 30,800 Philippines pesos (PHP), uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her various business activities so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family and to save up to increase her working capital for future business expansion. Floramie T. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Melvy

texts.es: La señora Melvy nacida en la Guardia el 3 de enero, casada y con 3 hijos,  su esposo es contratista de albañil actividad donde le va muy bien ya que muchos contratos por su responsabilidad y la señora Melvy trabaja en la agricultura con peones para la siembra de maíz, arroz, yuca también se dedica a la compra y venta de cítrico como decir naranja, achachairu. Ella trabaja en Sombrerito tiene su parcela de su padre ellos no usaban la tierra y como ellos no lo trabajan ella aprovecho la oportunidad para trabajar en esas tierras, después comercializan sus productos en el mercado de el Torno, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para la compra de semillas y también para el pago a los peones por el trabajo de preparado de la tierras, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs Melvy, was born in La Guardia on January 3rd. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a building contractor, and it is going very well for him, as he has many contracts due to his responsibility. Mrs Melvy works in agriculture with farmhands, sowing corn, rice and yucca. She also buys and sells citrus fruits such as oranges and  achachairu. She works in Sombrerito. She has a plot of land from her parents, which they were not using--so she took advantage of the opportunity to work these lands. She sells her products in the El Torno market. She will use the money from this loan for the purchase of seeds and also to pay the workers for their work preparing the land. She is a very hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: for the sowing of rice

loans.name: Jose Hernaides

texts.es:
José, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hija de 4 años de edad, él se dedica a la venta y reparación de celulares y accesorios, trabajaba junto a un amigo en esta área lo que le permitió aprender e instalar su propio negocio que tiene ya 6 años de existir.
Por el momento su dificultad es la falta de accesorios para celulares por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión ayudando así a fortalecer el inventario de artículos y ofreciendo a los clientes una variedad productos.
El aspira algún día tener un puesto adecuado y propio, poder independizarse de los prestamos produciendo de sus mismas ganancias para progresar en esta actividad.
texts.en: José is 25 years old and lives in the city of San Miguel with his wife and 4-year-old daughter. He makes a living selling and repairing cellular phones and accessories. He worked along with a friend in the area, which allowed him to learn and set up his own business, which he has now had for six years. At the moment, he is lacking cell phone accessories, and he is requesting the loan so he can invest in strengthening his inventory and offering his customers a variety of products. He hopes one day to have a fit and proper sales post so he can become independent from the loan cycles and rely on his own earnings to keep progressing in this activity.

loans.use: Purchase cell phone accessories

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a charcoal selling business.  She sells at home to her neighbours and passersby. Rachel faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open more businesses in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Oslob, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating a fish vending business.  Her husband Quirico, who is 45 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 7 to 21 years old. Rosario joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosario has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 26,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 22,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,000 to use as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Rosario L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional working capital for fish vending

loans.name: Luz Aidee

texts.es:
la señora Luz Aidee S. es una mujer luchadora que se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tambien hace trabajos como modista, distribuye sus tortillas en la colonia en donde vive, todos los dias se levanta muy temprano 
para empezar su produccion y asi satifacer la demanda de todos sus clientes.
el trabajo de modista lo realiza por las tardes y noches.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Aidee S. is a defiant woman whose occupation is the sale of tortillas and she also creates fashion clothing. She distributes her tortillas in the colony where she lives. She starts her days very early in order to start producing and to satisfy the demands of all of her clients.

She carries out her seamstress business in the afternoons and in the evenings.

The loan will be used to purchase ingredients to make tortillas. Her goal is to make her business grow and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, lime, and water

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a young woman from Gaza City in Gaza Strip. Samar and her husband are the parents of three daughters and one son. Samar's husband runs a barber shop, which he started seven years ago. She took out a loan as her husband needed to buy a neck and shoulder massage machine to attract more customers to his shop 

Samar is a conservative woman (as are most of Gaza inhabitants); therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase a neck and shoulder massage machine.

loans.name: Trabajando Unidas Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “TRABAJANDO UNIDAS”

Lucia como toda madre es una muy trabajadora, años atrás cuando sus hijos aun eran pequeños ella se esforzó para darle lo mejor que pudo, darle educación y comodidades, ella se dedicaba a la venta de comida cerca de su casa, todos los días iba al mercado a buscar los insumos para su menú del día, en la actualidad ella también se dedica a la venta de comida y a la vez también a la venta de pollos los cuales cría en el segundo piso de su casa y los vende a modo de pedidos de sus clientes ya conocidos, ella solicita el préstamo para hacer la compra de sus insumos al por mayor, y con el ahorro de ello podrá comprar alimento para sus pollos.
Lucia pertenece a la alcancía comunal “TRABAJANDO UNIDAS”, que se caracterizan por ser responsables, todos ellos se conocen ya que son vecinos desde muchos años atrás, cada una en sus respectivas familias han dado lo mejor di, y en su mayoría ellos sueñan con cumplir con sus hijos y hacer que sus negocios sean duraderos y rentables.
texts.en:
"Trabajando Unidas" ["Working Together"] Community Bank

Lucia, like all mothers, is very hard-working. Years ago, when her children were small, she worked hard to give them the best that she could- to give them an education and comforts. She sold food near her home, and would go to the market every day to look for items for her daily menu. Now, she sells food, as well as chickens that she raises in the second floor of her home. She sells them on order to her customers and acquaintances. She is requesting this loan for the wholesale purchase of basic materials, and with her savings she will be able to buy food for her chickens.

Lucia belongs to the "Trabajando Unidas" ["Working Together"] community bank. They are responsible people, all of whom know each other since they have been neighbours for several years. Each one has given the best of herself to her family, and the majority of them dream of seeing their children grow up and having long-lasting and profitable businesses.

loans.use: to purchase items for selling food; the purchase of rice, mixed vegetables, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita Lama (Shakya) lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two sons. Her husband's name is Rajesh Shakya. He went to Dubai a few years ago for work. Her older son is studying in class 6 and her younger son is in primary school. 

Anita Lama opened her gift shop four years ago in the village of Khogana Dobata, intending to raise the living standard of her family. She sells various types of gift and decorative items in her shop. 

In Nepal the demand for gift items is increasing constantly because Nepal is very rich in its festivals. So to meet the demand of the customers, Mrs. Anita Lama is requesting a loan in the amount of  25,000 NPR to buy various types of gift items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy decorative goods for resale.

loans.name: Digna Emerita

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del poblado de Telica , es casada tiene 2 hijos los que estudian en las universidades de león,  actualmente esta laborando en el centro de salud de telica, desde hace 4 años anteriormente laboraba en el hospital de león, su profesión es licenciada en enfermería, y se desempeña como enfermera General, es el primer financiamiento que obtiene con la empresa y es atravez del convenio firmado con dicho centro de salud, el financiamiento lo requiere para construcción de cuarto ya que ha venido construyendo con sus esfuerzos propios y con el financiamiento acelerara el proceso para tener mejores condiciones y nivel de vida
texts.en: She is originally from the community of Telica. She is married and she has 2 children. They attend the universities in Leon. She currently works in Telica's healthcare center. She has been working at the hospital in Leon for the past 4 years. By profession she is a licensed nurse and she works as the head nurse. This is the first loan she acquires with the organization and it is facilitated by the health care center. She requires the loan to finish building a room, one that she has been building with her own resources. The loan will accelerate the process to improve her situation and her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc, flooring, and doors.

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi has operated a Kikoi's sales business for the past two years. She sells her wares from home to her neighbours and passers-by. The primary business challenge she faces is seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Nazi and her husband have four children, all of whom attend school. The family owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

With the Kshs 30,000 loan she has requested, she wants to purchase bundles of leso’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of leso’s to offer for sale

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with six children, 2 of whom attend school while 4 have already graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, Nyamvula has operated a charcoal sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.  Her greatest challenge is seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Nyamvula plans to use this KES 80,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is 35 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason. She is married, has two children and makes a living catching and selling fish. She has been doing this for the last six years and is applying for this loan to buy equipment such as hooks and nets. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 3 5 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  OUELENI FIEBALA, un des villages de la commune de KAI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec FANTA 2ème à droite position debout.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 2hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de LOULOUNI et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group KOTOGNOGONTALA I are married women who average 35 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in OUELENI FIEBALA, a village in the Commune of KAI, in the sub-prefecture of LOULOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the off-season. The group members are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loans have been properly repaid.

The crop grown is: peanuts.  Such is the case with FANTA, who is standing second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing and to buy farm inputs and seeds for maintaining:  2 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold in villages, at the markets of LOULOUNI and SIKASSO, to a customer base composed of women and men.


FANTA plans on making an average profit of 165,500 francs CFA per planting. The profits will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

She would like to keep up this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make use of a larger arable plot, so she can derive better gains.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Trob

texts.en: Trob, 33, is an animal seller. Her husband works in SIMAX organization. Their income is $7 per day. They have 4 children, three of whom are studying. Every month she has to spend $37.5 on food, $10 on electricity and $12 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy pigs and pigfeed. Previously she was a cake seller but her income was not enough to support her. Therefore, she changed to raising animals because she saw other people doing this and earning a good income. She tries to follow this example and also become successful in this career. In the future she plans to raise more pigs and other animals to sell so that she can support all her children through university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy pigs to feed for selling

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is a responsible father who is doing his best to give his family a comfortable life. He raises hogs to earn extra income. He is 52 years old, married, and has six adult children. He has worked as a farmer for almost 38 years, earning an average net profit of 9,000 PHP per month. 

He is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy piglets, feed, and materials to repair his piggery. He hopes to grow his businesses well to eventually proviD. a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and materials to repair his piggery.

loans.name: Mwanza

texts.en:
Mwanza is a married man with thirteen children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 40,000, Mwanza wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: buy flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en: Munhtsetseg is 46 years old and lives with her 4 children and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. Two of her children are college students and one is a high school student. The other daughter works at the power station in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is on a disability pension. She started to sell spare parts at the local market in 1989. She has many regular clients and is very experienced in her field. With the profits from her business, she pays for her children's college tuition fees. She is planning to build a house. She is a diligent woman who is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase stock of spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Naisiae

texts.en:
Naisiae, age 32, is married and has one child. She has been farming on her own piece of land for the last two years with a monthly profit margin of KES 5000. 

She learned about KADET from the KADET staff. She paid her previous loan well and is now applying for her third loan with KADET, which she will spend to purchase agricultural inputs.

She hopes to use the profit generated from the loan to expand her farming. She dreams of educating her children to a higher level. She is a hardworking woman who puts more efforts into her work.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Solidario Las Marias Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO LAS MARIAS
Las  integrantes de este grupo son mujeres negociantes casadas, ellas se dedican a la venta de ropa típica, doña Angélica Maria, líder de este grupo quien tiene en su domicilio taller de bordados en maquina industrial, produciendo así la elaboración de blusas, delantales, por mayor en diversos diseños y colores,  por lo que es la proveedora de la mercadería a doña María Vicenta y María Estela  quienes venden de manera ambulante en las aldeas de la localidad, doña Angélica fue de la idea de solicitar  un crédito para ayudar a sus compañeras en el negocios, por su parte ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de telas para la elavoracion de delantales y blusas cada una tiene diversas metas y sueños laborales y familiares.
texts.en:
The members of this group are married businesswomen. They sell traditional clothing.

Doña Angélica Maria, the leader of the group, has an embroidery workshop in her home and works with an industrial machine. She produces large quantities of blouses and aprons in different designs and colors, thereby making her a supplier of these goods.

Doña María Vicenta and María Estela are street merchants who sell in the neighborhoods of their town.

Doña Angélica came up with the idea of requesting a loan in order to help her fellow group members with their businesses. For her part, Angélica is requesting a loan to buy fabrics for making aprons and blouses. Each day she has different goals and dreams for her work and her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for making aprons and blouses.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar, de 37 años es un responsable padre de familia. Vive en compañía de Hilda, su esposa desde hace 6 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Brian, Brandy y Jhon; a los que alimenta y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa Santa María. Hace 10 años comenzó a trabajar para el futuro de su familia. La siembra de café, plátanos y achiote son sus principales cultivos y medio de sustento económico; en todo este tiempo logró adquirir gracias a su esfuerzo 5 hectáreas de terreno agrícola. Pero la falta de capital de trabajo, hace que solo siembre en 3 de ellos. A pesar de su limitación no se desanima, al contrario lo incentiva a trabajar con mayor empeño para concretar su objetivo. Pues desea incrementar su producción, ahora tiene un vivero con 4 mil plantitas de café, los cuales piensa sembrar a fines de año y así comenzar a producir en mayor cantidad. Ya que tiene buenos clientes en la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde vende su producción y espera poder seguir brindándole un buen grano de café y achiote para el futuro. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los amigos cafetaleros” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Edgar de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para la limpieza de sus cafetales, asimismo comprará sacos de fertilizantes naturales para fertilizar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Edgar, 37, is a responsible father.  He lives with Hilda, his wife of six years.  Together they have three children: Brian, Brandy, and Jhon, whom they nurture and raise in their own house, located in the native community of Santa María.

Ten years ago he began to work for his family's future.  Coffee, bananas, and annatto are his principal crops and means of economic support.  In all this time, thanks to his effort he has managed to acquire five hectares of agricultural lands, but lacking working capital, he has only been able to work three of them.  Despite this limitation he is not discouraged; on the contrary, it gives him the incentive to work with greater determination to realize his goal.

Because he wants to increase his production, now he has a nursery with four thousand little coffee plants, which he plans to plant at the end of the year and so begin to produce in greater quantities.  Since he has good customers in the city of Pichanaki, where he sells his products, he hopes to be able to continue offering them a good coffee bean and annatto in the future.

He belongs to the Los Amigos Cafetaleros communal bank, and this is his second loan with MFP.  He hopes for the support of all of you to continue with his goals.  In addition, he promises to be punctual with his payments.

If he receives your support, he will use the requested money to buy tools for clearing his coffee plantations, and he will also buy sacks of natural fertilizers to fertilize his crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers and tools to clear his coffee plantations.

loans.name: Dorren May

texts.en:
Dorren May is widowed with four children. She is 40 years old and lives in Kauswagan, Plaridel.

To earn a living, Dorren May works abroad as a caregiver. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 20000. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to use for the payment of placement fees abroad. Dorren May has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: To use for the payment of placement fees abroad

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Purevsuren is a loving mother who lives with her husband and four kids in an apartment in the Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver, her elder two children are college students in the capital city of Mongolia, and her younger two children are school students. She runs an internet cafe business. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to replace the heating system of her work environment. She is requesting 500,000 MNT to replace the heating system. She is a sharp and diligent woman who says, "It is hard to handle two kids college fees, however, I will not step back and I will not rest until my youngest kid graduates college."

loans.use: to replace a heating system.

loans.name: Floresmina

texts.es: Floresmina, D. 48 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, es viuda desD. hace varios años, es madre D. cuatro hijos D. los cuales dos ya son mayores e iniciaron su familia propia, mientras que dos aún viven junto a ella a quienes brinda educación y alimentación. Tiene una casa propia en donD. cría a dos nietos que por diversos motivos no pueden estar con sus padres. EL trabajo D. Floresmina, consiste en la venta D. comida, ella a diario sale a la vereda D. su casa por las noches, pero desD. temprano se va al mercado en donD. hace sus respectivas compras para que por las tardes pueda preparar y salir a vender por las noches. Al principio le fue muy difícil iniciarse en este trabajo, que lleva realizando un par D. años, ella nunca antes se habia dedicado a este tipo D. actividad, ahora está muy orgullosa D. lo que hace ya que sus clientes le retribuyen con muchos halagos a sus deliciosos platos que prepara. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que tiene mucho tiempo para poder dedicar a sus nietos y brindarles los cuidados necesarios, además el flujo D. dinero es diario y es bueno tener ingresos, menciona. Le esta yendo muy bien, tiene muchos buenos clientes y espera poder mantenerse en ese ritmo ya que le es D. mucha ayuda los ingresos que percibe. Este será su crédito número 6 con la institución MFP, esta a la expectativa D. que le den el apoyo necesario D. un préstamo para así poder cumplir con sus objetivos, además se compromete en pagar D. manera puntual sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará algunos ingredientes e insumos para tenerlos en cantidad ya que D. esa manera podrá obtener productos a menor precio y así obtener mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Floresmina is 48, and she is a good, kind, and hard-working woman. She has been a widow for several years, and is the mother of four children, two are now adults and have started their own families, while two still live with her, and she provides them with schooling and meals.

She has her own house, where she is raising two grandchildren who for various reasons cannot be with their parents. Floresmina sells food.  Every day in the evenings she goes out on the sidewalk in front of her house.  But early in the day she goes to the market, where she makes her purchases so that she can prepare food in the afternoon, and go out and sell it in the evenings.   

In the beginning, it was very difficult for her to get started in this work, that she has now been doing for a couple of years. She had never done this type of work before, but now she is very proud of what she does, and her customers repay her with many words of praise for the delicious dishes that she prepares.

What she likes about her work is that she is able to devote a lot of time to her grandchildren, and proviD. them with the care they need. In addition, she has a daily cash flow, and she comments that it is good to have an income.

It's going very well for her. She has a lot of good customers, and she hopes to be able to keep going at that rate, as the income she earns is a big help to her. 

This will be her sixth loan with MFP. She is waiting for them to give her the needed loan support, to enable her to meet her objectives. In addition, she is committed to making her instalment payments on time. 

With the amount applied for she will buy a few ingredients and supplies in bulk, as that way, she will be able to obtain better products for less money, and thereby increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for preparing meals.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is single. She describes herself as optimistic. She has been running a general store for the last six years. The business is faced with the challenge of increased price of goods. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to add  to her stock of household necessities. In the future, Teresia looks forward to expanding her business.

loans.use: To add to her stock of household necessities.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Desde hace mas de 8 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella siempre ha sido una persona responsable y que disfruta de proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Ella inicio por medio de sus hijas buscando un medio de vida para sufragar los gastos del hogar, ella sale a vender todos los días de manera ambulante, con el propósito de lograr mejorar la condición económica de su familia. El crédito es para la compra de bolsos, cremas, calzado, prendas de oro laminado, plata y ropa en general.
texts.en: Rosa María sells general merchandise. This has been her livelihood for over 8 years. She has always been a responsible person who enjoys providing her family with the income it needs. For the sake of her daughters, she started looking for a job to defray their household expenses. Now Rosa goes out every day, selling in an ambulatory manner, in order to improve her family's economic condition. This loan is to buy bags, creams, shoes, gold-plated and silver items, and clothing in general.

loans.use: to buy bags, creams, shoes, gold-plated and silver items, and clothing

loans.name: Ana Rosalia

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana es socia del banco comunal Despertar, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que desde 1999 es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy hábil con sus manos y el arte de la joyería tiene vida propia, la gastronomía variada cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

La Señora. Ana tiene 26 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 6, 4 años  y un bebe de 4 meses, dos de sus hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que habita es de su suegra con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña Ana labora como secretaria de una cooperativa de taxi de la ciudad, actividad que la realiza hace 2 años en turnos rotativos. En sus tiempos libres trabaja en la venta de cosméticos por catalogo de varias marcas, en esta actividad  lleva 3 años.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su décimo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos, perfumes y cremas para implementar sus productos.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the “Despertad” (Awaken) communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that since 1999 has been a cultural heritage of humanity.  Its people are very skilled with their hands and the art of jewelry making has a life of its own; cuisine is varied and enchants the palates of visitors.  Its residents maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Ana, 26, is married and has had three children who are 6 and 4 years old and a baby that’s 4 months old.  Two of her children attend the local elementary school.  Her husband works as a private employee.  The house she lives in is her mother-in-law’s and they share household expenses with her.

Ana is employed as a secretary at one of the city’s taxi cooperatives, a job she’s had for two years and in rotating shifts.  In her free time she works selling cosmetics of various brands via catalogue; she’s been in this business three years.

She’s in her 10th loan with the communal bank and she will use it to buy cosmetics, perfumes and creams to stock up on her products.  Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Elizabeth Sarahi

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 38 años de edad, vive en Villanueva Cortes, con su hijo de 14 años de edad, quien actualmente estudia, ella es madre soltera y para obtener ingresos se a dedicado a la venta de ropa para damas, zapatos, lociones  y cosméticos. Tiene dos años de hacer esta actividad. Comenzó vendiendo solo ropa, poco a poco los clientes le han pedido zapatos, lociones, cosméticos y otros. Ha solicitado este préstamo para surtir de más productos y cumplir con los pedidos que le han hecho de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos. Su meta es aumentar sus ventas y atender bien a sus clientes.
texts.en: Elizabeth, 38, lives in Villanueva, Cortes, with her 14-year-old son who currently is attending school.  She’s a single mother who in order to earn income sells women’s clothes, shoes, lotions and cosmetics.  She’s been in this line of work for two years.  She started out selling only clothes but her customers gradually requested shoes, lotions, cosmetics and others from her.  She has requested this loan to stock up on merchandise and to fill pending orders for clothes, shoes and cosmetics.  Her goal is to increase sales and provide good customer service.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio de ropa, zapatos y cosmeticos para la venta.

loans.name: Sulayman

texts.ru: Сулайман житель района А. Джоми. Ему 61 год. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en:
Sulayman is a resident of the region A. Jomi. He is 61 years old and married. He has four children. He earns money by breeding cattle. 

Sulayman takes a loan for the purchase of steers.

loans.use: to purchase steers

loans.name: Cristituta

texts.en:
Cristituta is 41 years old and is a married woman with a 22-year-old child. Her husband works as a carpenter and fisherman.

Cristituta has been selling fish for 15 years. She buys from fishermen at her town and sells fish at the market. Cristituta also supports her husband in selling his catch. Cristituta works hard to improve her family's quality of living.

Cristituta has requested this loan to buy ice boxes and fishing materials such as nets, hooks and baits. She hopes for this loan to help improve their business.

loans.use: to buy ice boxes and fishing materials such as nets, hooks and baits.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Caridad works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Caridad is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Caridad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Holiyor

texts.ru:
Холиер жизнерадостный мужчина 29 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Холиер живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он очень позитивный молодой человек. Холиер старается во всем видеть хорошую сторону. 
Холиер любит, разводить, и ухаживать за крупнорогатым скотом. Он покупает на базаре скот, потом откармливает его и перепродает. Жена Холиер всегда помогает ему в этом. Полученное молоко они продают своим соседям. Соседи с удовольствием покупают у семьи Холиер молоко, потому что продаваемое ими молоко всегда свежие.  Вот уже год Холиер занимается этим делом, от этого дела он получает хороший стабильный доход.
В данный момент Холиер хочет приобрести корм для скота на зиму, для этого ему нужны денежные средства.
Он заранее благодарить «Арванд» за предоставленную помощь и надеется положительный результат.

loans.use: for the purchase of livestock feed

loans.name: Akporawo

texts.en: A 40 years old experience trader, Mr. Akporawo E. makes provision available for people in her environment. To meet the demand of her customers, he needs $400

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to pay for the school fees for her children

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is 27 years old. She is married to T., a day laborer, who is 29 years old. She has a son who is 4 years old. Additionally, she must support her two younger sisters. One sister has a foot injury, and the other is a student in the third grade. Hanh sells vegetables. Their income is $9 per person/month. Hanh hopes to receive a loan of $75 to purchase vegetables to sell. She will repay monthly.

loans.use: To purchase  vegetables to sell

loans.name: Floridalma

texts.en:
Floridalma Martínez, 39, has a business selling fresh raw chicken in the local market. Her store "Pollería Mary" is a simple stall with a concrete table, a cutting board, a knife, and the chicken she has prepared for sale. She sells between 75 and 150 pounds of chicken in an average day, buying about about 7 Quetzales per pound and selling at 8 or 8.5 Quetzales per pound, so she can net perhaps 100 Quetzales, or US$13, on an average day. She also does some catalog sales, with products like Avon. She has a nice niche – the women of the town come to buy their chicken and may also order some cosmetics or other products.

Flori's stall is quite dark, and she doesn't have a front to it, just the one table. She really wants to put in her own electric light and put a front on the stall.

Flori is married and has four children. Keeping her kids in school is the motivation for her business. Since the schools require the children to buy uniforms and school supplies, her four kids put a significant strain on the cash flow. They even hope to buy a computer at some point so they don't have to pay so much for computer and internet rental for the kids' studies.

Written by Nancy Lewis, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: Purchase chicken for resale

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old. He has 3 children, and two of them are in school. He has a general store in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new ice box and more goods for the shop to increase his income and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: To purchase new ice box and more goods

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Sra. Jenny belongs to the "Las Azucenas" (The Lillies) community bank in Peru's Ucayali region or "departamento", where she lives. She is 45 years old, separated from her husband and the mother of two children. She started her business with her mother but subsequently decided to strike out on her own.

She now relies on a drinks and food business. With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,300 (1,300 Peruvian soles or about US$433), to be repaid in 4 months, she'll be able to expand her shop and buy more drinks to stock her business.

Jenny is pleased that she's been able, along with her kids, to get ahead and to show everyone that she's an enterprising business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Jenny pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Azucenas” vive en el Jr Mariano Melgar 132 AA.HH - Ucayali del Distrito de Yarinacocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Está separa de su esposo, tiene 45 años y es madre de dos hijos. Se inició en el negocio con su mamá, posteriormente ella decidió independizarse.

Actualmente cuenta con un negocio de venta de bebidas y comida rápida, con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/1,300.00 soles ($ 433), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, podrá ampliar su local y comprara más bebidas para surtir su negocio

Jenny se siente satisfecha de poder salir adelante conjuntamente con sus hijos, y así demostrar a otras personas que es una mujer emprendedora de negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Yati

texts.en: Yati is 23 years old and has a 6 year old child. She raises chickens  at her home.  She sells them every three months and earns US$25. Her husband, W., is a driver who earns US$1.5 per day. She is requesting a loan to expand her business and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ishnazarova

texts.en:
Ishnazarova S. lives in Nausky rayon; she is married and has 3 children.  She has been an active client of MicroiInvest since 2006 and she recommended herself as an executive and reliable client who trusts the MicroiInvest loan procedures.

She trades in the bazaar where her trade outlet is located.  She is engaged in the special material for the national dress selling industry.  She is very experienced in this business (about 30 years).  She works with a straight supplier, which is why the prices for her goods are lower than the bazaar prices. 

Working in the bazaar she meets stiff competition and wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods to attract more repeat customers.  It permits her to realize new business plans and to develop the existing business.  Now Mrs. Ishnazarova requests the loan of $925 to widen the existing assortment and to develop the existing business.

loans.use: to widen the existing assortment and to develop the existing business.

loans.name: Arubaine 1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Halima S.. She is currently in the business of used clothing and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Halima is 21 years old and is married with one son aged 2. Halima makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to join up her profits with her husband's income so they can buy a piece of land. Halima has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Halima is joined in her small group by Mary Nadugwa, Zula N., Zam G., and Nalongo O.. Mary Nadugwa has a business in charcoal sales and wants to increase stock. Zula N. is currently operating a business in selling charcoal and wants a loan to add in business. Zam G. operates a retail shop and wants to increase stock. Nalongo O. is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to add in the retail business.

loans.use: To expand clothes business

loans.name: Busanzi South C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Linda K.. She is currently in the business of selling produce and is requesting a loan to add more capital. Linda is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant farmer for work. She has 4 children ranging from age 5 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Linda makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business. Linda has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Kinda is joined in her small group by Racheal K., Getrude N., Judith B., and Fida A.. Racheal K. has a business running a clinic and wants to purchase more drugs. Getrude N. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to stock more clothes. Judith B. operates a retail shop business and wants to add more stock. Fida A. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to uplift the business.

loans.use: To improve the quality and quantity of produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase porcelain items

loans.name: Khadija's Ngarambe Group

texts.en:
Proscovia is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 7 years old. Proscovia owns a small salon, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

In the past, Proscovia has taken out and successfully repaid 2 loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Khadija and Mariam, who sell clothing.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for her business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 39 years old and a mother with three children. Two of her children are in school now. Eva loves children so much that she now sells babies’ products like diapers, Pampers, cloths, soaps, creams, washing pans and bowls in the local market.

Eva wants to use this loan to buy more products to increase her inventory and sales as the demand for the products are high. She is a member of the group called God With Us. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more babies’ cloths and products

loans.name: Neourn

texts.en: Mrs. Neourn E. is a farmer in Trapaing Skun Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Pheap Choch, is a construction worker who also assists her on the farm. They have four children, three of whom are enrolled in school while the youngest one is of preschool age. Mrs. Neourn E. cannot support her family well because she and her husband earn only a small income, so she is requesting a loan to buy a cow and start a breeding business in order to improve her family’s living conditions. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow and start a breeding business in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Abror

texts.en: K. Abror has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2007. He first applied for a business development loan after seeing his brother improve his business after receiving MicroInvest loans. K. Abror applied and received a loan to purchase pedigree bulls. Mr. K. Abror sold the bulls and with the profits he purchased new pedigree livestock from neighboring Kyrgyzstan. He dreams of having a big livestock farm so he would like to increase his amount of livestock and build a big cowshed. Mr. K. Abror applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 3100 STJ for 6 months and thanks KIVA for its grateful support.

loans.use: To increase his livestock numbers and build a cowshed

loans.name: Oeut

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeut K., who is 45 years old, sells groceries from her house; her husband, Mr. Lam Ron, is construction worker who typically earns around US $5 per day. Oeut sells a variety of products and has been selling groceries since 2007; she earns around US $4 per day. She lives with her husband and three children in the Kantreang Commune in the Siem Reap Province. One of her children is employed in a hotel and earns US $100 per month; with this, he can help support the family. The two other children live at home.

Oeut needs capital to expand her grocery inventory in order to increase her family's income. Hence, she decided to request a loan of US $1000 to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries for sale

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen I. is 34 years old and married with one child. She sells soft drinks, a business she has been operating  for a long time. In order to increase her stock and number of customers, she is in need of the loan amount of $425 to buy more drinks to sell. In the future she hopes to be a major distributor of drinks. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Kuy
